reviews.content: Behold, children, if you dare, Manos the Hands of Fate. The literal brainchild of star, director, writer, producer and crap-salesman Harold P. Warren, this is the Necronomicon of modern film; as you view it, your sanity is slowly nibbled away. It would seem given the experience of the crew, one shouldn't bash this film so badly. Wrong. A 10 year old could make a marginally better film than this stillborn brainchild of a fertilizer salesman. The characters and settings are so clichéd one of the only original things about this movie is it features a mini documentary of various bean fields and hills hosted by an Alto who sounds as if she's in extreme pain. Tor-goat seems like a bum they pulled out of the streets and slapped prosthetics onto. The "wonderful" subplot of him being a Satyr is killed by a deadly team of bad camera-work and sloppy writing. To those not in the know, he's just a creepy beard-man in serious need of more comfortable kneepads. He and the master's "eerie" presence is denoted by "eerie-er" free-style jazz that sounds like something Charlie parker threw up, Tito Puente cooked and Kenny G garnished and ate. No, that applies to the rest of the movie. It's just so mind-bogglingly bad that it's impossible to watch without heckling it. Probably the best way to watch this is with the help of Joel Hogsdon, Kevin Murphy, and Trace Beaulieu in the MST3K version.

Torgo really made an impact on me in this film: every night, visions of his grossly deformed knees haunt my dreams. i put this film on the short list of the five scariest things i have ever seen. Torgo's death scene was positively terrifying...those women mussed his hair but good. And the final shot of the painting! My skin is still crawling, although that might be because I haven't eaten in weeks. I cried when the dog died, but then the dad said there never was a dog, so I was ok again. And I love the soundtrack: forget "O Brother..." and buy "Manos: music from and inspired by the movie."   Torgo, if you're reading this, I feel bad for what they did to you. All you did was look after the place while the master was away.

Manos The Han... (be right back.)This movie is probably... (wait a minute...)Sorry. There is no way I can even think about this movie without retching my guts out until I'm spewing blood. It IS that bad. Consider the worst possible torture you can imagine (red-hot rods inserted in various orofices of your body; being slowly eaten alive by small, poisonous insects; having to spend a night with Hillary Clinton, well, you get the idea) put them all together, multiply them thousandfold, and that is STILL less than 1% of the anguish you will suffer at the "hands" of this effluvia. When Joel and the 'bots cannot wring humor from something, then you know it's a lost cause.There are simply no words to defame this movie any more than the simple watching. By comparison, Gigli is on par with "The Godfather" as high drama.

reviews.review_title: The Weird, Static, Horror Movie As Comedy
reviews.content: I feel a little conflicted here. Manos is utter trash. It is ineptly made, badly acted, horribly scripted (scripted ?). If I could I'd give the movie two ratings, one--1--from what my logic and better sense tells me (it's crap), and another rating--say around 6 or 7--simply because I was entertained, I would.There are things I find frustrating, yet humorous about Manos: How all the actors seem to wait a full minute or two before saying their lines, as if waiting for some cue; the odd repetition of dialog like something out of the nightmares of Samuel Beckett (but done unintentionally, it seems); the sheer lack of anything resembling narrative consistency or internal logic.Make no mistake, this is a bad, bad, movie. But some movie masochists out there may find this entertaining. Hell, at least it's more creative than Bloodrayne.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the most unpleasant movie ever made
reviews.content: I just saw this again recently, and I can't believe that it's voted as high as it is.  This movie has the rare distinction of being both creepy and dull at the same time.  This movie is so unpleasant to sit through, you almost feel a malignant hate for you on the part of the crew.

reviews.review_title: Bad, but I kinda enjoy it.
reviews.content: Where to begin... By luck (?) I have this movie both MSTed and UN MSTed. I rarely watch it without the Mystery Science Theater 3000 treatment, as its even worse without the comments. There is one scene in the UN-MSTED version that actually has The Master slapping one of his brides to death (with a bit of blood). This scene would be the sole reason to watch the UNMSTed version.Anyway, the movie is all about Torgo. He's the star / anti-hero of the whole thing. And I have to give John Reynolds (R. I. P.) credit. He really got into the role, going as far as making himself a rig that created the big knees (and in the UN-MSTED version, you get brief glimpses of the cloven hooves he attached to the rig. Really, Torgo is the ONLY reason to watch the movie. Well, that and if you want to see a complete train wreck of a movie.Hal P. Warren (R I P), the writer / director / producer / star / voice of all the males in this film is responsible for this train wreck. Its been told that the cast and crew are still owed money for their efforts in this film.The Mystery Science Theater 3000 "Amazing Colossal Episode Guide" was right when it said "Just ask yourself "What kind of movie would a fertilizer salesman from Texas make?" and you'd have "Manos""

I was disappointed everyone said this is unwatchable. One of the worst films ever made. I disagree. I've seen worst. A lot of Troma movies such as nuke 'em high 2 and 3 were much worst. I actually turned those off.What I didn't like about this movie. The soundtrack doesn't fit this movie at all. Tons of overdubs that made this film just lazy and look incomplete. The story can be explained in about 2 sentences how much "Depth" there is to it. The shots are poorly spliced together like something you'd see by a film student today who swears they can fix it in post production. The bad guy and his dog are about as intimidating as an old lady walking a kitten on a leash. What will I remember about this movie.. the sweet jacket. The only reason I'm putting a 10 star so a more deserving movie can have the honor of being the most worst movie ever made. Though calling this a movie is a bit of a stretch.

reviews.review_title: You can't get much worse than this.
reviews.content: Manos, Hands of Fate is even stranger than it sounds. It has no point except for the "surprise" ending, which is about as strange and poorly conceived as the rest of the movie. In this mess, a family is going on vacation and accidentally gets lost. Instead of continuing, they decide to stay on a farmhouse even though the housekeeper Torgo said they couldn't stay because the master wouldn't like it. It turns out this house is full of some weird, stupid secrets, like the master's wives who all sleep on a wooden stake. The main characters are idiots for staying at the house to begin with, and the daughter has a really annoying voice. The character of Torgo is another strange guy who is always repeating himself, which gets very repetitive. Another element that adds to the strangeness of the film is the weird jazz music playing nonstop. It is about the worst music to play during a movie like this, and I have no idea what made a composer come out with this. Overall, this is one of the worst movies of all time, and I wouldn't wish it upon my worst enemy.My rating: BOMB/****. 72 mins.

From the opening scene, ineptness jumps off the screen at you. The movie is hard to turn off, though, as the mind is soon numbed and goes into shock, making self-defensive actions impossible. Watching this movie, I found myself nostalgically longing for the crackling dialogue and directorial surehandedness of Ed Wood. At least his films looked and sounded something like movies. In the trivia section, it says this film was filmed over a period of two and a half months. It's hard to see how, since two and a half hours should have been sufficient to make this drivel, including writing the screenplay (both pages). The man responsible for Manos should have his testicles removed before he has a chance to reproduce.

Browsing through IMDB.com's worst movies and not sure exactly how fate put me in line with this gem.  Interestingly enough, I was telling a good musician friend of mine about the movie, which came out the year I was born. I asked him if he knew anything about it.  He sheepishly bowed his head and answered "I'm the one playing guitar in the soundtrack"I couldn't stop laughing.  It's a shame, if not obvious, that none of the cast did anything even remotely notable after this hit the market.  I do want to say at least mostly all the musicians involved are now successful professionals playing all over the country and professors in universities. I promised not to name any names.  To them my deep felt sympathies for being involved in this project, and also look on the bright side-at least it wasn't a porn loop you'd rather forget.

The worst, worst, worst, worst, worst movie ever made. Absolutely appalling. It's excruciatingly painful to watch. I've seen quite a few MST episodes, and many more stinkers besides that. Manos leaves them all in the dust. What a piece of dung. Plan 9 would win an Oscar compared to this trash. It really has to be seen to be believed, but you must do so at your own risk, and be sure to use Joel and the 'bots as a shield...I pity the poor souls that have been subjected to Manos in its full glory. MST can't even make it funny, it's beyond laughable. It's disturbingly awful. I wish I knew some more disparaging terms, I feel I'm letting it off easy. In case you haven't noticed, I did not like Manos, the Hands of Fate.

Manos: The Hands of Fate. What a f@cking horrible movie this is! The writing is atrocious, the direction goes nowhere and the actors just read the lines like they have no idea what the hell they're actually saying! Oh; and the 16mm-32-second-filming-camera REALLY shows when you watch the movie. The abrupt cuts, the ear-bleedingly-bad music, and the AWFUL white balancing makes this a TRUE pain to watch; unless you've seen the MST3K episode roasting the sh## out of this steaming turd from the past. Now THAT's the way you watch this movie: with deservedly deprecating commentary!There's nothing good about Manos: The Hands of Fate. EVERYTHING about it is horrible. And it's BORING on top of all the pre-determined awfulness! It's 1966's Battlefield Earth!Manos: The Bottom of the Cinematic Barrel! 0/10 (even though I rated it 1 because IMDb).

Wow, this is THE WORST MOVIE EVER, and I've seen some stinkers. Plan 9, Bride of the Monster, Troll 2 Oscar-winners all in comparison. The only reason Plan 9 won years ago is because even TV late late shows wouldn't show this stinker.I have never seen such atrocious acting. I think the best(?) are the interminable "dramatic" pauses and the glares between characters. I'm fairly certain that the script writers (if there actually were any) wrote about 11 minutes of dialog for an hour+ movie, hence the dramatic pauses as the actors probably didn't know what the phrase ad-lib meant. Definitely see the MST3K version, I've seen both and nearly had to gouge my eyes out after watching it without any comic relief. The end with the little girl becoming one of the Master's wives is highly disturbing, but I suppose the director thought that he should do something considering nothing else happened in the movie. Still, that was just wrong.

Many reviews have made this point, but this movie ranks as perhaps the worst movie ever made in the history of the universe. Many buffs rank Ed Wood's "Plan 9 From Outer Space" as the "worst of all time". Not even close. "Plan 9" is "Citizen Kane" compared to "Manos". It's "Casablanca" and "Wizard of Oz" rolled into one next to "Manos". But therein lies the wonder and the rub: Manos is so colossally awful that it transcends the notion of "movie" and takes on some sort of "Platonic Perfect Form" that defines "bad movie". Bless the actors and anyone else who collaborated on this abysmal piece of celluloid garbage, because it has provided us with MST3K's riff-rich snark that's as entertaining as the movie is horrible.

I've seen people disparage this movie because of the long, tedious, and unnecessary scenes of driving. Or because of the poor acting and random scenes involving two lovers in a car (which contribute nothing to the movie). But everyone is missing the point. This movie is about the character Torgo--the clumsy doorman of the hotel.Torgo is first introduced early in the movie as a suave and sexy advertisement model. He sells everything sexy from brandy to cologne to unmentionables. He was the heartthrob of a generation in his youth (from ages 18 to 24). Unfortunately, when he went through puberty at age 25, he developed what some doctors term "hoofmitus legeranius" which is characterized as "a person whose legs turn into a horse's hindquarters". His masculine face that beckoned people to "come hither" had transformed into one that said "I'm going to come hither to you! Rawr!" As a result of this radical transformation, Torgo had no choice but to seek council from the local cult. They told him that he must learn the ways of the world--that it is secretly run by a vampire man who keeps women as slaves in an abyss that exists somewhere in a hotel basement somewhere in a desert, which is also located in Indiana. Torgo is skeptical that this is the real world, but he has little choice. So he joins his friend.Hoping that his once good looks will be able to lure any unsuspecting guests of the hotel, he takes a post as a doorman. He eagerly greets all sorts of guests--those who got lost in the Indiana desert to... those who... well, that's really the only people who are ever able to find the hotel. For some reason, the guests are more repulsed and unsure of where they are when they see Torgo. But no matter, it is Torgo who will make sure that they are welcomed and have a relaxing time in the hotel.Anyways, as the movie progresses, you realize that maybe Torgo wasn't the primary character of the movie and maybe you missed the point of the movie and are completely confused by what in the heck is even happening.

After watching the "Lord of the Rings" trilogy and "The Godfather,"  films which are at the top of the list for "best movies ever," I  decided to learn more about "Manos: the Hands of Fate" just so that I  can say "been there, done that!" And boy, what an interesting story  there is for such a bizarre film: a fertilizer salesman, an occupation  most unlikely to produce a motion picture, showed a movie person that  "if Hollywood can make a great film, anyone can do it!" So, he and a  bunch of local stagehands and models went out and basically goofed off  for a couple of months on...remember those precursors to the camcorder  called home movie cameras? Well, that's the equipment used for filming  this craziness! And they never recorded sound at all, so the voices had  to be re-dubbed in, resulting in a dub even worse than a bad Asian  martial arts film. And the storyline and characters...very innovative!  Also, what's with the couple of characters having fears of stock  footage? I've never seen it, but if you've seen some of the best films  ever made and are a huge fanatic of movies or DVDs, then watch this  film. It may be bad, but at least you will have seen the top - and  bottom - of classic film-making!

...about how not to make a movie. Seriously. Don't write it, direct it, edit it, block it, or cast it like this. Don't use similar sets, costumes, or props. Don't use this type of camera, sound recording, or film stock. In fact, this movie is so educational, I consider it a classic. Should be shown the first week of film school to make students feel better about their initial efforts. I know that I hope and pray no one will ever see my first film, and it was still better than this.Even the MST3K guys had a hard time coming up with wisecracks. At least Plan 9 looked as though one or two adults held a camera. This one looks like some fifth graders went out and shot random footage, then cobbled it all together in an order that was meant to be coherent, but wasn't. Thank God I was born after this dreck was filmed, so my generation can't be held morally responsible.

Fertilizer salesman Harold P. Warren had a dream. He decided to invest $19.000 of his own money in making one of the scariest ever to hit the big screen. Except, Harold knew nothing about making movies, he had no professional actors and only had one hand-held camera that could film for only 32 seconds at a time. Without sound.It's the story about a family who get stranded in the middle of nowhere and look for help in an old scary house. The only one who's there to welcome them is the creepy servant Torgo. Before the night is over they find themselves at the mercy of The Master and his evil cult.Placed at a #4 spot on the IMDb bottom 100, this has got to be one of the worst movies of all time, right?I think it depends on how you define a bad movie. I've seen plenty of million dollar Hollywood movies that bored me to death. And Manos didn't. In fact, I loved it. Warren's pure lack of cinematic vision and experience is what gives this movie its unique atmosphere. The recurring library music, the choppy editing, the weird sound loops all contribute to the movie's surreal qualities. For instance the scene where Torgo (in my opinion, one of the most enigmatic heroes in B-movie history) tries to touch the face of Margaret goes on and on. In and out of focus. Nothing's really happening, but still you can't look away. It could have come straight out of a David Lynch movie. The fact that Warren probably didn't mean this scene to be weird and surreal doesn't mean that it's not working on a whole different level. It is what it is, intended or not.I've never seen the MST version and I'm not going to. It's like kicking a dog when it's already down. Watch the great documentary Hotel Torgo instead to learn something about the movie's interesting and often hilarious background. And watch the normal version of the film. You might see Harold P. Warren's dream of making his masterpiece. He invested his money, wrote a script and made his damn horror movie. He followed his passion and the fact that he failed completely is utterly irrelevant. 47 years later, people still watch it. They love it or hate it, but they'll never forget it. Now does that sound like one of the worst movies ever?

reviews.review_title: So bad, we should send some copies of it to Al-Quaeda, to lead them to surrender!
reviews.content: *Manos: The Hands Of Spoilers* After a long and pointless driving scene, three uninteresting characters (the best - the father - played by the 'director' of this 'film') end up in a weird place and what they do? They decide to stay the night, in another pointless scene! Then Torgo, the most involuntary comedic lackey ever (he's supposed to be a satyr, but looks like just another weirdo) begins to put the moves on the stupid mother. Bad choice... Then Manos and his harem come into the story, and... oh look! There is another pointless scene in which they debate the fate of the daughter! And another pointless scene in which all the wives fight like they were in the WWE! Then the family tries to run, but since they're idiots, they don't go anywhere! And at the end the mother and (grossly underage) daughter are the new Brides of Manos (a pedophile who looks like a hick with a HalloweeN costume by the way) and the father has become Torgo N° 2, since the first has been killed; how, we don't understand, neither do we understand the why, since 'hot' man/man sex between those two idiots is the only thing that would have given people even a slice of interest in this mess.Oh, and did I forget the pointless scenes with a couple who does it anywhere, and cops who are always there to tell them to leave? A movie made of pointless scenes, don't ya think? It's too bad that I can't give negative votes on IMDb, because this clearly deserves a -100.000.000 or more, and actually is the worst 'movie' (if we want to call it that) ever made, and by a fertilizer door-to-door salesman! Well, since the movie's crap, it's probably also because of his job. You know, conditioning and the like...You know, if I had met the director after watching this, I would tell him 'Stick to your day job, man!' The MST3K episode is hilarious, though. The evil men asking Joel and the robots for forgiveness because the movie was too bad even for THEM made my day.Bottom line: if you want to see the worst movie of all time (or maybe the best 'involuntary comedy', pick up a copy of this, and I'll guarantee you, when you'll see the title at the end you'll be scared... that the movie is going to begin again!! Manos: The Hands Of Fate: 0/10 as a horror movie, 10/10 as a comedy.l

reviews.review_title: Textbook example of how NOT to make a good film...
reviews.content: This film is a textbook example of how not to direct a film, write a screenplay, act, or compose a soundtrack.Originally conceived by fertilizer salesman extraordinaire, Hal Warren, who directs, produces, writes, and stars, "Manos" is perhaps the worst film ever made.  Warren knew some big shots in Hollywood and thought he'd try to play with the big boys.  What he comes up with is one of the most painful experiences you can possibly imagine.  Several times while watching the film (especially during the opening segment which features endless minutes of the main characters driving around) I thought I'd die from laughing too hard. This film makes your stomach muscles hurt.  Even after the film is well over, you're still laughing, wondering how such a film could possibly be made.While the technical mistakes might be able to be forgiven, make no mistake: Warren effortlessly throws in every bad movie cliche in the book without even knowing it, from the stereotypical "weak" female protagonist, to the laughably bad wrestling scene.  To give you some idea, one of the main characters is nearly killed by women in white dresses who slap him.Combine this with a script that is about three pages long, a plot that doesn't even make sense, banal music, and out of focus camera work, and you have a truly horrible and wonderful experience known only as "Manos": The Hands of Fate.

reviews.review_title: Its a bad movie and i love it
reviews.content: There are times when you go to the theater and leave thinking, wow, that was bad. You actually mean, wow that was mediocre. Unless you can say the acting, the directing, the scripting, the cinematography, the editing, etc., were bad its not really a bad movie. its probably just an uninteresting movie.Manos: The hands of Fate is a bad movie for all the reasons listed above and more. I don't know why, but when a movie is very terrible, i tend to enjoy watching. maybe its because i'm a filmmaker and like seeing others fail. i don't think its that though, i think its more that I understand the process going on to make this junk and its delightful in a funny way. Keep in mind, Manos is Hal Warren's first and only film. Losts of people overlook that fact and its taken for granted how hard movie making truly is. Even Warren took it for granted by making the bet to make this(He lost the bet obviously. The guy he lost to went on to win an Oscar(Screen writing) for In the Heat of The Night for those of you who like Manos trivia). Most directors today who come out with a great big first feature have actually been directing for decades in music videos, television, and commercials. You hardly ever will meet someone who just all of sudden picked up a camera and begin making gold. Orson Welles had much knowledge of what makes a great story and had a flare for the dramatic. He was also a very talented magician. all which aided him(along with others like Toland) to make him great. Hal Warren sold fertilizer, he shouldn't have been able to make a good movie even in the 1960's.This is one of the strengths of the film i feel. Its a raw look at someones first attempt in to the art of cinema. I would really have loved to see Warren make a few more films. Every film is a learning process, he might have learned from his mistakes how to shoot a good action scene, how to write good dialogue, and how to treat a crew and actors to maximize the film.All in all, it's a dreadful film and most everyone hates it. I love it cause like an Ed Wood movie, it's a sincere attempt at something, and its an absolute car wreck.Note: The rating of one is to reflect the value any normal viewer will feel. for film fans or film junkies(if you like bad movies) this is certainly a ten.

reviews.review_title: Please, just do this for me.
reviews.content: Take one look at this, preferably on MSTheater (trust me, you'll need the comic relief.) Usually when you hear the phrase 'worst movie ever made', you think of something like "Plan 9 From Outer Space" or other, better-known cine-hairballs. This will probably move to your number One spot---you have to see it to believe it.

Cinema Saints forgive me, I love this film, but I'm giving it a 1 star rating in order to have it enjoy the status of THE WORST MOVIE EVER! Of course it's not, it's a fun watch and the more the merrier. Many other bad films will be forgotten - rightly so; this one - NEVER!

reviews.review_title: If you give a fertilizer salesman a camera remember to deal with the sh*t he makes.
reviews.content: Ouch this movie was bad. This thing makes "Troll 2" look like "Citizen Kane". At least in that movie stuff happens. In this I really don't know what is happening, and really don't care. It was really hard to sit through this thing, but I did it. Unfortunately I'm not getting the Purple Heart of movie critiquing out of watching this thing. All I get is a keyboard to unleash frustration on, and bad memories. Every last actor in this movie had no career after this or before. One actress was a script girl for a movie I don't know, and another was an uncredited actress in a TV movie I don't know. That is it. This film was just hard to sit through. Now if you excuse me I need to wash my eyes of this movie.0 stars out of 4

First I'd like to thank the guys at MST3K who made watching this movie possible...really, THANKS, couldn't have done it without you."Plot" summary: A family is driving (and driving...and driving...and driving...) through the countryside and (beleive it or not) gets lost. They wind up at a spooky lodge. There they meet Torgo, the guy who takes care of the place while the Master is away. Eventually the Master shows up. He has a fetching cape with the "Hands of Fate" (registered Trademark of "MANOS"...) logo printed on it. He worships "Manos", an evil deity of primal darkness, who dwells in the depth of the universe and the black chasms of night and is essentially very very bad. So after a lot of talking an less of doing, the movie ends...?"Manos" the Hand of Fate is a horror movie through and through. The plot, the acting, the MUSIC...HORROR. It is quite remarkable though how the crew (yes, they had a crew) managed to put in so much sexuality in a movie of the 60s...hmm.I have seen a lot of bad movies in my life, but none of them came even close to the HORROR that is "Manos" th Hands of Fate. Was it fate or just the hands of a very untalented director that lead to the making (and release) of this movie? Perhaps we shall never now...In conclusion (did I mention how horrifying this movie is?) this IS the absolute WORST movie ever!!! I can only imagine they spent the entire budget on renting the cabin,so there was no money left for acting lessons, or directing lessons for that matter...If you are one of those people who gets a kick out of sharpening pencils, suffer from schizophrenia, personality disorder or have had HALF OF YOUR BRAIN REMOVED, I highly recommend you watch "Manos" the Hands of Fate. If not, watch the MST3K version...it's a blast.

Einstein once said, "only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity. And I'm not so sure about the universe." "Manos" is the celluloid evidence that proves Einstein correct. This film is human stupidity taken to infinity. In a century of film making, there have been some wretched pieces of work, but Manos is the undisputed heavy weight champion of ineptitude. When we discuss the merits (or lack thereof) of a film, elements such as script, screen play, directing, casting, acting, cinematography, composition, continuity, visual effects, sound, lighting, set design, editing, post-production and numerous other aspects must be considered. As several other reviewers have stated, Manos is a total train wreck in every conceivable category. It was filmed with a single hand-held, spring-wound 16mm camera that could only shoot for 32 seconds at a time. And in order to save film (and money) H. Warren (Director) did almost no retakes. So, as you can imagine, the camera movement is closer in technical proficiency to a backyard birthday party video than a professional feature film. The film was also shot with no audio. All of the dialogue and other sounds were dubbed after shooting, with predictably dire results. From a purely technical perspective, this film would be 70 minutes of blinding pain, were it not for the fact that, much like the visual quality, the sound transcends the realm of bad to the point of being comical. What about the acting? Hold on a minute. I'm still searching for a word that might begin to describe the shear debacle of the performances. I can't seem to find just one word, so I'll give you two. John Reynolds. His portrayal of the character Torgo has gone beyond legendary and reached mythical status among the movie-going public. And for good reason. Please read some of the other Manos reviews for the particulars about Torgo, there are just too many to go into, and I really wouldn't even know where to start (although the ridiculous "goat legs" would probably be the logical starting point). One would think that given the numerous technical and artistic elements involved in a feature film, something, just one thing could be done at a mediocre level, even under the direction of a snow-white amateur like Harold Warren. And therein lays the reason for our fascination with Manos. That is to say bar none, absolutely every possible mistake imaginable was made in this movie. Viewing Manos is much like gawking at a horrible traffic accident, you just can't seem to look away even though you know you should.

reviews.review_title: One of my favorite all time bad movies
reviews.content: Katrina victim. Lost all my Dvds and VHS tapes. Had good collection of MSTK3000, "Manos" being one of many. Family and friends would watch over and over, never failed to bring a laugh. Love all kinds of movie genre, golden turkeys among them, and this truly rates as one of the top three of all times. Like to know what was budget for this one. Poor Torgo what kind of scary physical ailment do they give the guy, big thighs. "Torgo bring in the luggage." Torgo get the luggage we're leaving." Looks like it was shot on 8mm and could have been a Manson family get together. One thing you can say if you ever get to see it, you probably won't forget it. It has a little bit of everything, bad lighting, scripting, acting, female wrestling, who could ask for more.Whoa! Some of you people have got to lighten up about being so serious over Manos and the voting there of. I admit I do appreciate bad movies, as well as "serious fare", and enjoy them for the humor they can engender. But jeez, I also know it's not Citizen Kane, A Day at the Races, StarWars, Gone With the Wind or whatever your idea of filmdom's greats are. Being a new member of the IMDb family, maybe I've committed a faux pas of actually giving it a ten rating. But mainly it was meant tongue-in-cheek, since it has given me a much needed laugh many times over, unlike some of the mega-million dollar Hollywood schlockbombs that have been touted as some brilliant auteur's film-making. From now on I promise not to offend the elitist film crowd and will fully agree with everything they like and say about their choices, and also take my voting much more seriously. Really I will. The Master would want it that way.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie ever made.
reviews.content: Does it deserve a 10? Well, no, but I'm giving it a ten to counter-balance all of the ones. Contrary to popular belief, this is *not* the worst movie ever made. The editing is terrible, the sound is terrible, I'd say something about the cinematography, but there really wasn't any. But I have seen far worse performances in much "better" movies, and the basic idea for this film could, in the right hands, make for a fairly creepy horror film. Forget for a moment, all of the hype surrounding this film. Now imagine a family that is forced to shack up in a really shady motel with an even shadier caretaker. Their dog disappears. The creepy caretaker stalks the wife. The car won't start. Their daughter disappears only to reappear later with the discovery of a strange room full of silent, unmoving women. This is a truly creepy premise with shitty execution. In the hands of a competent writer, director, and cast, this film could be really good. Allow me to give you an idea: Written by, oh, let's say Alex Garland. Directed by M. Night Shyamalan (say what you will about The Village, the man knows how to create a creepy atmosphere). Johnny Depp as Torgo. It could be a decent film.

reviews.review_title: ... but is it WORTHY of a sequel?? I say YES!
reviews.content: I hear that director Tony Trombo (who made the film "Hick Trek 2: The Next Aggravation") is looking into making the sequel to this fine little 1960s film! I hope it's just as good (or as bad) as the original! I've always thought that Manos was a great film, although it IS the WORST movie ever made! I say, If you're gonna make a crappy flick, do it right! Never mind about the script, or the acting, or the lighting, or the camera work, or the sets, or the special effects, or the really, REALLY long opening driving scene that doesn't have the credits rolling (like it should!) No sir, just go out and shoot footage and cut it together later, regardless of the outcome, or the popularity of the film afterward. Quentin Tarintino owns a 35mm copy... and that should be good enough for you!

Family man Michael (Hal Warren), his wife Margaret (Dianne Maherr) and daughter Debbit (Jackie Neyman Jones) travels on vacation as they stumble to the Valley Lodge. They soon find a creepy mangoat-like fellow named Torgo (John Reynolds) helps them to their rooms until his evil master (Tom Neyman) traps them into a horrifying nightmare.One of the worst films of all time! this stinky abortion of a movie has one of the worst plots in the history of film plus rotten acting, horrible production values, lethargic pacing, and all that sort of thing but does have a good jazzy soundtrack which helps the level of this excretment. Thank god for Mystery Science Theater 3000 riffing this mess apart and you can feel the pain they suffered through this movie.Watch only the MST3K version.

More than five times as many reviews have been posted of this film on the IMDb than of 'Last Year at Marienbad' (whose total number presently stands at 125)!Having once again come across this title mentioned in passing as a legendary stinker, I decided to give it a whirl on YouTube and was pleasantly surprised to find that it's in colour, and thankfully runs less than an hour and a quarter. Distributed by Emerson Film Enterprises (who four years earlier had gifted us 'The Creation of the Humanoids'), like most films famous for being really, REALLY bad 'Manos' certainly isn't up to much, but is hardly THAT bad. Anything made around that time by Elvis Presley or Andy Warhol is a far greater trial to sit through; and turning in a lousy film on a microscopic budget doesn't take much doing.The attention is engaged throughout, whether by the annoying jazz score, the swarms of moths that flutter about during the night-for-night scenes, The Master's foxy coven of wives in diaphanous white robes, glossy red lipstick and sixties permanent waves, and the enormous red hands printed on The Master's ceremonial robes that make him resemble Kenny Everett as Brother Lee Love; all in glorious sixties Eastmancolor!Jackey Neyman as young Debbie never seems to be paying much attention to what's going on around her, while the late John Reynolds - whose beard I could never figure out was real or not - staggers about as if he's recently suffered a stroke.

This beats The Room, Birdemic, Troll 2, Plan 9 From Outer Space, and even Santa Claus and the Ice Cream Bunny (which is another worst film many people have never heard of). I can't give it a 1, because I was entertained so wonderfully from beginning to end. For what it is, it is a 10. The reason this is truly the best worst movie ever is that there is not one shred of competence in the entire movie. The sound, the cinematography, the "plot", the acting, the dubbed voices, just everything. If you enjoy watching the worst movies and have NOT seen this one, you are in for such a treat.

reviews.review_title: Its either hilarious or numbingly painful
reviews.content: There is only one way to watch this bad excuse for movie, MST 3K style! It's hilarious when you watch it that way.ON THE OTHER HAND This movie has a emaciated plot, terrible sound/acting/lighting/story progression/camera. It should not be in existence! The opening of the film alone bores you to the point where you want to perform the "Eye splinter scene" from Lucio Fulci's Zombie on yourself, just because you had to watch this movie. The opening scene is more than 10 solid minutes of driving in a car and doing nothing! AHHHH! Do not watch this movie, under any circumstances. I would rather disembowel myself and cannibalize my intestines that have to watch it again. (Without the Mystery Science Theater 3000 of course)

reviews.review_title: Oh my god it real is pooh pooh.
reviews.content: This has one of this one of the worst horror movie of all time. The story line is awful. The acting is awful. The ending is awful. It is not scary. This is a pile of pooh. It is so campy. And real stupid. It real pooh. Do not see it. It is one of the worst movies ever. Do not see it. It is a big pile of pooh with pooh on it. It is stinker then pooh. Do not waste your time. And do not waste your money. Do not see this movie. It is not scary at all. It is the worst horror movie ever. Do not see it. It so stinky. It could not be any stinker. It is an awful movie. Do not see this movie it is pooh. It is awful. Troll 2 is a better movie.

How would I sum up Manos? To start off, bad cinematography, no plot, bad acting and (obviously) a low budget. A family is going on vacation to the Valley Lodge, but gets lost on the way. When they stop to ask for directions, they encounter Torgo (the caretaker) a half goat/half man, but with the bad prosthetics, it just looks like he has footballs shoved in his pants so you can't tell that he is actually a satyr. Although Torgo is reluctant, he lets the family stay for the night, knowing that his 'Master' will get mad for letting a man and young girl stay at the house (all he wants is a new wife). The voices of the characters were dubbed (mostly) by Hal Warren and Diane Mahree, but it isn't exactly in sync. The soundtrack (if that is what you want to call it) is very bad jazz and doesn't seem to flow with the film. The first scene when the family gets lost, seems to take forever because they forgot to put the credits in the beginning, so there is no talking, just driving. This movie is for a tough audience and is also physically draining, so if you watch it, make sure to get the MST3k version and/or lots of caffeine.

reviews.review_title: A film that lives up to its reputation
reviews.content:
I have seen quite a few bad films in my time but this one is up there with the worst of them. I wasn't even really entertained personally and I am glad MST3K made it more entertaining because by itself it is dreadful.
I do have to say that John Reynolds, the actor who played Torgo, gave the most interesting performance. From what I've read, he reportedly spent a good deal of his time on the film high, and I think you could see that was probably true. But let's be honest, how could anyone agree to and then go through with appearing in this stinker without a little help from their friends? I don't do drugs myself, but I felt like I must've been on something to be able to sit through this snoozer for that long. This only became a classic due to the MST3K episode and there is no way this would have ever gotten a sequel without it. Yes, that's right, there's a sequel. Pick your jaw up from off the floor and either watch the MST3K version or don't bother.

Here is a "movie" that you should see because its so god awful. But I think you should only watch this film if it has MST3K commentary otherwise you brain will melt and your head will explode during the first 10 minutes. It begins with a man named mike ,who needs anger management, driving along the road with his family on vacation. Eventually they stop and ask for directions from a lovable gout victim named Torgo. they end up staying in Torgo's house which is inconveniently the mouth of hell. Mike and his family must band together and stop a man in a Pancho from killing them. I'm not going to tell you much about "MANOS" because there really isn't much to tell other than good luck I hope you head does't explode

Well, I read all the comments and read all the reviews and I thought to myself, "This can't be that bad". Then, I saw it. Not only is it that bad, it's much worst.I can't say much that hasn't already been said, but I will say it's the most disgusting, nauseating, depressing, boring, freakiest, loathsome, stupifying, pathetic, unredeeming, unpleasant, vomit inducing, grotesque, and suck-filled attempt at a movie I've ever seen. Absolutely every aspect of the 'film' is laughable to say the least. And it gets worse, much worse, as it sloooooooooooooowwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwly plods along taking it's sweet time and leaving the audience in a dreamlike stupor. And finally, to Mr. Warren whereever he is, I want him to know that he hurt me badly and I hope he suffocates to death in the fertilizer he so shamelessly sells in spends an eternity forced to watch this debauchery he created. Thank you.

reviews.review_title: My New Guilty Pleasure Next to Wild, Wild West with Will Smith
reviews.content: In no way is "Manos: The Hands of Fate" a good movie, but it is one where you leave your brain at the door and enjoy it! I admit to liking things other people hate like the movie "Wild, Wild West" and old episodes of "Full House.". I discovered "Manos" when Jackey Neyman (Debbie) wrote about her experience of doing this film with her father, the late Tom Neyman (the Master). She was only 6 or 7-years-old at the time. This movie was the brainchild of fertilizer salesman, Harold P. Warren. It's a tragedy when someone is on their deathbed and they regret one or more dreams they didn't make true! The dreams can be anything from writing a book, traveling through Europe or making a movie despite having zero experience in the art of movie making. I guess Mr. Warren wanted to be known for more than fertilizer and the movie was on his bucket list. Our heroes of this piece are Harold P. Warren who also wrote and directed as Michael. Diane Adelson as his wife, Margaret and Jackey as little Debbie. They also have their little dog named Peppy with them. They are traveling by car and wind up at the home of the Master amidst cops on duty and two teens making out in their car. Michael, Margaret and Debbie end up at the Master's house. They are greeted by Torgo (the late John Reynolds) who committed suicide after the filming. He is quite memorable as this creature who is part man/part satyr. He also was heavy in the drug scene and his twitchy and jerky performance is the result of LSD.The budget for the movie was so low he wore metallic rigging under his pants to give the impression of satyr legs. The family is invited into the house by Torgo and they see a picture of the Master on the wall. The Master is sinister-looking and wears a black robe with red hands painted on the front in giant proportions. He is shown with his evil-looking dog. Jackey says this dog was the family pet and not evil at all! The Master has brides dressed in white gowns. All of the brides are asleep in one room and are standing up in that state. The Master is sleeping lying down. The brides wake up and argue about the family. Torgo wants Margaret as his bride but the Master won't allow it! He has his brides massage Torgo to death. Another death happens to Peppy by the Master's dog. The family escape into the desert on foot because their car doesn't work. People in scary movies act like morons! The family could escape and find the cops or the face- sucking teens to help them, but they don't! They go back to the house and are captured. Now Michael is the guard of the house and Margaret and Debbie are the new brides. This movie is terrible in every conceivable way! The acting is awful from all except for the Master and Torgo! The scenery goes on forever and I was scratching my head at the necking teens because they had no place in the movie. This movie is a guilty pleasure and you feel bad if you like it. On "Modern Family" Phil and Clare said one of their guilty pleasures was going to the theatre and watching bad movies. I like good movies but I also like bad movies if I can find something good in them. The lates Tom Neyman and John Reynolds were both great in their roles as villains and they made this movie so bad it's good!

reviews.review_title: Excellect movie, if taken in context
reviews.content: This movie should be included in film school textbooks under "how to make a bad movie". I own 2 copies of this classic (the MST3k DVD, and the normal movie) and enjoy both of them. It's not exactly gone with the wind, but the "sucks so bad it's good" factor of this film will give Ed Wood's best a run for it's money. Wild cuts, horrible voice overs, bad acting, and a 6 minute intro that's nothing but someone driving with background music are just a few of the wonderful moments you have to look forward to. Bottom line if you don't want to watch a bad movie , then stay away from this film. If however, you're morbidly curious enough to seek to answer the question "Just how bad can a movie be" then give it a try.

Well... not all the answers. I read in Entertainment Weekly last week all about this movie. Seems it started as a bet. Hal Warren thought directing a movie was easy. Anyone could do it. Hal Warren was given some money and the rest is history. Most of the people working on the film knew something was up. They all agreed to do it in return for shares of the profits. But in Producers fashion, the shares added up to 300%! In the end, the only casts members to be "paid" were the little girl (a bicycle) and the dog (50 lb bag of dog food). They knew they were in trouble, but were assured all the mistakes could be fixed in some magic editing room. Which ceased to be an option when the money started running out. There was a premiere which the casts went to.. all but Torgo, who committed suicide a few weeks earlier (not resulting from being in the movie). It was at the premiere the cast found out their voices were all dubbed! There was silence for about 15 minutes.. then some chuckles.. which evolved into out and out laughter! The producer and director didn't stay, and went to a bar. The place where it was filmed is still around and somewhat of a cult tourist attraction. The little girl remembers the guy who played Torgo as being the nicest, but others thought he was on acid the whole time!. The girl remembered the director as someone who yelled all the time and wasn't very nice. Say what you will about this movie.. it certainly has it's place in history, but people need to stop calling it "genius" or "classic". It's also wrong to compare it this to Ed Wood Jr. At least he had passion about what he was doing.. he thought he was making classics.. Manos: The Hands Of Fate was made on a bet!

reviews.review_title: 70 Minutes of MANOS Feel Like an Eternity: Still, Worthwhile as a Curio
reviews.content: It's just a shoddy 70-minute grade-Z feature, but watching it you feel like time becomes molasses, it passes so slowly. It's an ordeal to watch MANOS, it truly is. Good for a drinking game (like: which shots are in focus or not, or spotting continuity errors - Hell, the whole movie is a continuity error!), but only with beer, not hard liquor! Every 3 seconds or so something goes wrong: continuity, framing, dubbing, acting, editing (!!!!), dialogue, music, cinematography - EVERYTHING goes wrong, and all of the time. It becomes clear after the first 10 seconds that no person involved in the production had ANY history in making or starring in movies. The incompetence is unparalleled. Edward D. Wood Jr. (Glen or Glenda, Plan 9 from Outer Space) would rotate in his grave to witness such rampant inanity. They used 1 woman and 2 men to dub ALL the characters in the film, which was shot with a silent camera (Brilliantly, they did no record the audio separately, leaving the dubbers without a clue about what was actually being said!!!). MANOS is fascinating for two people involved in the production: John Reynolds, who played Torgo (and is obviously on LSD all the time - he killed himself shortly after production had wrapped and never saw the finished film - lucky him!) and Tom Neymar, who not only played The Master (whose plans remain as foggy as the cinematography) but also made his own costume and painted his self-portrait which is central to this movie. They're all dead now, including Harold Warren, who made this "film" on a whim. MANOS stands there as the epitome of cinematic ineptitude - but it's not funny bad, it's just bad. Now, if you really want to watch a so-bad-it's-good movie, seek out SAMURAI COP! Now, that's an entertaining fiasco. This one, it's just a fiasco.

reviews.review_title: I wanted to see what many rated as the wrost movie ever.
reviews.content: I got through about the first five minutes before I hit fast forward. Another 5 minutes and I hit double fast forward to skip through it. It lived up to it's reputation as one of the worst of all time.

reviews.review_title: Makes Plan 9 From Outer Space look like Gone With the Wind
reviews.content: This really is the worst movie ever made, bar none, no doubt about it. When I first saw it, it was on MST3K, and while they made it funny, it was still abundantly clear that the movie was terrible. But then, I had the misfortune of watching it without the benefit of Joel and the Bots, which was one of the most difficult experiences of my life, if you ever have the opportunity to do the same, take my advice...go have a tooth pulled instead.

reviews.review_title: Every Bit as Bad and Fascinating as They Say ...
reviews.content: Full Review on my blog max4movies: Manos: The Hands of Fate is a horror movie about a young family being trapped in a lodge in the desert, while its owner summons the evil demon Manos. Conventional criteria of quality can't really be used for describing the movie's features, as there are countless apparent flaws in the production, e.g., the plot, the acting quality, and the editing. However, in a way, all these problematic technical aspects sum up to a fascinating experience that doesn't bears any resemblance to what most come to expect from movies in general. Therefore, it can be watched for escapist entertainment, mocking the low quality or even for technical analyses. Ultimately, as a movie, Manos: The Hands of Fate, can only be recommended as a prime example of what not to do. Read my full review on my blog movie-discourse.

reviews.review_title: A Film with a Well-Deserved Reputation
reviews.content: I went into this film knowing of its reputation as the 'worst horror movie ever made' but nevertheless, I still tried to be open-minded and watch it without any preconceived notions as I do with any other film. I gotta tell you... I never give out one-star ratings but this film was just so poorly made, I couldn't help myself but laugh at how awful some of the scenes were whether it was due to the editing, the acting, the storyline, the script or the sound design.

reviews.review_title: Well, um, I uh, um, like, what the....i don't know ha ha?
reviews.content: Sorry but the title of this summary kind tells you how the movie went. I seriously hope the director was not attempting to make a good movie, because if that is the case, I'm ashamed to call myself a human being, I think I'd rather be that guy with that pink-painted absurdly looking finger-dress (oh maybe thats Manos). To get on with the point, you would have to be pretty brilliant to be able to follow or comprehend any of this complete utter disaster that is mistakenly called a movie or be able to find anything good about it. I just couldn't watch a lot of it, because I was afraid that my intelligence would actually decrease if I saw the whole thing. Usually I would strongly advocate watching a movie through to its entirety before reviewing it, but this one is an exception. Don't waste your time....unless you want to.....1/10.

reviews.review_title: Look no further, this is the worst
reviews.content: I don't think I can add anything that hasn't been written. Suffice it to say, there is no redeeming qualities to this. It is truly awful. It makes Troll 2 look like an Oscar best picture winner (that's not saying much I know). It's 70 painful, atrocious minutes. I dare you to watch it. Other "terrible" movies have funny moments and quotable lines. You won't find that here. You'll just find an outright mess. Consider yourself warned......

reviews.review_title: There was nothing redeeming about this movie
reviews.content: As has been stated here over and over, this might be the worst movie ever made.  But it's something more than that.  I rented the full non-MST3K version (in a city of 130,000, only one store had the original version). Having already gotten all the laughs I will ever get out of the haunting Torgo theme from MST3K, I actually watched this thing as I think it was meant to be seen.  You know, it's funny (the irony, not the movie), but without MST there, you will really never laugh - there is just something evil about Manos that wafts from the screen and makes you want to take a shower with sandpaper to get it off.  NOTHING redeeming happens (all the main characters and the dog die or become slaves), the cast is made up of real-life weirdos that you would simply never WANT to watch. Imagine (well, you can't) that this became a hit in 1966 - would you really want to meet the actor that play the Master?  The only character I'd be curious to meet killed himself.I guess what I'm trying to say is that this movie not only wasted 70-some minutes of my life, it actually made me a worse person having seen it. Manos: Hands of Fate is not campy, is not fun (except for Torgo I guess), is not interesting or thought provoking (yeah, as if); it's mean-spirited and uncomfortable, and not even in a sleazy way.  It does have a more coherent plot than other sub-Z type movies, but that works against in the end simply because the plot's so wretched.  It would have been better if it had just been ENTIRELY driving montages and cat fights.  It has NOTHING going for it. It's not even f**king in focus.Did I like it?  No.

reviews.review_title: I survived it, but you shouldn't have to.
reviews.content: I have actually watched this entire film, without the Mystery Science Theater riffing to ease the pain. If you can help it, don't do what I did. It was very, very difficult to sit through, and it used up pretty much all the resolve I had. I'm not an expert, and I have not seen every movie there is to see, so I can't definitively tell you that this is the worst movie of all time, but it is, without question, the worst movie I've ever seen.There is something to be said for movies that are "so bad they're good". But this film goes beyond the realm of "so bad it's good" straight into confusion, dullness, and straight-up unpleasantness. It's so bad, it's just painful. I know probably every other person who's written a review of this has said this almost word for word, but it's so true, it's impossible not to say it. "Plan 9 From Outer Space", often considered the worst movie of all time, is a magnum opus by comparison. Yes, "Plan 9" is nonsensical, unintentionally funny, and not a good movie by any stretch of the imagination, but at least it counts as a film. It is a heartfelt, genuine attempt at filmmaking, and it was evident that Ed Wood really believed in it and gave it his effort. I would even go so far as to say it's entertaining. Much of it is, anyway. I really don't know that "Manos" qualifies as a film. There is something passing for a story in it, but it is so poorly told, acted, and directed that I really don't know that it counts. And even if you could follow the plot, you wouldn't really want to. It's certainly not entertainment. What story there is is buried in the complete lack of pacing. The long driving sequence at the beginning is painfully boring to sit through, and it never really gets more interesting than that. May as well just go for a drive yourself. You'll have a lot more fun.It was made on a budget of about $19,000. And it shows. Even if you know nothing about how movies are made, you can't help but see how unfinished and unedited "Manos" is. The clapboard is blatantly left in one of the shots. There's a young teen couple who make out in their car, and they appear a few times, yet are completely unnecessary to the plot. There's no reason for them to be there. The jazz soundtrack, while I don't entirely hate it, is completely unfitting and just adds further to the unpleasantness. Just awful. The one thing about the movie that held my interest at all was the character of Torgo. Even though he really has no back story (there's no such thing as back story in a movie this awful), he does have a bizarre presence that is somewhat compelling to watch, and he even has his own musical theme, as MST3K pointed out. Don't get me wrong, he's not a pleasant character. His dialogue is just as stilted and awkward as anything else in the movie. But honestly, with what he obviously had to work with, he really wasn't that bad, I guess. Maybe it's just that the rest of the film was so incompetent that he looks really good by comparison, but he was the best thing about "Manos" by far. At least he left an impression. John Reynolds, the actor who played Torgo, shot himself a month before the film premiered. Apparently his suicide was not related to the film, but I can't help but feel sorry for the guy. This was his only film role, the only legacy he got to leave behind. This is totally hypothetical, and maybe not even true, but he just might have gone on to something decent, if he'd survived. Even if he only did b-movies, anything would have been better than this. The only reason I might recommend watching this movie is if you want to know just how bad a movie could be. Before I saw this, I really had no idea movies could be this bad. But if you absolutely must see this film, please, do yourself a favor and watch Mystery Science Theater's riff of it. Even they have a hard time making it funny, but it helps a little, because this film is just...well, I've said it all. I've also heard the guys from MST3K (who now do RiffTrax) are doing a completely different riff of this movie that might be worth checking out. But please, don't watch it without their comedic assistance.

reviews.review_title: A historic failure you must watch
reviews.content: This movie is like watching a baby take it's first steps. Every few seconds it falls over flat on it's face. The story behind this movie is more interesting than the movie itself. I hope we can get a disaster artist style movie about this movie.

reviews.review_title: Potentially the worst movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: Even with the commentary from the Mystery Science Theater 3000 episode going for it, the true awfulness of this movie seeps out the edges.  I believe I may very well die if I watch it alone, as it is, without Joel and the 'bots keeping me company.  this stupid, insanely low-budget and zero-scare movie is one big excuse for a scene in which scantily-clad women fight each other.

I haven't actually seen this movie, but I'm gonna rent the MST3K version sometime.  What I think is extremely creepy is that not one, not two, but three of the people in this movie (two of which, it seems, had large roles) killed themselves the year that this movie was release, in the town that the movie was filmed.  Seriously, how bad would a movie have to be for all involved to have killed themselves over it?

A family go on a road trip tosomewhere and wind up getting lost. This is within the first fifteen minutes. How did they manage to pad out a simple plot like that into a quarter of an hour? With tons of shots of the passing countryside as they drive! By the time they get to the house and meet a guy I believe is named Tardo (who has the kind of swag you'd only expect from a guy whose bones are made of gelatin (apparently we're supposed to be scared by gimp-walking)), and I'm not saying that as a joke, I literally think that's the name they call him, you'll be bored out of your mind. Then they get to the house and stay the night becauseI guess people were more trusting back in the day. We're given tons of shots of African furnishings bought from the local Pier One Imports that are supposed to be horrifying.Anyway, the house is home to some creepy porn-star-cum-cult-leader who wears the stupidest looking poncho/robe I've ever seen. He has a harem of women and sacrifices people to the dark lord Manos. Blah blah blah he takes the family and turns them into his slaves and this movie has no point.Everything about this movie is stupid. It's not helped by the fact the film is shot horribly and they dub over the film, because getting a microphone would have cost way more than this movie was budgeted! What's even worse is that this movie is seventy minutes and is padded out so much just to reach that mark! So many landscape shots and this pointless focus on a couple of kids making out in the desert (who keep coming back to the same spot again and again for some reason).The only thing I can give the film credit for is a shot where we're shown the owner of the house and his dog and it cuts to a painting of the two. In better hands, that could have actually been eerily effective. I also thought that the ending, as cliché as it was, would have worked if I understood how the owner of the house survived being shot four times.Manos is a watchably terrible movie, but it's still garbage.

What is this movie sitting as the 'worst' of all time, the very bottom of the bottom 100?   Fair enough it doesn't have superb special effects or a particularly meaningful storyline, but Hal Warren has done his VERY best, is that not good enough for you people??? No...obviously not, what more can you ask from a man who's only trying to earn a living?   I pity those who vote '1' for this movie, if anyone wants to criticise this movie they should keep it to themselves. Because from my point of view Hal has produced the highest quality of features for his tight budget. Not only has he had to direct it, he even plays an important role in it. Anyway, movies that are being worked with multi-million budgets have been a disaster...Vertical Limit? A complete waste of time! Watch it, try not to pick out it's faults and appreciate Hal's work. After all, he didn't spend a lot of valuable time to make a movie that would get criticised so much

reviews.review_title: Even after so many years, it's still one of the worst movies ever.
reviews.content: Where do i begin? The acting? The direction? The plot? It's so bad on so many levels that it's hard to say. The movie tells the story of a family who got lost on a vacation and encounter a cult led by a guy named The Master and his servant Torgo. The plot is almost nonexistent and so boring. The acting is awful, none of the actors gives a slightly good performance. The film is only about seventy minutes long, yet it feels like three hours. There's also a subplot about a couple making out in the desert, and they have absolutely no purpose to the film at all. At the end credits there's a song that's actually pretty good, and is probably the best part of this movie. If you want to see how bad films can get, see it. If not, avoid it.

reviews.review_title: 1 Fertilizer Salseman+1 Gigantic thighed actor= 1 disaster
reviews.content: Wow. Anyone who thinks that this was a better movie than Baby Geniuses 2 obviously has never had to suffer through this sad 74 minute excuse for a feature film. I would have to say that I would rather watch an hour and a half of Public Access TV or even static than have to torture myself by viewing Manos again. If the government took suspected terrorists and made them watch this video until they gave up information, we wouldn't even have to interrogate them! The acting was terrible, there was no comprehensible plot and machinery at a construction site sounds better than its soundtrack. If you for whatever reason MUST watch this movie, then do yourself a favor and watch the MST3k version. And one more thing: "Manos" means "hand in Spanish, making the translated title "Hand: The Hands of Fate."Drama (wait, there was drama in this movie?) Movie Score (1/10) Overall Movie Score (1/10) Not Recommended to anyone who does not want to kill off their brain cells

This movie set the standard for awesomely bad movies. I have actually yet to see it without the genius commentary of the Mystery Science Theater 3000 crew and I am not sure if I would be able to handle sitting through the duration of the film without it. The acting is horrendous and to make it even worse, the dialogue, however bad it may be, is actually dubbed over itself making the movie appear even more low budget. This is the kind of movie you show to people when they say "I just saw the worst movie ever!" just to prove them wrong. To the movie's credit, however, after seeing this little flick, it will be forever etched into the permanent portion of your memory, whether you want it to be there or not.

reviews.review_title: Indefensible garbage - and I just love this kind of stuff.
reviews.content: One can't really compare this to other "so bad they're good" films. This is unmitigated trash.Plan 9, Horror of Party Beach, etc had plots one could actually follow even if they weren't creative or credible. This is more in line with Robot Monster where nothing really makes sense. Not having a clue what or why things are happening interferes with any possibility of getting some schlocky entertainment value from a badly done movie.I love 1950s B-grade horror and sci-fi so I have a real tolerance for nonsense and low-quality. But I can't recommend anyone bother with this mess, it's not worth the time.

This movie was awful in ways that cannot be expressed with any human language.  After having watched it, even with the help of MST3K, I was surprised to find the universe allowed this movie to continue existing.Worst. Movie. Ever.

I have to agree with another reviewer: it's just not right to count the 10 scores for this movie. What else do they call a 10? "Santa with Muscles?" "Larry the Cable Guy, Health Inspector?" Sheesh! This is one of the times I wish IMDb had a way to exclude contrary votes; votes clearly intended to mess with the system. For MTHOF, I can see a 2 or 3 vote. Maybe a 4 if you find B movies acceptable in their own way, or if watched with the benefit of the MST3K guys (I wanted to give a 3 since Joel & crew gave me some laughs, then I remembered what I was rating). But a 10 vote!? The votes for this had the bell-curve around 1, so the 10 votes had to be an anomaly. I wish IMDb had a way to kick the obvious irritation votes. For example, 1 votes for "The Godfather" and "Schindler's List." What does such an individual consider quality film-making by comparison? "Debbie does Dallas?" (sigh)This is a bad movie that is a must-see by any film buff. It gives a sense of scale. (It's a bit like taring a scale to 0.) The only way to possibly enjoy it is to watch it with the MST3K comments. When the master confronts Torgo, a full two minutes goes by watching him wordlessly approach Torgo and we watch Torgo struggle to his feet. After some funny patter during this scene, Joel finally screams "Do something!" The MST3K crew is the only life given to the film where aiming the camera at an average street corner would provide more action and plot.

I consider myself 'experienced' in the area of trash films, having viewed Ed Wood's "Glen or Glenda" and others. (Plan 9 is actually an entertaining movie -very funny)  This movie, shot by a fertilizer salesman in his spare time, is the most painful movie experience ever concieved.  Excruciating is a better word, actually.  Luckily, I was watching this movie with the bots from Mystery Science Theater, which made it somewhat entertaining, but what I was viewing along with my metal friends is far beyond actually describing...

This film is odd, very very odd! I have only seen the MST3K version, but I don't think I could sit and watch the 'uncut' version.
The acting is sub-par, and the sets are desolate, dark, and moody. Had it had a better plot, and a better written script, this movie could have been good!It's a great movie to make fun of. But in the end, sadly the guy who played Torgo, committed suicide after the movie was laughed out of Texas moviehouses. He had wanted to have a big career in movies..

Rightfully regarded as one of the worst horror film ever made. A family (mother, father, daughter and a cute little dog) get lost in the middle of nowhere. They soon find themselves under attack by a Devil-worshipping cult led by the Master, his six wives and servant Togar. It's just incredible how terrible this movie is. It was shot without sound so all the dialogue was (badly) dubbed. The plot makes little sense and ALL the acting is terrible! There's no suspense or horror at all. Frankly it's just boring! No action either. The closest we get to something exciting is when the Master's six wives are fighting each other. Even then it's so badly staged it's laughable. It all leads to a stupid surprise ending that had me wanting to throw the TV out the window! It's incredible how this movie did everything wrong! You can safely skip this one.

reviews.review_title: "Likes Me?! I Thought You Said He Was Dead!"...
reviews.content: Michael (Harold P. Warren), his wife Margaret (Diane Mahree), and their daughter Debbie (Jackey Neyman) are on a road trip when they become inexplicably lost. Various music samples cut in and out, as the family speaks their overdubbed dialogue.What powers of hell could be causing this?Thankfully, there's a house ahead. Is that a tramp? No, it's Torgo (John Reynolds). Against his better judgement he takes the family inside, knowing that his Master would not be pleased. Here, the nightmare unfolds.The painting! The poodle! The horrible, non sequitur howling sounds!Don't let Debbie sleep on that couch! It's obviously left over from some infernal frat house!Torgo gets weird with Margaret. Debbie wanders off. The poodle perishes.Meanwhile, The Master (Tom Neyman) is revived!The hair! The robe! The satanic sandals! The bevy of brides in their unflattering nightwear!Now, The Master commands his wives to awaken! Let the bickering and slow-motion brawling begin! Complete with halfhearted slapping!"Man, yes! Child, No!", they chant!More dislocated music plays, and more howling. The Master is certainly not pleased!MANOS: THE HANDS OF FATE is the reason cinema was created! Director Warren never made another film, proving his genius! After all, how could he top this miracle? Watching it puts the viewer in a Zen state, much like being stunned by the glancing blow of a passing bus.P.S.- There's a sequel! MANOS RETURNS...

reviews.review_title: It's a waste of time commenting it
reviews.content: Imagine a cross breed between Dracula and The Stepford Wives done with the budget and inspiration for one episode from a south American soap opera and you get MANOS The... hands of fate. Luckily for me I've watched in the MST3K version, but this was really bad. I mean, bad bad! The previous movie I've commented on I marked as 2 and since I watched it from start to end I can't rate it 1, I need a 1.1 mark here :)The film features the most pathetic devil worshiper ever, the cutest evil hound, the most annoying harem, the jerkiest husband, the most Xanax filled wife (and daughter) in US cinema, the teenage duo with the Guinness record on kissing and a wonderful elevator music soundtrack.It's a must avoid!

Yes this is an awful film - I mean awful. Yet I find something compelling about it - something interesting about it in a weird sort of way.This really is one of the world's worst movies - that I have to agree but it's so horrible that it's entertaining. It can be funny, weird and plain boring at the same time. This is a film you would have to see to know just how awful it is. It's up to you whether or not there is some sort of entertainment value for you - and I don't think it would be for most viewers. I am one that has found it entertaining in a weird way.Bad acting, bad lighting, bad cinematography, bad script - yes just terrible. Why do I find this one appealing in some strange way? IDK but I do.3/10

I first saw this film very late (3 am) on some cable channel (sans the bots)I flicked onto it about 1/2 way - when the Wives start to fight. It was awful, it was a train wreck I couldn't turn away. I never caught the name of the film (they never said I'm not sure why) but I knew, down to my bones, that I was watching one of the worst things I had ever seen (and even then that was saying something). By the end of the movie, it was all I could do to drag myself to bed. Had I read The heart of darkness then I would have been saying "the horror, the horror" years passed and MST3K arrived. In all innocence I picked up the VHS of Manos since they said it was the worst film they ever did - popped it in the player and then realized Oh my god it's THAT FILM! The horror, the horror.

reviews.review_title: One word sums up this movie...
reviews.content: Painful. Period.  This movie is so bad it is painful to watch.  If the MST3K guys weren't cracking on it, I would have turned it off after the first "scene." Just Painful.

reviews.review_title: Astounding, for all the wrong reasons !
reviews.content: Two friends of mine and I was reading the IMDb list of the worst movies ever. When reading the reviews of Manos: The Hands of Fate, I was laughing so hard I was twitching ! I had to see it ! The fact that I was watching the MSTK3K version didn't spoil it; I thought it might be irritating with some people blabbing away on top of the dialogue, but: no problem ! Because there is very little dialog in the movie, and the dialog that's there, well.... sucks !I thought Plan 9 from outer space was the worst, but we have a new champion.None of the actors can act and framing and clipping is off the scale ! ! ! The music is always, always out of place, a mix of soft jazz with a trumpet that won't stop, and what you might characterize as porn music, or something from a VERY sleazy night club.Actors do stare at each other for minutes, I thought that was a joke made by someone here, but noooo, it's the awful truth. In a lot of scenes they just stand around without doing anything ! Just pay attention to the scene where Torgo gets out of bed and stands in front of the master. I would say it lasts a good 2 minutes.And the "night-chase" where the family is being pursued through the woods at night, well it's gotta be the worst chase-scene ever made. With the music being out of place of course, accompanied by hideous lighting making it hard to make a damn thing ! Kinda like a Lars Von Trier movie during a night-scene.The movie shows a host of uninteresting things, shot from horrible angles, in the most bizarre lighting ever.There is a couple in a car kissing away for hours, and they have nothing to do with the story at all, which is kinda strange ?Take all the acting talent of all the "actors" in this movie, multiply by 10, and your'e still miles away from Chuck Norris on a bad day.The movie was shot on a camera from 1489 that could record only 30 seconds of film at a time, without recording sound. Most of the clips look like they are randomly put together, and 3, THREE people did the voice-over and dubbed the movie, meaning ? Yep, in a lot of scenes you can't make out who's talking. Nice.Did I mention the director was a fertilizer salesman from Texas ?OK, some movies are so bad they are good, and yes the first time I saw Manos, I was laughing and twitching away. When I saw it the second time, I my mind was numb and I wasn't laughing; it was worse the second time, and God help me, I wonder what the third time might be like. Yes, this is one of those movies that get worse every time you see them, because you notice things you didn't see the first time, things that you wish you hadn't noticed anyway.You gotta see this to believe it ! I Was full of expectations and giggling as I put it into the DVD because I was wondering: what does the worst movie ever look like ? Let's just say it exceeded my expectations, I mean it was staggering !A friend of mine made a crap movie for fun a few years ago, and my god, it looks like the masterpiece of a genius compared to this.A number of people here gave it a 10/10. Those people have to see a headshrinker.Make sure you see the MST3K version, but no matter what version you see, your'e still gonna waste 90 minutes of your life, and afterwards, your'e gonna want to stick your head down your toilet and flush.

reviews.review_title: The absolute worst movie ever made.
reviews.content: Like many of the other reviewers, the only reason I give this film a one is because it is not possible to give it a lower rating. Believe me, if I could I'd give it a negative ten star rating. It is just that bad.There are so many things wrong with this movie:1. The actors all just happen to be completely talentless, and I'm pretty sure that the majority of them are on Valium or something. They don't make the mistake of overacting, which at least would be entertaining to the audience. Instead, they underact in the worst way. No matter what the situation, the dull, drugged expression will not leave their faces. 2. The dialog, or rather the lack thereof, is simply atrocious. There is so much repetition, which might have been okay if the actors had only had any feeling or emotion in their voices.3. The story. Some parts of this movie were so bad that I couldn't even watch anymore. I had to just close my eyes and force myself to breathe. I'm pretty sure that at one point, the overall atrociousness of this movie brought tears to my eyes. 4. The action. WHO taught these actors to slap? Who taught them to fight?
