Those fight scenes were pathetic, and no human could ever have been injured in one of those rows. Honestly. There are at least three hundred other negative things to say about this movie, but if I got into those, I'd be here all night. I swear, I couldn't have made a movie that bad if I'd tried, and I doubt anyone else in the universe could either. It's almost as though they were trying to make THE worst movie ever, and succeeded.The MST3K version of this movie is absolutely hysterical, however, and I think that everyone should watch it. Just make sure you don't make the mistake of watching the original version. You might not make it out alive.

reviews.review_title: Oh come on! Don't be cruel with this one!
reviews.content: Since I've been a member of IMDb (about 6 years ago) this movie has been on the Bottom 100. In fact, it occupied the number one spot for two straight years. Anyways, "Manos..." has generated somewhat a cult and it's even more popular than many good Horror movies.The truth is this : the movie is terribly bad. Not unintentionally funny, but just plain bad, mediocre. The fact that this was filmed with zero budget doesn't means that it deserves pity or something. No, the movie reaches high levels of mediocrity. For example, the acting. None of the actor deliver even a regular performance. I guess none of them had even acted in school. The direction is poor, poor. In fact, the "director" just shoot a movie without knowing how to use the camera. I won't even get on the cinematography or art direction because it would be humiliating.But in reality, "Manos" is a movie everyone seem to love for sentimental reasons. It seems that even though there are minimal production values, the producer tried too hard in order to create a serious movie. For example, I went like "awwww" when I watched the movie's climax or when the master explained about Manos. It's like, you can't be cruel with this movie. In fact, people should recognize it as one of the most popular bad movies that have ever existed.It's that popular that MANY avid Horror fans have watched it. Please, avoid it like the plague but if you watch it by accident or something, don't be too harsh with it. It's like this movie is hiding from the world and does not want to be watched. Don't disturb it.I can't give it a rating... I don't know why.Trivia: watch the creepy trivia for this movie on it's IMDb page. Many people committed suicide after the movie's release. Mmmh... do you think Torgo or the Master had something to do?

I recently picked up a copy of MST3K's "Manos: The Hands of Fate" and have watched it twice (so I could see if it was really as bad as I thought it was the first time).It was WORSE.The ONLY credit I will give to this film is that the underlying (more like buried) concept is actually somewhat scary when you think about it (for those that have seen it, of course).Thing is, they did NOTHING right in this movie.The acting was so awful that it was mind-boggling. The plot was almost non-existent. The cinematography was hideous. The design was shoddy. Half the scenes had no relevance to whatever minor flow the movie had to begin with. It was, however, another one of MST3K's shining moments (but even they were often in awe of how miserable this flick is!) To date, this is the worst movie I have ever seen. Though not by much, it's worse than "Space Mutiny" (and that's saying A LOT). I REALLY don't want to imagine this movie without Joel and the robots.

Well gee whizz, the legendarily-awful Manos turned out to not quite be the colossal garbage-fire of unbearably bad celluloid that I was led to believe for so long! I dare say what we really have hear is a bad movie buzz and that this movie's lousiness is actually rather vastly overrated! Don't get me wrong now, it was terrible, the grainy look of it was unbelievably ugly and unappealing, and the voices were so hilariously muffled and distorted sounding that I really thought it was dubbed! But the thing was, despite myself I had a bit of fun with it, it made me laugh a lot because of how weird the atmosphere and setup was and how everything was so shoddily slapped together. It was a story that couldn't handle a story and one that I had trouble following at all, most of the time I was like, "what's going on!?" The director went mad! It was so stupid and funny the way it had stuff like the lame Egor knock-off character who had his own limping music, and when the main priest guy wearing the cloak with the big red hands on it would malevolently laugh at nothing at really inappropriate times, and his laughter was so poorly looped! It made me laugh at the part where he commands the god of hands Manos to awaken his squad of priestess wives, and they all immediately start bickering at once, and his expression looks like he's one second away from beseeching mighty Manos to put them right back to sleep! I love when all the wives get into a ridiculous cat fight that jumps film cells, probably kills a few brain ones, and goes on for just about forever, it was beautifully orchestrated nonsense. I'm a fan of hand-to-hand combat.. I wasn't that bored by it, at least I don't think I was. The movie has a bit of a hypnotic mind-whammy thing going on if you're not wary! It was such a messy oddity of a film that I was ready to hate so much that I ended up finding it strangely enjoyable and somewhat entertaining. I've seen way worse bad movies, ones that really made me angry while I was watching 'em, but not so much with this one. For me it's horrendousness made it almost cute. And it's certainly garnered an impressive amount of attention for all the wrong reasons over the years. Oh man though, I am never gonna give anybody a hi-five again!

reviews.review_title: so bad & ridiculous that it's a must see!
reviews.content:
So bad & ridiculous that it's a must see! one of those "we got lost in Texas" films. in some ways precursor to Texas Chainsaw Massacre. One wonders if Toby Hooper had seen this film. The bright red hands robe costume it
is actually pretty effective. the music is really strange as well. might've been fun to see at a drive in theater back in the day.

reviews.review_title: This is truly a painful movie to watch
reviews.content: The only 2 redeeming qualities: 1- Torgo 2- this movie will cure insomniaOther than that, nothining but pain can ever come from watching this movie. And how come no one in the cast ever mentions Torgo's knees in the movie? Not even behind torgo's back! That little girl should have been staring and pointing at those knees until either given an answer or told to ignore it, which of course is impossible, they're HUGE!

reviews.review_title: An extraordinary turkey experience from the wastelands of space
reviews.content: (The first thing that must be said, is that I think MST3k is totally pointless. I love watching cheesy old oddball B-movies, but not with a bunch of silly robots ruining the experience. I treated "Manos" as it should be treated -- I let it speak for itself.)There's not much to be said that's already been said about this movie's lack of... just about everything. I saw it for the first time just now, and I'm still baffled. This is not a case of "so bad, it's good". It's not even a case of "so bad, I want to spew my run screaming into the woods, using my own hand for a torch". This movie reaches beyond "bad", and comes out on the other side. It's set entirely in a parallel universe, where time and logic are twisted beyond recognition for mortals. What looks like Texas is actually the other end of a worm hole, where the fabric of space has turned itself inside-out.It HAS TO be this way. How else could a movie be so indescribably... not "bad", that word is to simple and two-dimensional... mesmerising, but yet so extraordinary painful and genuinely creepy... you feel the movie slowly pressing a pole into your blackened heart, and you make sure to keep the remote control near in case you should feel a psychosis coming... but still you're always on the verge of laughing your head off... and at the end, you can almost feel your brain suppressing the whole experience, and you will never, never be sure what actually happened during these 80 minutes.THIS MOVIE IS EVIL. If you're looking for a great turkey experience, something out of this world, that leaves you with a smile on your face and a somewhat altered way of relating to movies in general, I suggest "Glen or Glenda".I guess I will never look upon more ordinary B-movies the same way again. The thought isn't pleasant, but I still don't regret watching "Manos" for a second. It had to be done.

reviews.review_title: Torgo rules in this masterpiece.........of bad cinema!!!!!
reviews.content: When a family gets lose of the way to their vacations, they find a house where the only resident is a very strange man named Torgo, who says that he is taking care of the place for "The Master". Soo the family will be in trouble with "The Master" and his wives, when they are trying to use them for their sacrifices.This is the plot of this unique and bizarre low-budget horror film, that is ranked as one of the worst films ever made here in IMDb. And that has lots of bizarre things around it, for example that nobody who work in this film never appears in other film and also exist a rumor that some of the cast committed suicide shortly after the release of the film, anyway according to the 2004 documentary "Hotel Torgo" there are no proofs of that rumor.And the film itself is full of bizarre things that works as a lesson of bad cinema. I mean since the title, "Manos: the Hands of Fate", because the word "Manos" is Spanish for "Hands" so the real title is "Hands: The Hands of Fate", really bizarre. And well the act is just bad, the edition is one of the worst ever and there is a continuity mistake in almost every scene. The characters are really strange, specially Torgo that is my favourite and also the couple of teenagers in the car, there is nothing that involves this characters to the plot so is really strange. But this is the magic of this kind of films, that it supposed to be an horror film but in the end is nothing but a really funny comedy so is truly entertaining to watch and works excellent for having some fun with this lessons of bad cinema.Conclusion: I really love this So-bad-they're-good cult films, so i highly recommend this film to anyone that loves cinema, watch this film just for pure curiosity and to know how do you make an horror film that looks like one of the best comedies ever. So watch this film and enjoy it as one of the funniest films ever.DVD: I first know about this film because of it awful rank in IMDb and later because of Quentin Tarantino, who is a fan of this film. So i really want to watch it; last weekend i bought a 100 Movie Pack of Horror Classics from Mill Creek. I was really happy because this film was in the pack and it was the first that i saw. The quality of the DVD is not so god, its like it was recorded from an old VHS cassette, but i'm pretty sure that is the best quality possible for this film so is great to have it in my collection.

First of all God please sincerely forgive me that i offend your divine shits comparing them with Manos.Secondly i owe a big APOLOGY to all you people who reviewed it i have no excuse you warn us but my poor mind thought you were too critical with this plus add the curiosity which is one of the fatal human characteristics so i decided to challenge myself unable to imagine what would follow.To begin with Manos means hand,if rephrase the title we have Hand:The Hands Of Faith? lol is a masterpiece of a unique terrible film which cannot compared to anything else you have ever seen I GURUANTEED.Please don't say the low budget as an excuse NO..NO..NO we have seen many worth telliing lowest budget films even amateurs but the problem here is my 12 years old daughter has more technical knowledge and artistic view in her films and are flawless compare to this even the simplest shots THE SIMPLEST god damn shots are technically wrong the acting is unimaginably bad not even in an pre amateur level the audio and editing are really really PHENOMENON beyond any imagination.It is impossible for someone make such a abnormality of a film without a purpose,in my opinion the sadistic director intentionally made it so desperately bad and ironic to last to the ages as the worst film ever made just like the Parthenon was one of the most ever lasting beautiful structures.Also look the Master's bathrobe has two open hands point to the viewer(to fool us)to laugh with us to pleasure himself with our physical and mental pain as we experience this film.I will say nothing more YOU MUST EXPERIENCE it yourself and yes personally i recommend to see this understand evil in it pure form and test yourself how far can you go physically and mentally ill.Painfully remember i was so anxious after the first 20 minutes but i was keep talk to myself terrified how worst can this be oh..sweet Christ i didn't knew.The end of this terrible experience was the icing on the cake,after 74 MINUTES strain i had a terrible low being feeling etched into me,physical and mental pain.I FLED TO THE NEAREST ALCOHOL SHOP to bought a bottle of a strong whiskey.I remember i wanted so f@cking desperately to get badly drunk.I admire Actor John Raynolds who played the half-man half-goat character a satyr named Torgo who after this film completed has the balls and the DIGNITY to suicide.What about the others how they lived with this weight on their consciousness specially the cunning director harold warren. Finally i want to WARN YOU people do not watch it with use on any kind of recreational drugs or alcohol you may remove your own eyes,have panic attacks,a strong feeling of pessimism or even a permanent brain cell damage.This film is used by the CIA as a method of torture,from Navy Seals Instructors in Hellweek to keep students awake or even the Prince Of Darkness in Hell in a new DTS 7.1 Remastered Edition because as it is well known physical pain can be tolerated this film SERIOUSLY NOT.Υ.Γ I wonder what experimental drugs have given to the Mystery Science Theater 3000 guys to withstand re-edit this until the end without suicide and feel wretched pity about being editors.

reviews.review_title: One of the Bottom 3 films of all time
reviews.content: This, one of the Bottom 3 films of all time, was screened last week in New York, where it likely made more money than in its original theatrical run. I spent about two-thirds of the film's run time shouting " What is this god-damned movie even about? " For its final third, I didn't care what it was about, I just wanted it to end. Seriously, I couldn't even tell you what genre this film could be classified as, nor could I tell you what the plot is about.Apparently, filmed in a matter of days, on a budget of only a few thousand dollars, and screened only a couple of times in El Paso ( where it was filmed ) , and then lost for decades, until its rediscovery by Mystery Science Theatre 3000, this is seriously one of the worst, most excruciatingly boring films ever made. It's barely even mockable, let alone reviewable. The music score consists of competing sax, and ivories being tickled in the most obtuse, out of place fashion, seemingly intended for some other movie, and it's used throughout almost every scene. Most times​ I've heard the title/ lead character's name spoken, it's MAN-os, but in the dialogue in the film, it's pronounced like MAH-nos. However his name is correctly pronounced, I kept waiting for his dog to bite him. No such luck.A middle aged nuclear family ( a grumpy old man in ridiculously over-sized trousers, his whiny, nagging wife, and their young daughter, who serves absolutely no purpose in the plot of film ) are driving in the desert ( for the first nine minutes of this movie ) and lose their way. They babble about the weather, are stopped about a broken taillight by a cop with nothing else to do, who later hassles a young couple kissing in a parked car ( and the visible guy holding the clapperboard ) on the roadside. The female half of this couple is clearly bored, as she repeatedly delivers her lines while looking directly into the camera. Was this nine minutes long scene really necessary in setting up the plot of this movie? The family comes across some type of home, inhabited by Torgo, a 25 years old man in old age make-up ( because that always works so well ) , hobbling around, who repeats almost every line of dialogue twice. After their car won't start, they're stuck in this desert overnight, where slightly weird, but mostly just interminably boring, things happen. Torgo tells them " The Master " is dead, but eventually, a hidden, sort of Satanic-looking room is found, where " The Master " is shown apparently alive after all. He's a John Astin lookalike in black robe with red hands, acting grandiose, in front of a group of women, who do little more than sit around and talk for several scenes, before a catfight erupts. The family from the first half disappears for most of this second half, while the John Astin clone and his six wives do ... stuff, ... possibly killing Torgo, because yeah, sure, of course they do. The kissing couple appear again, at night. It looks like they're parked next to a gas station, judging by the lighting equipment reflected on their car. About an hour in, it's revealed the father from the first half has a gun... ( ! ) He's been armed for this entire time? He shoots ( shoots at? ) The Master, then for some reason, a lesbian couple is introduced in the last scene, and it appears as though the entire plot is starting again, as this pair of girls get lost, with writer/ director/ producer/ star Harold Warren standing in for Torgo. A lame joke in the closing credits reads, " The end? "Yes, it is mercifully the end. " Our sincere thanks to the city & county of El Paso for their cooperation " I bet they just LOVE having their name attached to this one.I then shouted at the screen, " What? " It even has 666 in its url!

Poorly produced and incredibly under budgeted, Manos: the Hands of Fate is indeed one of the worst movies ever made. But I disagree with sentiments that this is the absolute worst movie of all time. Indeed it's as bad as many have claimed. It's a sad testament when a movie is so lousy that the only convincing performance comes from Torgo's pet Doberman. Yet I still can't say this is the worst of the garbage pile.Manos was filmed way back in 1966 when special effects and acting were cheesy to begin with. On the other hand, what excuses do the makers of such recent tripe as The Final Sacrifice (1990), Werewolf (1996!!),  and the ever atrocious Space Mutiny (1988) have ? I have a particular gripe w/ Space Mutiny as it had the audacity of stealing special effects footage from Battlestar Galactica and staging battle scenes in an abandoned factory. The "escape pod" race at the  end by itself merits Space Mutiny as being the worst film ever made.  Lets give Torgo & company a benefit of a doubt.

reviews.review_title: Honestly, the worst movie ever made.
reviews.content: I've seen the vast majority of the bottom 100 movies, as well as many other horrible flicks that were not on the list and I can honestly say that this is the worst. Horrendous production qualities, terrible repetitive dialog, at times completely incoherent, and 90% of the film serving no purpose to the primary plot... it was really a labor to sit through. There were times I actually cried from the pain of watching it and others I considered hanging myself because I could not possibly bare the thought of living in a world where this film existed. I would have trouble forcing even my most hated enemy to watch this movie. It is really, really, really bad.Did I mention they dubbed over the entire thing? Well, apparently the camera they used had no audio, so some of the worst dubbing I have ever heard was employed with a bland repetitive soundtrack commensurate with Chinese water torture.Basically, if someone says "Hey, let's watch Manos, the Hands of Fate" think of it as them saying "Hey, let's go castrate ourselves with a piece of steel wool and some elbow grease."

Well, this film must rank as one of the all time greats! It has everything; Comedy, horror, gripping tension.... I could go on.  Well acted and with fantastic location. The way the family get lost in the back of nowhere is creepy too. In short... Pure class.

reviews.review_title: This movie is terrible? Has anyone been to the theater lately?
reviews.content: From reading everyone's comments on this movie, I was expecting this movie to be one of the worst movies of all times. However after watching the original movie (not the MST3K version), even though it was pretty cheesy, overall I was pretty impressed. With a budget of just $20,000 and with no real actors, Hal Warren was able to produce a movie which had a better plot and more realistic acting than most big budget movies that I see today. In my opinion, the disdain which people direct toward this movie would be better used on movies such as Stealth, Poseidon, Date Movie, and every other sorry piece of slime that finds its way out of Hollywood these days.

This film is a bleak joyless train-wreck of a movie. It has no plot, no budget, and the acting is horrible. The premise of the movie is that the Master worships a demon in exchange, I suppose, for the ability to wed many women, all of whom he keeps in suspended animation in some room that is like a crypt or something. A typical middle-class family gets lost while going on vacation and winds up having to stay the night in the Master's home. All the wives wake up and bicker about whether the Master should marry the woman and her six year old daughter who are staying the night. It's a kind of creepy insight into the mind of the man who made the movie, actually. Not much more than that, though. No plot, no action, and a horribly depressing ending.The only reason I ever watched this movie is that I had heard that the Mystery Science Theater 3000 treatment of it was pretty funny. Sadly Joel and the bots couldn't even make this one worthwhile.

reviews.review_title: The Worst Movie of all time being the Best thanks to MST3K!
reviews.content: I got stick my two cents in here about "Manos, The Hands of Fate".This is it folks -- the Winner and Undisputed Champion of "The Worse Movie Ever Made". The only thing that made it worth watching as "The Best-Worse Movie Ever Made" was MST3K ripping it to shreds. Those guys (and puppets) took this gosh-awful film and made it one of the best gosh-awful films you MUST not miss.I never laughed so darned hard in my entire life. You can't even use the word "bad" for this film, that is being too kind. Whether you see it by itself (and God help you if you do) or via Mystery Science Theater 3,000 (MST3K) which I say is THE best way to view this with any redeeming qualities what-so-ever, its the pits.It's low, low, low, low, low, low, low, low, low budget. If they spent more than $300.00 to make this back in 1966, I'm shocked.The acting is horrid. The sets are horrid. The story is....what story?!??! The filming is...well if they used a five year old drawing a storyboard it would have given this film a quality.This is a film where you grab your rowdiest friends, your loudest movie lover friends..you know the ones..order all the junk food available..partake in kegs or wine or whatever gets your party going and enjoy to your heart's content. This IS a "only have a few good friends over for Halloween because I'm too old to go out trick or treating" kinda film. Do NOT watch it alone. Do NOT watch it with intellectual people. This is a party film if ever one was made.You'll laugh -- till you cry, its that bad. Rent it today via MST3K. You'll be glad you did!

reviews.review_title: The most inept film ever made terrible film, horrible.
reviews.content: Manos, it truly one of the greatest Terrible films ever made. And you would need to be hypnotised or drug-ed to ever watch this film.My Uncle made me watch this film for a bet and it was truly torture. I cannot believe how poor the acting was and there was no storyline what so ever. I can endure any low budget film or any poorly shot horror flick.Manos is truly seriously one of the most rubbish films made. It so bad that it's actually funny. If you ever want to test your stamina then i dare you to watch the entire film Manos.Only the brave would be able to endure such torture.1-10

This movie was made by amateurs on a shoestring, yet gained theatrical release and is still being talked about by movie buffs forty years after. How bad can it be? Considering the extreme limitations, it's a respectable piece of work. I saw "Behind The Green Door" immediately afterwards (OK, so I am going through a schlocky phase), a movie which after all made millions, is considered to be one of the foremost films of the Golden Age Of Porn and gets a fair amount of praise from cineasts, and, boy, Manos towers above it. Whereas BTGD is essentially a glorified gonzo shoot with some taped-on plot, Manos is at least a real movie, with plot, development, cheap thrills, great capes, and comelier actors (boy, that Margaret -- phew, I'm telling ya).It does of course fall short, but then so many other movies do that on a much larger budget, and with Manos you at least get a lot of enjoyment out of it -- you can bitch about it with your friends, play "spot the gaffe", laugh at its cheesiness. And if you're into cat fights, you've hit the mother lode, bub.See it as a labour of love -- even if it fails, at least it failed for love.NB, the Mystery Science Theatre 3000 version fills in all the slow spots with comedy and actually makes for enjoyable viewing.

reviews.review_title: A terrible punishment heaped upon 2 innocent Bots ( and 1 Human )
reviews.content: This is without a doubt the worst movie ever made. It gives one the feeling that you get when you see a train wreak. You know you shouldn't slow down to see the possible carnage, but you can't help yourself. The film has this rather puzzling quality to it. Like you can't quite believe what you're seeing. You keep watching, hoping that it either gets better or a least makes sense. IT NEVER DOES. At times you don't know who to feel more sorry for; the viewer watching it or the people who made it. They had to go into this venture with certain expectations, like what they were making was going to say something with this film. It says something allright, Like these people should have never been given access to any type of filming equipment, not even a Brownie camera. All things considered, my favorite character has to be the lovable Torgo(I still can hear the unforgettable theme music in my head).The only way that the movie was made even somewhat bearable was because of Joel Robinson and the Bots. I would like to hear from any other commentors on how to find the MST3K version on video. E.Wallace Los Angeles California.

reviews.review_title: Probably the Most Boring Horror Movie Ever Made
reviews.content: Back in the mid 1960s, a Texas fertilizer and insurance salesman named Harold P. Warren made a bet with screenwriter Stirling Silliphant (writer of In the Heat of the Night) that anyone can make a horror movie. Soon afterwards, Warren created his own horror movie on a budget of $19,000, with random people cast to play the characters, and a 16mm camera that could not record sound, causing the film to be dubbed in post. The result was Manos: The Hands of Fate (literally translated to Hands: The Hands of Fate), which despite going largely unnoticed for many years due to only playing in drive-ins and one Texas theater, it soon developed a cult following after MST3K lampooned it and turned it into a famously bad film. Me personally, I wish this film would remain obscure, for it's not even so bad it's funny, it's just pathetic.The film revolves around a vacationing family who end up getting trapped at a lodge run by a pagan cult, and they try to flee them as the cult's members decide what to do to them. Now this plot may seem really basic on paper, but with the right amount of pacing and momentum, this film could elevate its thin narrative into something with lots of substance....that is not what happened. Really, the whole movie could be cut down into 10 minutes, not only because of several insignificant scenes, but also because it drags certain moments on for no reason. There are many times when characters just stand around doing nothing even after they're done talking, and it becomes very awkward and even frustrating to watch. In addition, a whole mini plot with a couple making out in a car feels like it belongs in a completely different movie. Even an out of place catfight breaks lose with the cult master's wives, showing off pure incompetent storytelling as far as the eyes can see.Now I'm well aware that Warren could only use nobodies to play the characters, but ho'boy does nobody look like they have any idea what they're doing. Warren plays the main character Mike, and it looks like he's trying to figure out what to do on set rather than giving a performance. Same can be said about the rest, especially Mike's wife Margaret, the daughter, and the infamous Torgo. Speaking of Torgo, he's probably the most interesting character in the film from his design alone, mainly because his actor John Reynolds was high when he played the character, making his scenes hysterical but also questionable. The only other actor who seems to be having some resemblance of fun is the one playing the cult master, but he feels like a hammy cartoon villain with all the wackiness sucked out. Also, it is painfully obvious that the movie was dubbed in post, down to the young daughter clearly being voiced by a grown woman, but they had to work with what they were given, so I'm sure they tried in that aspect.Lastly, in spite of the shoe string budget, there's way too many infamous technical deficiencies to behold. Probably the biggest sin is the editing and continuity flaws, showcasing the never ending scenes and confusing side narratives that have nothing to do with anything. There's even a moment where you can clearly see the clapperboard right when the film cuts to the makeout couple. In terms of story errors, Torgo is supposed to be a satyr, so John Reynolds wore metallic rigging, but he accidentally wore it backwards which made him look more like a man with oversized knees. Also, it is never once mentioned in the film that Torgo is a satyr, so anyone watching this film will forever see him as some weird deformity. Not to mention, the soundtrack is poorly synchronized, and they even repeat the same tracks and voice recordings multiple times just to pad things out. Lastly, the whole opening showing the family driving feels like it was meant to have opening credits that were never added in, proving that the best solution would have been to trim the scene down, like the rest of the movie.Overall, Manos is a painfully incompetent and abysmal watch that can only be admired by Mystery Science Theater and RiffTrax fans for its disastrous technical failures and horrendous writing and acting. It's true what they say, nobody ever sets out to make a bad movie, and I admittedly do respect Harold P. Warren for actually making this film out of a bet, no matter how incomplete it is. Besides, plenty of filmmakers have proven to make their own successful horror movies on shoe string budgets, such as George Romero with The Living Dead series, John Carpenter with Halloween, Peter Jackson with Bad Taste, Sam Raimi with The Evil Dead, and more. However, given that those people have talent and experience in film-making, Manos is an example of why films need to be made by people who actually have some background in the techniques of crafting films, not fertilizer salesmen who make bets with Hollywood writers with a rich profile. Unless you're a cynic who adores riffing on the worst of the worst, I think Manos is better off left deep in the heart of Texas where nobody will ever seen it again.

The only way i have seen this was with MST3K and it was hilarious!  As a serious movie it is definitely lacking.  But as a camp film it RULES!  Its what Rocky Horror would have been if it didn't have musical numbers and "Transexual Transylvanians". Family gets lost is welcomed in and then made slaves.  All pretty common fare if you truly think about it. I do have to say that Torgo is the saving grace of this film.  Where did he come from?  And why did the Master kill him?  Torgo was just a confused guy in need of love and attention. On a final note watching the MST3K version of the film (which was the only version we had on tape) became a rite of passage in my high school.  Basically it enlightened you to what a movie shouldn't be.

reviews.review_title: Made by a fertilizer salesman; should be used as fertilizer! So bad I love it!
reviews.content: This film is so staggeringly bad, so awesomely terrible, only Monster A Go GO comes close to the same level of awfulness. When it comes to crimes against humanity it's a toss up between this and Hitler. I saw the MS3k version, which is hysterically funny; but the film itself is like watching someone get an enema - in close-up! Two awesomely terrible actors and their test card daughter are stranded, after a driving tour of the least interesting locations on Earth, at the house of "The Master", complete with the funniest comedy servant of all time. Funny, that is, for all the wrong reasons. The actors's performance as "Torgo" is so bad he later claimed he was on LSD throughout the shoot. That I can believe. He's become something of a hero of mine. I want a Torgo t-shirt!Each scene consists of actors standing around looking as if they don't realise they are being filmed, cutting to shots of paintings, dogs, the a couple making out in a car that has nothing to do with the plot. Words cannot express the fantastic direction in this movie. If the director wasn't stoned, he surely should have been...with rocks. he can't even frame his shots properly. The plot? I just can't be bothered to mention it. Devil Worship....wrestling women...death by, er pawing, a Freddie Mercury look-alike, etc. Never mind Torgo I thought I'd taken something illegal myself by the end.Yaaay for the MS3K version. Which deserves at least 8 higher marks than this. Altogether now..."Smoke, on the weirdo..."

reviews.review_title: Come on people, it isn't that bad.
reviews.content: Just taken as a film, sure it stinks but is it the worst movie ever? No. Is it the worst movie ever shown on MST3K? No, that "honour" goes to Angel's Revenge, the movie that literally made me consider suicide.And it has Torgo, I mean when I think of memorable film characters, it's Hannibal Lecter, Atticus Finch, Bill the Butcher and Torgo.They just need to give Torgo his own franchise and cast an A list actor.I want to see a remake of it with an all star cast, shot the same way.Michael could be George Clooney, the master could be John Malkovich, Torgo could be Ewan McGregor, the wives could be like Halle Berry, Lucy Liu, Gabrielle Union (The Master could be assembling a Benneton ad here), etc.But getting to the point, sure this movie stinks but it isn't the worst movie ever.

reviews.review_title: Is this a comedy or a horror?
reviews.content: I just watched the MST3K version of this movie (if you want to give it that much credit) and with out Joel, Crow, and Tom I would have killed myself.  This is by far the WORST movie I have ever seen.  The character of Torgo by himself could ruin any movie, (it looks like the world's biggest bee stung him in the knees).  None of the kissing scenes have anything to do with the movie, the voice dubbing is horrible, acting awful, the script should have been used for toilet paper, and the worst sound-track ever. Crow put it best, "It's the haunting Torgo theme."  the worst movie ever, but one of the best MST3K.

reviews.review_title: "Like having Joe Cocker as your bellhop"
reviews.content: You can't help but wonder how the hell was this movie allowed into theaters? What possesed someone to write the script for this movie, cast a group of "actors" (I'm using the term very loosely) and film it?  Well, much of that can be attributed to fertilizer salesman Hal Warren (fitting, since this movie is so crappy, I could probably use it to improve my lawn), who displayed his skills as a writer, director and actor in his only known film (If he made any other movies, please don't tell me, this one hurt enough). The result is so bad, the only reason it hasn't been banished to the darkest corner of hell is it's immortalization through Mystery Science Theater 3000- a blessing and a curse. If you have absolutely nothing to better to do in a two hour period of time, rent the MST-ed version.  If you find the original version, destroy it or get as far away from it as possible.Some other observations:Doesn't the Master look like Frank Zappa?What's up with Torgo's thighs, really?Why the hell do they keep showing the teenagers in the Cobra?It's "Hands, the Hands of Fate"!And perhaps the most frightening observation of all:Yes, somewhere in America, this movie was actually shown and people paid to see it!

reviews.review_title: A #1 runner for Turkey of the Millennium
reviews.content: Saw this movie in DVD last night; it looked like teenagers, with a an old Super 8 camera, were 'day -tripping', which they might have been doing since it was released in 1966. Even the commentary by the MS people couldn't save it from what it was shoddy editing. ("the camera could only take 30 seconds of film at a time", what kind of camera ever did that?) It had $1.98 written all over it!I read that 4 cast members committed suicide after this picture was released. Sounds like they didn't like it either!Makes 'Plan 9 from Outer Space' look like Oscar material. Watch it if you must but if you run screaming from the room remember you were warned!

I wanted to swing an ax into my chest after watching this "movie". Did someone really make this on purpose? It seemed like just a bunch of random scenes were shot and thrown together. Like, 80% of the movie consisted of aimless driving and Manos' wives "fighting" it out. Oh, and the great scenes of the characters just staring at each other for minutes on end, I can't forget those.The best part was when the wife looked for the child. She opened the one door a few inches, peered in, and closed it again. What a thorough inspection! Later we find that it's the same room where Manos (it feels ridiculous to write that every time) and his wives were hibernating. How could she not notice them!?!?! Joel & the Bots made it watchable, barely. Even they didn't have a lot of material to work with, having been reduced to saying, "'Manos' Hands of Fate" about 10 different times because they didn't know what else to say.I am pretty depressed right now, and this misery will probably be with me for a very long time after watching the dreaded Manos. The pain that Torgo felt after the Master lit his hand on fire is nothing compared to watching this movie.

reviews.review_title: Friends don't let friends watch Manos
reviews.content: I think that every aspiring filmmaker needs to give Hal Warren a big round of applause: He lowered the bar for independent filmmakers. On a more serious, much more appreciative note, Manos the Hands of Fate deserves respect not for the film, but for the fact that this was a movie made on a whim that managed to get made, despite many setbacks. Even more surprising then it getting made, is that it got picked up by a company and was distributed to major theaters.And nowadays, the film has a large fan base. Well, I would hesitate to say it is a "Fanbase" seeing that many of us are dedicated to hating this movie. It is a God awful film. Though I would have to say that if it was a better film, the ending would have been seen by many as edgy (though only a year or so ahead of its time). Though it really didn't matter how it ended, because most people couldn't get through the beginning.I warned people that this movie is not for the weak. They must have thought I meant weak stomachs because they laughed it off. I have had so many people come up to me and tell me just how much they despised the movie. I guess they thought ten minutes of dialog-free driving was an exaggeration. The script was written within one week, but it's not like it's a complicated story. Family takes a wrong turn, ends up in a lodge run by a cult. It's about them trying to escape their clutches. Bad dubbing. Bad camera work. Good acting destroyed by bad dubbing. This just is a bad movie that seems to drag on forever.And I am proud to own this film. Seriously. Some movies are so bad they are good. Some are just so bad they are, well, bad. This one is the latter. So unbelievably bad that one can call themselves a fan but refuse to watch it time after time, because they know the horror that is Manos: the Hands of Fate.

I thought that I had seen horrible films in my life, but when I finally sat down to watch "Manos:The Hands of Fate," I just couldn't believe what I was watching.A wife, husband and child are on a road trip and end up staying with a strange looking dude named Torgos (John Reynolds), who is watching the house "while the master is away." Who is The Master? Some incredibly strange looking guy in a red/black robe trying to look menacing and got a lot of women hanging around him and fighting each other.Nothing is explained, and a lot of stupid choices are made in this film (The wife keeps telling her husband that they should leave, but the man insists on staying despite the obviously strange behavior of Torgos). The biggest stupid choice being to make this film at all.If you have to see it, you should catch the Mystery Science Theater 3000 version of it, just so you can laugh your butt off and marvel at the stupidity of this film.

When the movie starts out with a family on a road trip singing "Row,Row, Row Your Boat" I just knew I was going to hate this movie, but I just had to see for myself just how bad it was. Oddly, the only vaguely redeeming quality was John Reynolds portrayal of Torgo, you know, the guy with the goat legs who "takes care of the place while the Master's away".(which still isn't saying much).The rest is painful to watch. The characters are incredibly stupid, made all the more so, because their voices were badly dubbed.As bad as it is, I'd still have to say "Mac and Me" (which I reviewed a couple of weeks ago) and "Underdog" are even worse. On the other hand, there are many reasons why "Manos" belongs on the #3 spot on IMDb bottom 100, one of them being that it may have even contributed to the untimely death of John Reynolds. The apparatus he wore to give him the "goat leg" effect (Torgo was supposedly a satyr) resulted in permanent knee damage and his subsequent addiction to painkillers. He committed suicide shortly before the film's premiere.As to being "so bad, it's good", Manos is too bad to be of any good. It's not fair to compare it to "Dark Star" or "The Lost Skeleton of Cadavera", two films I highly recommend. This, however is to be avoided at all costs.Rating: 1/2* out of *****

reviews.review_title: Didn't hate it as much as I thought I would.
reviews.content: This is often considered to be one of the worst films of all time and understandably so. The dubbing is bad, the editing is very rough and unpolished, the awkward silences are weird, some of the cuts are distractingly bad, a few characters (the second couple and the officers) are unnecessary given how little they do in the film, the music choices are unbearable at times, and several scenes are poorly executed. It's not hard to see why this film has such low ratings everywhere. As poorly made as it is though, I can't help but find the film interesting for a few reasons. Firstly, as a couple others have noted, the film feels like a nightmare in some respects since you're actively forgetting about the movie as you watch it. I didn't notice this when I first watched the film, but hearing this from some people caused me to appreciate the film more. I also find the story behind the film really interesting. Warren, who had no experience with directing films prior to this, got the idea to make it from a bet he made. Immediately afterwards, he began writing out the script on a napkin. Warren also ran into several hurdles while shooting the film. Most of the equipment used for the film was rented, Warren had to rush through as many shots as possible to finish the film on time, the camera he used could only record 32 seconds of footage at a time, and all sound effects and dialogue were dubbed later in post-production from Warren and a handful of other people. So, to paraphrase one of my movie buff friends, I have far more respect for Warren, who managed to create a film in spite of his inexperience and the hurdles he ran into than I do for Michael Bay, who has all the resources in the world, yet has churned out so many awful films throughout his career. If you look at the film through what's shown onscreen, you'll find a lot to criticize it for, but if you look at it through the lens of its historical context, it becomes rather interesting.

reviews.review_title: If you want to see how BAD a bad movie can be, then check this one out.
reviews.content: If you dare that is! This movie is just plain terrible!! "Manos" is without a doubt the worst movie ever. The plot is bad, the movie as a whole is an atrocity that is hard to witness. Sure, it does have a character in Torgo, but still even he can't save this crap even if he had a knee disfigurement, and a speech problem.The only WAY to watch this garbage is on MST3K. I own the episode on DVD, and enjoy it every time I watch it (since Joel, and the bots bashed it excellently). But don't watch it MST3K free, it's truly bad to watch without the riffing.This gets no stars. Could you blame me for my rating?

Some would have you believe that the best episode of the venerable MST3K series was the Manos: The Hands of Fate episode, I am quite afraid it was not.  They have absolutely nothing to work with and it shows, even Hobgoblins and Future War had unintentionally humorous moments that Mike and the Bots could capitalize off of. Joel, Tom, and Crow were not so lucky here, for Manos did not even manage that, it is bad in the same way a failed comedy is. The only laughs come from stunned disbelief at how truly hideous this films is and even those will fade as the movie wears on and on and on and on.As mentioned, the problem is that there is nothing to see in this film, nothing to laugh at or to spark the interest. Plan 9 From Outer Space was a bad film, but at least it had the benefit of being laughably inept.  Most bad horror films share this, as, if nothing else, you can always laugh at the poorly realized monster and cheesy plot. Manos, on the other hand, is just there.Is it the worst film of all time?  Probably not, there's bound to be something out there that is even worse; a few completed films were never even released because of how bad they were.Does it have the worst direction, acting, and production values ever? Doubtful, I am quite certain there is a student film out there somewhere that exceeds Manos in all of these categories.  Besides, the crew actually managed to turn the camera on.Is it the most loathsome film ever because of the ending?  Not at all, there are many German films out there after all and they are quite bad all the way through.No, Manos even refuses to excel at being the worst. Anybody who loves movies should see it though, just to see how not to make a movie, even a bad one.

reviews.review_title: Come on, you all love it too.
reviews.content: The funny thing, reading all these comments, is how much energy everyone is willing to put into commenting on the obvious flaws of a naively made piece of cinema, which contrasts with the fun tone of phrases like "I was vomiting for weeks..." In fact, I think you all enjoyed hating this movie nearly as much as I hate myself for enjoying Spielbergian garbage. It speaks to a subconscious level, it works as one of our dreams, to bring archetypal imagery to the foreground without the cumbersome logic of the waking mind. As one commentator observed, Manos was a labor of love, perhaps not a finely-crafted Impressionist painting, but a surprisingly effective Abstract combination of random paint splotches on canvass. Perhaps a movie like this tells the viewer more about himself than about the filmmaker.

Manos: The Hands of Fate is the story of a family who become lost while driving thought the West Texas desert and are menaced by a polygamous cult. It also a strong contender for the title of worst movie ever made. With glacial pacing, a threadbare plot, very little that could be described as acting, no real production values to speak of, and nothing remotely scary or exciting, it's a near perfect example of how not to make a movie.This makes a lot a lot of sense once you know the story behind the movie. You see, Manos was written, directed, and produced by an El Paso insurance salesman with no experience in film or acting, in order to win a bet that he could make a movie. He did this with a near zero budget, a cast of community theater volunteers and random townspeople, and the absolute minimum of editing and post-production work possible. He won his bet, but seeing the result, you'll seriously wonder if it was worth it.At least the first five minutes consist of the family driving aimlessly around the desert, passing the same amorous teenage couple again and again, in what may be the most pointless, meandering opening sequence ever put on film. Apparently, this was supposed to be a leisurely opening credits sequence, but the filmmakers ran out of money to add the credits, and just left it in to pad the runtime. It drags on and on, going nowhere, adding nothing to the story, until they finally reach the Master's house. Sadly, this brings very little improvement in plot or pacing.Instead we're mainly treated to slow, awkward conversations, aborted attempts to leave the Master's house for somewhere safer, and even more shots of that teen couple making out in their car. The closest thing this movie has to a high point is the extended catfight between the Master's nightgown clad wives, but even this gets boring after the first couple minutes. You know you're in trouble when you can't make gratuitous exploitation work.As with any bad horror movie, the characters spend far too much time wandering around looking for each other, calling out each other's names over and over with no reply. You wouldn't think it would take them so long to find each other in such a small house in the absolute middle of nowhere. Then again, it is pretty dark, and these people aren't very bright.Now the reason it's so dark is that in order to accommodate the cast and crew's day jobs, most shooting was done at night. Only they didn't have the budget for proper lighting, so most of the exterior scenes are pitch black. Hence the scene in which police hear gunshots, walk a few steps from their car to investigate, then turn around and give up because it's too dark to see anything. The lack of production values is even more apparent when one of the night scenes cuts to a piece of stock footage- instantly recognizable as such because it's better lit and photographed than any other part of the movie.If there is any redeeming value to this production beyond sheer camp, it's John Reynold's one of a kind performance as Torgo, the Master's slow talking, long suffering henchman and housekeeper. I'm not saying it's a good performance. In fact, it's about as far from anything resembling a good performance as can be imagined. But between his stilted, halting speech, jerking movements, and near constant facial tics, Reynold's acting is so awful, so creepy, in such a uniquely bizarre way, that it's almost hypnotic. Like a Beatnik version of Nic Cage, he's either manic or semi-comatose in every scene. No one could possibly be this terrible on purpose, and I was not at all surprised to learn that he was in fact a heavy drug user.The other performances are also uniformly bad, but aside from a few amusingly overwrought outbursts from the Master, only in the flat, boring manner of the entire movie. It's kind of amazing that it takes over ninety minutes for so little to happen, or that what's supposed to be a horror movie can be so utterly devoid of anything remotely scary. It does manage to be intermittently creepy, but only in all the wrong ways, as in the deeply unwholesome final scene, which I can only hope the filmmakers didn't realize the full undertones of.The whole thing is just an utter mess of earnest intentions colliding with woeful ineptitude, like Ed Wood minus the minor celebrities and special effects. It's slow, boring, disjointed, frequently bizarre, and completely botched on every imaginable level. If there is a lesson to this movie, it's that just because you can do something, it doesn't mean you should. I cannot recommend the original cut, even to the most committed bad movie lovers. However, I can recommend the Mystery Science Theater 3000 treatment, which makes for a rather amusing, relatively painless introduction to the cult of Manos.

reviews.review_title: Please make the pain go away!
reviews.content: Why isn't there a Zero on this voting thing? I have seen the ninth circle of hell and its name is Manos, Hands of Fate. Like many, I was introduced to this stinker by Mystery Science Theatre. Until that fateful viewing, I thought that MST3K could make any film enjoyable. By the time the movie (if you want to call it that) had run 5 minutes I knew that getting through this film would be the mental/ spiritual equivalent of draining the Gulf of Mexico with a bent straw. Don't get me wrong, I think that everyone should see this one, if only for the Bragging rights. "Forget Anzio, Never mind Iwo Jima. I've sit through Manos, Hands of fate"!!

I recommend only watching the Mystery Science Theatre 3000 version. The original is so stinky and smelly it is so...well... "It makes my prostrate weak and my bowels are full to bursting" Not only is the script comprised of well idiocy. It doesn't make sense. The whole thing didn't make sense. My head hurts so badly. I cant think anymore... Why was this movie made? Why!?!?! Seriously, only watch the MST3K version otherwise you will waste your time. They make it hilarious. Their silly banter and sarcasm makes it actually fun to watch. Why was this movie made again? What bet was made to make this movie? Did someone ever take this movie seriously?

This movie is SO bad, that it looks like it could have been made by an upstart manure salesman from El Paso with a sad little home-movie camera. Oh, wait...IT WAS.  (No offence to any manure salesmen...I'm sure some of them really do have talent.)Really, this little piece of film is so pathetic that it's questionable whether it even qualifies as a "movie."  The taglines didn't lie, though: it certainly is "shocking," and "beyond your imagination," how something this laughable managed to garner a release (complete with a "gala world premiere").The posters tease, "We defy you to guess the ending!...and ask you not to divulge it!"  They must have been talking about that question mark, which incidentally was the only truly scary part of the movie for what it suggested (you'll have to see the movie yourself to see what I'm talking about).

Is this THE worst movie ever made?  Maybe not, but it's certainly worse than "From Justin To Kelly".  But is it horrible?  Certainly.  Is it one of the finest MST3K outings ever?  Oh my, yes.  I think that this movie is really, really stupid.  It was filmed on what looked like a home video camera, featured horrible dubbing, some of the worst dialogue ever written anywhere (especially Torgo's), pretty bad acting, and so on.  The music is really disturbing, to say the least.  That stupid "haunting Torgo theme" is stuck in my head, and I've forgot all of the rest of it.  I don't know what else to say on this film that hasn't been said one hundred times before.  One star for "Manos", and ten for the MST3K version.

You know how great films get better with each viewing, because you see things you you hadn't noticed before?  Well, same with "Manos,  the Hands of Faith," except of course in reverse.The best thing about this thing is the comments.  I almost bust a gut from laughing at the spectacle of people struggling to convey their shock ("I didn't believe a movie could be that bad!"), pain ("My brain hurt"), disgust ("Can't think about it without retching"), scorn ("Hands, the Hands of Fate") frustration ("If I could give this a minus score, I would.") and pity ("I can understand why there were three suicides after this"), in order to describe this, this . . .Next is the debate over whether "Manos" is one of the worst or THE worst. No other possibilities.  When I think of other classics like Puma Man or Teenagers from Outer Space, I can understand how people of good will might disagree.Why don't we do this:  Whether or not "Manos, the Hands of Fate" is actually the Worst Movie in history, shouldn't we just go ahead and vote it "Number One," as the perfect paradigm of the bad movie?

reviews.review_title: A recipe for a really lame B-Movie.......
reviews.content: Take one Texas fertilizer salesman named Hal P. Warren to be the producer.  Add a bunch of unknown cast members, some of which soon be forgotten to oblivion.  Remove anything that would have the plot make some sort of sense.  Add 3/4 cup of a bad music and cheesy dialogue  Then add 1 full cup of a vacant location, plus an extremely low-budget.  Add 1/2 cup of senselessness and a story that wouldn't be even halfway scary.  Then add one inconvenient plot device named Torgo.  Let sit for 2 hours.  Makes 8 servings.  Results are disastrous!And that was the receipe for this inane B-movie, "Manos: The Hands of Fate".  In this B-movie tells a story of a family going on vacation, and ending up in a house that is presided by a half-man half-satyr named Torgo and his 'Master' who has a harem of wives, and together they are a supposedly evil devil worshipping cult.  I've heard that the guy who plays Torgo killed himself shortly after this film was complete.  Also, some of the actresses and Hal P. Warren himself committed suicide after the making of this movie.  It kind of makes you wonder if those people thought it was really worth it to kill yourself over a totally bad movie.The funniest scenes of the whole movie were then the wives were in a mutual fighting frenzy, and when they sacificed Torgo and as you can see, once his hand was burned off, he ran away as if nothing happened!Manos did indeed made a hilarious MST3K episode.  In fact it's one of the favorites, too.  It's almost impossible for me to recommend this lame horror movie of disastrous porportions to anyone, unless it's watched with Joel and the 'Bots.This movie really deserved to be bashed by the crew of the Satillite of Love!  My best advice would be to watch it with MST3K and hear them tell really funny jokes about this movie have a good laugh!

I am Hal's daughter, and I'd like to say a few things. First off, He NEVER tried to distance himself from the movie. He was proud of it, he enjoyed making it and thought it was great fun. He and his friend(s) didn't intend it to be the next great movie when they made it, but he would be pleased to no end that it has become the sensation it has. He always told us that it was intended to be thought of as a "bad grade B movie". He kept that major painting of the master and the dog, and he kept the Master's robe (wearing it on Halloween for many years). And he did not spend his life as a fertilizer salesman in Texas, in fact, not only did he not spend much time as a fertilizer salesman, he was only in Texas a few years. the last 16 yrs were in AZ (where he died the day after Xmas 1985) On to the movie itself, I rate it a 10. It WAS slow and diffcult to follow, but from what I understood from him, it was to be done for fun and it was, and since it made it to the screen and then became almost a cult film... it deserves it. You need to see it without MST3K add-ons. Joel and whats his face ruined the ambiance of the movie, distracting and hiding things. I understand that thats the purpose of MST3K, but still, watch it as it was intended. (its available on DVD now)

Sorry to disappoint the soft cotton candy and warm fuzzy world of most film-goers, but there are a vast spectrum of film out there. Just as in any art form, music, theatre, painting and.... yes, film.
This film was produced by people sincere in trying to make some entertainment, maybe a little personal fame and some recognition for  their community. Okay, so they failed.
The plot has been covered, with various levels of competence, no need to add anything to that, just a few observations and some background. The man who played Torgo, who everyone following the MST3K version laughs at for having "big knees" was actually in the costume of a satyr that he had made himself. If you had seen the real version (without fake theatre seats and characters covering the bottom fourth of the screen as in MST3K) you would have seen his cloven hooves, look at any rendition of a satyr and you will see the large animal-like thigh muscles. What was being tried with the Torgo character's knees was not just out of the blue, there was a method to the madness.
The man who played Torgo killed himself either just before the film was released or just after (reports vary). Apparently he had trouble with drugs and came from a very strict family. And this film was the only film work of the great majority of the cast, it was their one shot and they took it.
But yes, the film is fun to laugh at, it is inept and scattered. But in the laughing from your safe couch where no one expects anything of you, spare a thought for the heart that went into making a picture like this. And if you want to see the worst movie ever made that no one (even , gasp, MST3K) has ever heard of, see a film called "The Legend Of Blood Mountain", made about the same time in the Atlanta area.
Recommended with the proviso that you know that low-budget regional films like this are truly in a category of their own.

... was probably Casablanca. Or maybe Gone With The Wind. Perhaps one of Godfather or Star Wars movies. Whatever cinematic achievement holds this pinnacle in your personal top ten list, you'll almost certainly place the wretched "Manos: the Hands of Fate" at the other extreme.When a movie really and truly sucks, the actors and actresses are usually the last ones I blame, since even the best performers can't do much with a stupid plot, dumb premise, poor direction, and nonexistent continuity. But in this case the talent-deprived actors should have realized halfway through the project that they'd be better off having gone back to their day jobs, whatever they may have been. Are there any bright spots in this abyss? The only performer who displayed any recognizable talent was John Reynolds as Torgo. I write this under the assumption that the late Mr. Reynolds was not mentally handicapped, and that his pauses and stutterings were him desperately trying to bring his ill-conceived character to life. Even Joel and the 'bots, our fearless bashers of stupidity, had trouble making this movie entertaining. What's there to say about a movie that takes ten minutes of dialogue-less driving? The Ultimate Raspberry award goes to "Manos: Hands of Fate", which should be placed in the condemned spot of Worst Movie Ever.

reviews.review_title: Could be used to torture terror suspects at Guantanamo Bay
reviews.content: I only lasted through the first 20 minutes of it. It was that unbearable. Had I sat through the entire film, I may have suffered brain damage. I saw it on TV, which means I didn't have to pay for i, but I still wanted a refund. It is so repetitive, so noisy, so confusing, so incompetent, and so devoid of anything happening, forcing someone to sit through it could get a person charged with mental cruelty. I'm not sure what it was about, something involving a family on vacation who makes a wrong turn and winds up being captured by a pagan cult in the desert. Nor did I care. Sometimes, a bad film can be entertaining, but this was absolute torture. Some call this the worst movie ever made. It is certainly one of the most painful to watch.

reviews.review_title: Hideous, repellent fun for the whole family!
reviews.content: Words cannot describe this movie.  Ok, maybe they can, but they won't be very good words.  One probably could not print them in the newspaper. Everything about this movie reeks: the dubbed-in voices (they lost the original soundtrack), the repetitive dialogue, the huge-kneed Torgo (you will see if you watch, although don't take that as a recommendation to see this), and the stupid plot.  That isn't really a long enough list, but I don't think they would allow me to write the sheer amount of words it would take to describe how truly revolting this movie is in every way.  If you really, really want to torture yourself, and you have plenty of experience with other bad movies (it helps to have seen such cinematic masterpieces as Hobgoblins and Red Zone Cuba), then prepare yourself for one heck of a ride. (Well, not really, but I just like saying that, since my therapist says it will help the healing begin.)

By the way, this is not a compliment. It's shocking that the people who run movie theaters let it into movie theaters. This is definitely the worst movie ever made. I understand that there has been a fight between Manos and Monster a Go-Go for the title of the worst movie ever made. It's no contest, people! Manos wins!!! I know that there have been a lot of people who recommend just the MST3K version of this film. Please listen to them. They are right. Honestly, NOTHING happens at all! There's just some kissing, driving, and a bad stay at the "Master's" home. I mean what's up with that?!?! It's totally pathetic! What sort of person actually likes a pathetic horror movie ripoff. I mean horror is the lowest form of cinema entertainment. On a star scale of 0 to 4, this film deserves a NEGATIVE 4!!! Boring, boring, boring, boring, boring. To get this movie on MST3K DVD, get it on single disk or the Essentails, which also contains Santa Claus Conquers the Martians.

reviews.review_title: Could be good if redone without the unrivaled low production
reviews.content: Not the worst movie ever made but almost certainly a contender for worst production value. I can complain about how bad the film is but that seems fairly pointless since about 1000 people have already beaten me to it and while many of their gripes are unreasonable Manos doesn't deserve to be dubbed the worst film ever. Manos actually had a decent horror story to it and I think would have made a very good horror film but it suffered from an exceedingly low budget and abysmal production. The movie was an editing nightmare with such bad camera cuts it left me asking the question, what were they thinking? There were many other examples of what to avoid in film-making. There were long, tedious shots where virtually nothing occurred; superfluous panning of the open Texas range or simply watching characters stand silent for extended intervals as Torgo (very interesting character) hobbled around. But before I deal out unreserved criticism of this film, I make note of the fact that the technical aspect of its production was doomed to disarray due to the camera. According to IMDb, Manos was "Filmed entirely with a hand-held camera that could only record thirty-two seconds of film at a time. The film was shot without sound." No wonder they had such a hard time editing it. It is for this reason that the film is an editing disaster. It would be nearly impossible to produce anything remotely well with such a technical handicap. From a more conceptual perspective, Manos is an interesting idea and the film had a spooky quality to it. Like another user stated, awarding only one star to a film should be reserved for only the most inane of cinema, the kind of film that leaves the viewer angry at the sheer stupidity of the project. If you want examples, modern film-making has generously provided them. Films devoid of intelligence; movies made on large budgets, solely for monetary gain, generally just to capitalize off of some pop singer or pop culture icon (Paris Hilton for example) truly deserve the ridicule . Mano isn't a terrible concept, just an example of how technical barriers can cripple production.

reviews.review_title: And here I was, expecting something
reviews.content: When you first sit down to watch Manos, you should ask yourself whether or not you want to waste your time. Then you should decide "No. No I don't" and throw this movie out. No one should ever put themselves through this sort of unjustified torture. I don't care who you are or what you did.Out of focus, off frame, oddly lit, poorly acted, poorly scripted, and just plain poor. If you really want to subject yourself to this horror, and I mean you REALLY want to, then it's best served with some Mystery Science Theater 3000. Otherwise just inject some arsenic into your body. You'll get the same effect.

reviews.review_title: Like being lost with tired irritable kids in the car
reviews.content: Manos: The Hands of Fate is a strong contender for the worst movie ever made, though to be honest I think Zombie City is a hard act to beat.The film starts, and for a long time continues, with a car. The car drives along and people look out of the window. Now I'm not a total philistine and I don't mind a slow start but this is just unbelievable. There's a couple, their kid and their dog of which the dog is the only good actor. Conversations go around in circles, nothing happens.Then our vague family arrive at a villa which is inhabited by Torgo. Torgo is a bit like every monster sidekick in that he is deformed and just..well, wrong. He walks like he has a pair of brooms in his trousers preventing him bending his legs and the actor doesn't seem sure if he's supposed to be a hunchback or not. Torgo isn't very welcoming but they decide to stay there anyway despite lots of vague talk about the master and the master not liking visitors and so on.None of it really makes any sense but the meandering conversations ensure that any sense that existed floats away as the characters argue and talk in circles.This is really like being lost in a car with children that are overtired and irritable. You will get the exact same sense of exhaustion and irritability, unless that's what you look for in a film - and I really doubt it - or you just want to see how badly a film can be made then Manos is a movie to avoid.

I have found it. I have found it. The worst movie ever made. Ever. I do not honestly think anything is worse than Manos: Hands of Fate. There is nothing more painful that watching this moldy, disgusting reel of film. Well, besides having your fingernails torn out one by one while someone drills a three inch hole into your skull, but how often does that happen? Like, every two or three years, right? At least with that you can prepare for the horror. But this...holy mama of Moses. Okay, we are going to go step by step here, because that is the only way I can accurately describe how flicking horrible Manos can be:1) How about the fact that the first, oh, five hours of the movie is made up of the same damn travelogue footage of rolling hills and fields? I really felt the MST3K cast's pain as they just stared in awe at the screen saying, "So...Manos. The Hands...of Fate. Yep."2) Almost all of the dialogue seems to be dubbed because none of the actors' lips match the voices. This is not a Japanese movie for crying out loud! Just re-shoot the film a bit!3) None of the characters are at all appealing. At least Batwoman had a cool costume. The wife moans and whines for her hubby, who is a jerk, and the little girl is simply grating. "Mommy, I'm scared! Mommy, I'm cold! Mommy..." oh kill me!4) The entire movie's soundtrack is easy-listening jazz. Yep, even the horror parts are set to the sounds of sax-a-maphones and obo-maboes. I caught snippets of an insanely high-pitched woman screaming the lyrics to some song, but she was so bad I could not understand them.5) Torgo is the movie's saving grace. With his pilloesque knees and tittering voice, he is just perfect cannon fodder for the bots and Joel. He even has his own stupid theme music! Yes!!!6) The camera work is plain awful. None of the characters are in frame half the time, which the bots point out many times.7) Oh, and here is the kicker. Most of the time the actors are seen just standing around. Just standing. Not doing anything. ARRRGH! But this does prompt the best line from Joel: Do something!8) The ending is supposed to be all cool and mysterious (they even do the God forsaken The End? gimmick after the final credits), but in execution it is just the nail in the coffin. I give Manos: The Hands of Fate 0.000000000000000000 out of 4 stars.WATCH AT YOUR OWN RISK PEOPLE!

Let me 'splain. No, that'll take too long, let me sum up. Some movies are so bad, they are good, and this is one of them. It is a painfully poor movie, with a horrid script and bad acting, but that's part of the charm of this shlock sci-fi thriller. Of course, if you can see the MST3K version, I would recommend you do (Mentos, the mints of fate!). May Torgo become as beloved a character for you as he is for me.(Note: I ranked this movie as 2 out of 10. I may sing it's praises, but it's still a bad movie)

I, like most of the other commenters here, saw "Manos: The Hands of Fate" because of its MST3K fame.  Well, I warn all who are planning to see this movie, do NOT do so on a full stomach, and do not attempt to operate heavy machinery afterwards.  For this is truly one of the worst movies ever made; as opposed to the much maligned "Plan 9 From Outer Space" which at least is goofy fun.There is very little goofy about "Manos."  The movie is horrible. Terrible. Awful.  Wretched.  A pox on the entire concept of cinema.  I cannot imagine possibly stomaching this movie without the help of the SOL crew.  As it is, I can rarely sit through the entire disaster in one sitting, opting to break it up.  The movie is short, and yet you will not believe how long it feels when you watch this movie.  Time seems to dialate.  It is truly incredible.I noticed a lot of people said that they "wondered what they were thinking" when they made "Manos." Frankly, I don't want to know, for fear that whatever dreadful specter possessed the people making this movie be loosed upon us once more.  The one item of interest is the fascinating Torgo character, who for some inexplicable reason, has big knees.  He stumbles around, mumbles, and shakes.  Somehow he is also evil.  Go figure.This movie is truly a freak show; deplorable, and yet we cannot look away.

There is nothing at all redeeming about this horrendous travesty of a film. The acting is poor, the story lame, the sets lousy and the sound awful. I ponder the reasons any cast member other than Hal Warren agreed to take on such roles. Surely they read the script before hand. How could they ever think this film would be something somebody would want to watch. I've read that the city of El Paso held a gala premier for this awful film. Did they know nothing of the script or production? If one reads how actors in the film snuck out of the theatre at it's premiere, one must conclude that all involved in the production had blinders on during the making of the film. Was Hal Warren was such a feared tyrant of a director that no actor or crew member dare suggest a dialogue be reworked or a scene re-shot? Maybe the entire crew (including Hal Warren) thought they were making something great. I know nothing of Hal Warren besides his career selling fertilizer. I must admire the fact that Hal Warren somehow convinced a distributor to distribute this film and had the city of El Paso hype it up for him. I even heard he had other ideas. Maybe another effort behind the camera would have been much better as Hal Warren learned from the mistakes made in Manos The Hands of Fate. It would have been a great opportunity because the film presents every mistake a film maker can make.UPDATE 2009- I was in a low budget film produced in my hometown. Well, they only gave me the pages from the script that involved my scene. I did not get to see the rest and assumed the rest was a "good movie". I was wrong. It was a confusing collage of action scenes and dialogue. Maybe a few actors in "Manos" can explain away their participation as having been involved in a situation similar to mine. Also, my hometown hosted a grand premiere at the city's most elegant theater. I guess getting municipalities to give poor films shot within their city limits unworthy premieres is more common than most would think.

Well. I posted one time, quite a while back, but I find that i lack the rich text that I could add to insulting (literally) the worst movie that was ever made. This movie was made on a bet by a fertilizer salesman, named Hal Warren. It doesn't surprise me that he didn't ask for Hollywood's help either...He wrote the screenplay rough draft. He directed. He did all of the (craptacular!) "special effects". What more can I say. He did a fine job.Of making himself look like a complete idiot.Maybe it's just a coincidence that he died of cancer.This movie lacks plot, characteristics, note-worthy actors. (If you look up the stats of the actors, you might notice that none of them were in any other movies. I wonder why.) It also lacks rich text, (...and sound), intelligent dialog, and actors that don't count bugs all day.This movie was introduced to me by a friend (who sarcastically said that it was good.) I borrowed it from him... and I must say this is the first movie to drive me to the point of not knowing whether to cry, or to laugh hysterically. I did a bit of both.I cannot refrain from lecturing the people who've seen this god awful excuse for a movie that they can still repent for wasting 70 something minutes of their time by going to see a movie that's actually good.If I ever get married and have children... I'm not going to use this as a family movie. This movie will be to punish my kids.They should change the name of the movie from "'Manos' the Hands of Fate" to "'Manos' who wrote this crap?" Rated: for alienated degenerates only.

reviews.review_title: Dedicated to the watchers of bad media
reviews.content: One good thing to come out of bad movies is the comments that people write here on IMDB, you could get more laughs per minute perusing the bottom 100 films than watching a good comedy film. And of course we wouldn't appreciate good films nearly as much if there weren't terrible films sitting on video store shelves and being screened on TV.

UK readers won't know what MST3K is, I've just imported Manos and can now tell you. Imagine you've rented a really bad movie, and you're watching it with a few friends, drinking a few beers and everyone's making quips about the film, well in MST3K you get this commentary of jokes about the film in the gaps in the dialogue.
