The commentary is really funny, but I feel a bit cheated that I couldn't enjoy the real awfulness of the original film. I believe that there's a DVD with both versions about. What's wrong with the film? Repeated inexplicable silences when nothing happens, the appalling acting from Torga, the failure to make it any way frightening, it's a kind of sub-Hammer Horror film. The kissing couple who are at it for 20 hours or so, the police who are also on duty day & night, people walk in front of the camera!!. The plot however does hang together, the teenagers & police are an element of the plot. None of the actors (AFAIK) ever appeared in any other film. This was obviously just a low budget film, my idea of a bad film would be a turkey like Independence Day.

reviews.review_title: It's not Lysastrata, but I like it
reviews.content: I've been telling everyone for years that manos was the worst film ever made.  i showed it to my niece, who wouldn't believe me that this movie actually seems to be about five hours long, rather than it's actual MST3K running time of 90 minutes.  After she watched it, she turned to me and said:"You're absolutely right."  This is the most painful, awful, horrible movie I have ever seen.  I wanted to shoot Hal Warren in the head a couple of times for writing, producing, directing and starring in this turd of a movie. I'm not surprised that some of the cast killed themselves-if I'd made this movie, I think I would have killed myself, too. There isn't a rating low enough to encompass this dreadful miscarriage of a movie.  I'll have to go with a 1.

'Manos' is definitely a poorly made movie, but I just cannot bring myself to say that it is the worst of all time.  I feel that it was one of those things that slips through the cracks or cheats its way into the public consciousness.  'Manos' has a lot things that shout amatuer filmmaking -- but it successfully brings to the screen a story and yes it has a plot.  I am not going to sum this movie up like so many other people do.  The plot is simple, a family encounters something dark and horrific.  The problem that so many people have with this movie is the lame script, disasterous sound effects, the muted color, and the meandering plot.  You know what, that is comparable to a lot of people's opinions.  Say what you may, but I have seen so many "works of artistic expression" that are the equivalent to 'Manos.' Yet, these people were constantly lied to about how great their poem, short story, painting, etc. was.  It was the level of amatuer that kept these pieces of artistic expression from the public eye.  As stated before, 'Manos' just simply slip through the cracks.  Also, it did not try to exploit me, say like a _Gigli_ or _Batman and Robin_. 3 out of 10 stars

reviews.review_title: The worst 'movie' I have ever watched.
reviews.content: I bought this movie on DVD. Well, not exactly: I bought the MST3k version, and I must complain about one thing: the absence of the uncut version in the same DVD. I would have liked to see the whole thing without Joel & the Bots to have a better idea of how horrible it really is. I even don't know if it's possible to find the original Manos, anyway.Nevertheless, I have no doubt that this film is the worst one I have ever had the 'pleasure' to watch.But I have to point something important: this film is an amateur film, although it was released in a theater. It's uncommon to see an amateur film get into a cinema theater. Maybe that's the reason why it's so bad. It's like a third division soccer team playing at the first division, it's like my local basketball team playing at the NBA. It's a matter of mathematics that it will go right to the bottom. There must be lots of amateur movies even worse than Manos, but they will never be shown at a theater, so they will never be known and rated. Manos is an exception, and MST3k has a lot to do with the film's immense popularity.In a few words, I must admit that this is the worst film I have ever watched, but I also must admit that it's just an exceptional amateur movie which had a lot of luck to be picked by Joel & the Bots.

Almost a rival for Plan 9 From Outer Space as worst movie ever.  One of those movies that you just have to shake your head at and wonder how on Earth the flick got made.  What else can you say about this movie except what MST3K said?  "Manos, the.... hands of fate."

For decades, until this movie was discovered by the show Mystery Science Theatre 3000, ( a small cult comedy show that forces its lead character to watch really, really, REALLY bad movies ) no one was aware of the absolute horridness of this movie. But now, cult film fanatics, fans of the show, and film critics alike have almost unanimously dubbed this film "the worst movie ever made."But what makes it so bad? Let's see: corpse-like emotionless acting ( except perhaps Torgo who is the best character the movie has to offer ), the worst editing I've ever seen ( and I've been editing high-school DV videos for 4 years ), audio dubbing reminiscent of old Godzilla movies, and a script that makes "poorly-constructed" seem insignificant, for starters. I gave it a 2 just because of the possibility that the filmmakers weren't serious and that it has maybe one or two good transitions/ideas.Plot summary: you know the drill, lost family in the desert winds up at a house where they need to spend the night with a weird housekeeper named Torgo who guards the place while the "master" is away. Things get worse and worse until they discover that it is home to a dark cult who worships a deity known as Manos. Throw in some bad plot deviations such as teenage romance and feminine competition... it's so fragmented it's impossible to do an accurate plot summary.Bad? Definitely. Fun to watch? Absolutely. I recommend the MST3K version though, or else you might just consider suicide, as that is exactly what 4 of the people involved in the making of this movie, including John Reynolds (Torg ) did after its release. No, I'm not kidding. Oh, and not to mention, the commentary is hilarious. In the case of a worldwide nuclear crisis, all United States missiles and those of friendly nations calibrate their weapons on the town of El Paso for allowing this movie to be made in their town.The End ?

What can be said about "Manos: the Hands of Fate?"  "Manos" is simply the worst piece of cinema ever made.  Bad color, half-ass sound dubbing, a written on the fly script, and really pathetic acting make this barely viewable.I would "only" watch the Mystery Science Theater version, otherwise you might risk serious nerve damageThey should show "Manos" to prisoners.

Why, it must be Manos: Hands of Fate, whatever the fek that means!; a movie about I don't know what, starring who the hell cares!  This movie has got to be one of the worst ever commented on by Joel and the 'bots.  Compared to this, movies like The Brain That Wouldn't Die and Angel's Revenge almost seem coherent.  Fortunately, sometimes the worst movies make for the best MST3K episodes.  Joel Hodgson and his robot pals are in top form here.  Joel and co. never skip a beat throughout the entire uh, movie (for lack of a better word), unlike some other stinkers reviewed by MST3K where, during some stretches, a sort of lull is reached and even the cast is helpless to make the show endurable; that's not the case with MHOF.  Hats off to MST3K.

reviews.review_title: You have to see it to believe it!
reviews.content: Words can not describe this film.  You have to see it for yourself.  If you value your life, you will see the MST3K version.  Its difficult to choose the worst film ever made, but this has my vote.  The people at Best Brains, which makes MST3K, said in the series guide that this was the must disgusting film in the show's history.  Considering that they have probably seen more bad films than anybody(I mean its their job!), it probably has a better claim to the title of worst film ever than anything else.  I certainly haven't seen anything worse.

I ought to convey the impact of Manos, its vital importance, and fan the flames of MANOS. OH! The great meaning MANOS consequently give to one! If desire to open ones mind, to view without elite, bias, stubborn, and easily influenced eyes, necessary. Bleakness shines through IMDb ratings, encouraging or rather discouraging viewing MANOS! I FIGHT BACK! I presume the ratings done that of distasteful, disrespectful, and with a dash of repugnance. (In relation to Manos being in the top 100 worst films of all time.) I am more than keen on Manos; this film is in the top ten of my personal favorite films. The character TORGO (rip) will for eternity stay in my spirit, psyche, and core. Thinking of him encourages an excited fuel of happiness to fire up into my heart and convey through sounds of laughter. Torgo plays character that of a horrendous monster; the deformities Torgo contains still disturb my psyche. THE END?

reviews.review_title: The Movie So Bad They Named It Twice
reviews.content: I'm sure someone's already mentioned this, (and I'm not going to take the time to read all 600 odd reviews on here), but the translation of the title of this film is Hands: The Hands Of Fate. Yeah. Makes a lot of sense, don't it? If you're reading this, you've probably read from other reviewers about how much of a stinker this film is. So, I'm not even going to talk about it. I certainly won't talk about the the countless continuity errors. I'm definitely not going to talk about the endless driving sequences, awkward silences, and satanic wife wrestlers. And I sure as heck ain't gonna say anything about Torgo. Just take the advice of EVERY other reviewer, and don't watch it. However, if you must, only watch the MST3K version. You know what? I think I will talk about Torgo a little bit. After all, he's the only part of the whole movie that made me give it that one extra star. He's truly unforgettable. Name me one... well, better make that one thousand... more memorable characters in cinematic history. Bet you can't do it!(Well, maybe you can. Actually, yeah, you probably can.Unless Manos is the only film you've ever seen.)

The first 15 to 30 minutes of the movie with the couple driving around lost was mind numbing.  When TV's Frank and Dr. Clayton Forrester apologize to Joel, you know this has to be the most unbelievably awful movie of all time. If by chance you watch this waste of time you will be shaking your head in shock for years to come.  I would put my name but I don't want anybody to know that I actually watched the entire movie.

Do not watch this movie without Joel, Crow, and Tom Servo. This movie is so bad that my wife, an independent film producer, uses it as an example of what NOT to do when making a movie. The acting is almost as bad as it gets. Mark Spitz would not have been out of place acting in this. There is very little logic in any of the characters. The sound track is pretty awful. The camera work has no dimension to it. And the story??? Why? One sad note - the guy who played Torgo killed himself shortly after this films release. Is that some kind of comment on how bad this film is? Perhaps. Nevertheless, I own this movie simply because it is so bad - but like I said I have the gang at MST3000 assisting me through this nightmare which they manage to make a rather entertaining cult favorite.

Mano's isn't a bad film. really. it all depends, of course, on how one defines a "bad" film. as far as i am concerned, a "bad" film is one that is boring and/or annoying/disturbing. Mano's kept my attention and didn't really contain anything that i found annoying or disturbing. Harold p warren wasn't much of a film maker, but he somehow managed to maintain the narrative flow in this picture. he is continually throwing something at us that is freaky and/or entertaining. (albeit, i am a b film fanatic and a lover of horror films. if i see a film of this type, i WANT to like it. i TRIED to like Mano's, giving the film every benefit of the doubt, and i succeeded.) now, there is much in this movie that a film school instructor would rate as amateurish and technically inept. but within the context of Mano's, this amateurishness and incompetence WORKS. incompetent cinematography, art direction, and editing can have their charms, and in Mano's they definitely DO have their charms. Robert guider's idiosyncratic photography definitely has its charms. he shot using a hand wound sixteen millimeter camera. as a result, he comes up with some delightfully unusual effects. the film's color scheme is interesting. one could dismiss the cinematography as b movie hackwork, but that would be too cruel. the technical "lapses" actually help to create the funky, grungy atmosphere that is essential to the film's "success." (and i contend, uncynically, that it IS a "success.") tom Newman designed the sets, and these are sets of a kind that one is unlikely to find in a Hollywood motion picture. the "funky"/"grungy" aesthetic of the cinematography is echoed in the set design. the film takes place in the desert, at the roadside compound of a polymerase, polytheistic cult. the members of the cult are funky, grungy people. bohemians who have chosen to live off the beaten path, in frankly offbeat surroundings. and these surroundings have a charm of their own. one might think of the master and his cult as progenitors of the Manson family. if you want to imagine what the decor in Mano's is like, imagine a compound whose rooms have been decorated by members of the Manson family. the scrappy editing adds to the fun. smooth, "professional" editing would not have worked on Mano's. but the rough- Hew editing of Ernie smith and James a Sullivan succeeds brilliantly. the choppy, idiosyncratic cutting seems to bring out the power in the film (or whatever power the film possesses). (Sullivan served as production manager on the "eye creatures." he was the assistant director on "zontar: the thing from Venus." he was unit manager on "curse of the swamp people" and he actually directed the john agar starred "night fright." these are all "good" pictures, as far as i am concerned. and as far as i can ascertain, James Sullivan's contributions to these films were effective. the man knew what he was doing. even if he didn't know what he was doing, what he was doing WORKED.) all in all, the cinematography, set design, and editing of Mano's conspire to create a dark, evocative mood. think of Mano's as a "mood piece." in that light, the mood that Mano's creates is an interesting one. Mano's is a funky, grungy trip to an imaginary place located somewhere in roadside America. it succeeds at what it attempts. even if it succeeds in a way unforeseen by its creators, nonetheless Mano's is a film that succeeds in creating and maintaining a distinctive atmosphere. what more should one ask of a motion picture?

reviews.review_title: The fact that this movie was made because of a bet should tell you something...
reviews.content: "Mystery Science Theater 3000" has always been one of my favorite shows, so when I heard about the infamous "Manos, the Hands of Fate" episode, I rented it from Blockbuster just to see what all the fuss was about. Well... This is officially the WORST movie I've ever seen. It's not just mediocre, it's terrible. Acting, script, cinematography, direction was all laughably bad. The story also made no sense: A weirdo cult leader lives in the woods? Whatever. I had a great time listening to Joel, Crow, and Tom Servo trash the movie, but this particular butt of their mockery is definitely bad. To be sure, "MST3K" has always featured some of the worst Hollywood has to offer, but this one takes the cake for it's sheer awfulness. If you feel the urge to see this film (which I sincerely hope you don't), see the "MST3K" episode with it. You just cannot sit through this film without the guys trashing it. It is just not possible. My Rating: -1,000

reviews.review_title: The Curse of Manos The Hands Of Fate
reviews.content: Hal must have angered the Gods when making this tripe. The same year this was made, the actor who played Torgo committed suicide. Not convinced? The actress that played Marget also took her own life right after. Was it mere shame, or the Curse of Manos?

I'll agree that *Manos* is an awful piece of work, and (as stressed in many of these comments) made only barely watchable through the rose-tinted lens of MST3K.  But there's also something profoundly creepy about this film. You have to stop for a minute and think: at some point, a bunch of people gathered together and thought it would be a good idea to release this. How severely messed up were these individuals?Also: was this movie cursed?  According to imdb, two of the leads committed suicide the same year this movie was released.  Sure, we could make lots of cheeky comments like "Hey, who wouldn't?" but it's really bizarre when you give it a minute's thought.Ugh, I'm giving myself chills.  It's better just to think of this as simply a very bad movie and not as some weird satanic suicide ritual.

I'd heard of Manos but only just recently got around to finally viewing it. And yes, in the bad movie department it doesn't disappoint. While worse than Plan 9 From Outer Space, it's still not as bad as Monster-A-Go-Go. And of course to make this movie worth watching you should watch the MST3K version.The acting is horrendous, the lighting is poor, the sound is bad, and the video a bit fuzzy. Typical for amateur, low-budget movie efforts. Also typical for low-budget movies is the plot. Travelers get lost, find a group of weirdos, then try to escape from said weirdos. Tell me you haven't heard that one before. And yet another typical amateur low-budget mistake are many scenes which seem to go nowhere, along with confusing plot lines. But you have to see the Master's wonderful cloak.Interspersed with the plot are a couple of policemen who don't seem too keen to investigate anything except for the couple who seem to be interested in making out in a sports car 24/7.If there is one bright spot in this cinematographic dungheap is that the character of Torgo really did come off as creepy. I understand reading the trivia was that the actor was on LSD at the time which caused his twitchy, out-of-it behavior. That's not to say that the part was good or that he was a good actor, though, but you really wouldn't want to spend the night with Torgo. I can understand why this movie bombed at the premier and why it's consistently been rated as one of the worst movies in history.

reviews.review_title: Calling it worst would be praise
reviews.content: After reviewing my previous statements, I have decided to write my comment from scratch.Manos: The Hands of Fate was the result of a bet, where fertilizer salesman Harold P. Warren assured that he could produce a film with an extremely small budget. What happened later has become an infamous legend.These "moving images" (I shall not call it "movie"), have a purposely plot regarding a small family of a husband, a wife and a daughter (oh, and a poodle) that are set to drive to the Valley Lodge, but are mysteriously drifting away from all known road and led into a strange semi-abandoned house. The house, as is later revealed, is inhabited by a "Master", who is also the leader of a polygamous cult that worships the god "Manos".If you have never seen it or you've only heard the stories, you'd probably think "Hey, it can't be that bad". "The Premise sounds promising". "There must be worst movies than this one".Well, let me say that you have thought wrong! The stories are true.I'll state that what I saw was the family friendly version (MST3K), for if someone should see it without Joel, Servo and Crow, it could cause brain damage to the poor soul who ventured.Have you ever seen a slow sequence in a movie, where nothing happens? All of those are non stop action packed compared to the opening driving of "Manos": 15 minutes of driving through the countryside. That's it. There are a few remarks by the lead star (Mr. Warren) saying that "the sign pointed this way" and some key changes in the background music, but that's the most exciting part of the whole scene. You might think that the countryside is beautiful or at least the photography is interesting. None of the above.Harold (Hal for short) P. Warren wrote the "screenplay", was the producer, the director and the lead star. Having said that, there are four tasks that he proved himself incompetent by far, beyond known borders.The "script" is the worst I have ever heard in my entire lifetime (and I thought ID4 was bad). The dialog is so repetitive that it's sickening. "The master wouldn't approve!" is said by Torgo (I'll get to him in a minute) at least 7 times in the same scene. And making it "worst" (if it would be possible), the camera couldn't pick up sound, so the voices were re dubbed by Warren and others (not the original cast).The inability of sound would make a clack board useless, as basic film-making teaches. Still, one of such boards is clearly seen in one of the scenes, swiftly leaving the frame but not edited out (nice work there. editor).As for the family's story, they're all stuck (willingly) inside a creepy house with satyr Torgo (he wears metal rigging under his legs, but somehow he put them on wrong, making his knees enormous), who "takes care of the place while the Master is away". Torgo's speech impediment has so many times explained the family that "the master wouldn't approve" their presence. He inconspicuously reveals to the mother his feelings towards her. He tries to grope her hair, making it one of many disturbing scenes found abroad.There is so much to say about this colossal anti-epic, there is not enough paper in the world to write a review worthy of it. You do feel horror, but not for the "scary" sequences. Calling it worst would be praise. If you look for "incompetent" in the dictionary, you will find the poster for "Manos". The background music, including the "haunting Torgo theme", is mind numbing and stressing, sounding like Antonio Carlos Jobim's worst nightmare. The scream "Mike, Mike!" coming from the woman playing the wife, is the worst piece of acting I have ever witnessed. So many movies are bad, so many movies are worse, only one is the worst of them all. It makes all porn scripts seem like literary classics. It makes "Plan 9 from Outer Space" the equivalent to "The Godfather". It makes "Gigli" Oscar worthy. It makes "Ballistic" the greatest action movie ever made.As much as I hate to admit it, it has grown on me. You may be shocked to read this: I LOVE IT!!!!!. But, some may wonder "if he loves it so much, why doesn't he rate it 10?" Well, I may be crazy, but I'm not stupid. "Manos" deserves a -100, and the only reason I give it a 1 is because it's the lowest rating in IMDb you can give.So many big-budget no plot movies have been said to be the worst ever. Whoever says this obviously looks away to certain redeemable aspects of the movie. Whether it had good actors, a good story that was handled carelessly, a nice musical score, state of the art visual effects, a particular sequence that you enjoyed, good camera work, something. "Manos: The Hands of Fate" has none. Seriously. No effort was put into this thing to make it work, either as a horror, suspense thriller or any kind of movie. Nothing! If someone has called you a mediocre director, a wannabe writer, a failure as a producer, a charmless actor or something similar, whoever has called you that obviously has never seen or heard about "Manos" (and lived to tell the tale).If you're still skeptical, if you think you can handle it, if you just can't believe a movie is so bad or if you're a masochist who knows what he's going for, then there's no other choice to you than seeing it. But, one last warning, it's not for the faint of heart, stomach or brain, and it Will leave you scarred (and that's with the MST3K version).

Where do I start with this one? There's not a single thing about this that prevents it from being one of the worst films I've ever seen.The amount of technical problems become very clear very quickly. The painfully obvious continuity errors, the awful overdubbing (which was supposedly done my three people - voicing all the actors in the film), the abysmal acting and the fact that the film is a complete bore (despite its runtime of just over an hour).I mean, this film isn't even worthy of a 'so-bad-it's-good' status. It really is that bad.However, the Torgo character is definitely intriguing especially after reading up on John Reynolds (the actor who plays Torgo) which explained many things about his character.Overall, I think Manos is better studied than enjoyed since the latter is virtually impossible.1/10

reviews.review_title: Beat yourself with a blunt object
reviews.content: First off this is one of the great MST3k episodes, but strangely this movie is so bad I still felt sick afterwards.....Torgo and his theme are hilarious, but you are far stronger than I copuld ever dream of being if you can watch this one alone, uncut....I would bow to you as my god, in fact...This movie came from Hell I'm sure of it...

I used to think "Plan Nine from Outer Space" was the worst, but "Manos" is much worse. I saw the "MST3000" version and even the robots had trouble keeping up with this terrible film. This one gets my vote for the all time worst. Just plain awful, and the ending really sucked.

reviews.review_title: Hard to compare a movie that cost $20,000 to make with one that cost $200 million.
reviews.content: The movie is far from being the worst movie ever made in consideration of the cost to make it and comparison to the 100 to 200 million dollar farces the studios are putting out today. Ignoring all its shortcomings it is interesting enough to watch to the end and ask yourself what the £@#$ was that. This is another movie where the background story on how the movie was made is more interesting than the movie itself.

reviews.review_title: You've heard it before, but here it is again
reviews.content: I'm sure you've read other reviews of this movie. Having seen the movie myself, I can safely say that it is true what they say about this movie being the worst in cinematic history.I heard about this movie from a friend, he then showed it to a few other friends. The verdict was unanimous. "It was the worst film in cinematic history".Now, I've heard this phrase a few times, but the look of sheer stun and shock in their eyes told me that this time, it was for real. So my friend shows me the movie, and I feel like I've learned something about the world. You know, the way that third -orld criminals learn something when they have their eyes gouged out.This movie is a must-see for anyone who has an under appreciation for movies. The phrase "at least it wasn't Manos" will become the new norm.I'm usually pretty generous with movies. I work in a theater and see films for free on the big screen on opening night (or later if the former statement is not possible). I've even come to appreciate Steven Seagal's career as a result of Manos.It isn't possible to explain WHY it's such a bad movie, I guess the only real purpose of this review is to help put Manos back on the top of the worst 100 list. Back where it belongs.See it, and you too be awed at shocked at what is without question the reigning lord of all terrible movies.

reviews.review_title: Watching this film was the peak of my petty existence
reviews.content: A true masterpiece of cinema, Manos will not disappoint. From the breathtaking views of the gorgeous, sprawling countryside to the terrifying horrors inflicted by the dark and nefarious Master, few things in life can match the visual and auditory splendor that is Manos (Hands):The Hands of Fate. I wouldn't want to spoil even a single delicious morsel of this, the epitome of cinematic storytelling, but I must say that watching this movie is the most fear-inspiring experience that any person, being, or object could ever possibly have. Written, directed, and produced by fertilizer salesman Harold Warren as the result of a bet and featuring REAL FOOTAGE of a snake from a Disney nature documentary, Manos is truly a work to behold.If you are ever granted even the slightest, minuscule possibility to have even a tiny, insignificant fraction a chance to maybe conceivably see this movie, then TAKE IT! No matter what the cost, no matter what you would lose, YOU MUST TAKE IT! Nothing that could happen to you would ever top the experience of seeing this movie! I would give up everything I have if it meant i could see even part of Manos for the first time again! Seriously. Drop whatever your doing and watch it. It's worth it.I can't wait for the sequel.

I must say that I have seen many stupid movies in my life, but Manos the Hands of Fate is by FAR the worst movie I have ever seen. I once thought Invasion of the Neptune Men was the worst, but no...this is IT! About halfway thru the movie most normal people would break out in a cold sweat and laugh uncontrollable at the stupidity they are witnessing. I also give Troll 2 a notable tip of the hat for being downright stupid (but it was so stupid it was somewhat entertaining). However, if you really want the bottom of the barrel, look no further than this movie. This has to be the crown jewels of bad movies! Good luck!

reviews.review_title: "Let me get your complimentary crazy bread..."
reviews.content: I've seen Hobgoblins, Time of the Apes, The Pod People, The Beast of Yucca Flats, Red Zone Cuba, Skydivers, Eegah, Mitchell, The Creeping Terror, Parts:  The Clonus Horror, The Girl in Gold Boots, The Wild Wild World of Batwoman, The Amazing Colossal Man, Cave Dwellers, The Sidehackers, The Brain That Wouldn't Die, Phase IV, The Crawling Eye, The Crawling Hand, Bloodlust, etc.  Never before have I witnessed such inept "filmmaking" in my entire bad-film watching career.  Despite Joel and the 'bots frequently hilarious banter, Manos somehow manages to pull ahead and, by the end laps the Satellite of Love by producing more pain than laughs. Now, to describe the plot......... um, well, there's this guy driving forever and he's supposed to be doing something.  Then, there's this LSD-driven "guy" who has big knees, and he kind of interacts with this black robed Frank Zappa, who happens to have a dozen or so "wives" who wear next to nothing and tend to get into big mud-wrestling brawls.  Then, these people drive and act stupidly and then other people drive to exactly the same place.   It took months of therapy and multiple viewings to gather that synopsis for your reading pleasure.  If you do view this on MST3K, then stay tuned through the very end for a hilarious encounter with Torgo, who now works at TORGO'S PIZZA (with free crazy bread!).

reviews.review_title: Similar to a Kenneth Anger movie... (SPOILERS?)
reviews.content: ...in that blurry color and 16mm film are used, and that the plot makes no sense unless you read the director's comments on the film. The only problem with "Manos" is that one-shot director Harold P. Warren thought that the film spoke for itself. I mean, it should: a 1966 family is out on vacation in their black `65 Ford. Dad can't find the Texas hotel they have reservations at, Mom can't read a map, the daughter terrorizes the family poodle the whole way there. After meandering around an empty field they find a small, cheaply painted sign: "Valley Lodge." The follow the rutted path until they come upon a tiny ranch house managed by this greasy white guy in a floppy hat and mechanic's overalls. This is Torgo, the stuttering and squeeky-voiced servant of the Master, who isn't seen until the final reel. From then on, the movie sticks with every devil-cult movie cliche known to man: the car won't start, the dog is killed mysteriously, somehow the couple stumbles on to the ceremonial area used by the cult, a Satanic religious service is shown, people are killed, and the family never leaves. There is also some sleaze with Torgo wanting Warren's screen wife because the Master (who wears a massive black cape with red hands and resembles Bill Buckner) has a harem, collected God knows how. This sort of tired stuff can work (See the Karloff and Lugosi flick "The Black Cat" for proof) if the right atmosphere is struck, if the acting is right, and if the beginning is slightly plausible. The vibe "Manos' gives off at the start is like an educational film on freeways or farming, though the viewer could think they have stumbled on to a real snuff film. Having all the voices dubbed by three people also breaks the atmosphere, as does repeating lines, the background score (either canned music, or people noodling on pianos, guitars, and flutes), and the overlit set. Certainly the place is grimy enough to be a horror movie set, but it looks like what it is, the guest house of a ranch. Besides all these other defects, the pacing is totally shot, and plot-holes abound (Why don't they notice that the Master is sleeping on a rock in the back yard until night? Why does Hal have a gun?)Some final jabs: Only the guy who played Torgo killed himself, and that was an O.D. "Manos" did play at a movie theater in El Paso (around which the film was shot) and the cast sneaked out on the opening night afraid to face their friends in the audience, who were laughing their heads off. Warren died before the movie was torn to shreds by MST3K. He did want to redub the movie as a joke, but it went out on a nationwide run (which probably lasted two weeks) as it was before sinking into oblivion.Personally, I don't know who is the worst director: Hal Warren, Ed Wood, Coleman Francis, Bill Rebane, or the guy who shot "Battlefield: Earth."

reviews.review_title: Nice Cars & Pretty Women - Lousy Movie
reviews.content: There's so much to say about this movie from Torgo's extra eyebrow and messed-up legs - well, Torgo is just plain messed-up. I love the now classic cars. Diane Adelson as Margaret is a lousy actor, like everyone else in this movie, but at least she's attractive even though she can't seem to run for more than a minute at a time without falling and whining. The poor little girl lost her doggie, and all her dad can do is tell her to shut up. There's a lot more, but it's not worth rehashing. And, oh yeah, shouldn't the credits be at the beginning of the movie?

reviews.review_title: possibly the cheapest looking film EVER made
reviews.content: It has been said by many others just how bad and cheaply made Manos: The Hands of Fate is, but I will say it again as this film has got to be the epitome of a film so poorly made it's good. A family driving through the country winds up at a remote house, watched over by the bizarre Torgo. I won't spoil it for those who may not have seen it, but things go downhill for the family after they decide to stay for the night. No matter how bad the film is, the ending is actually somewhat clever and will make you cringe a little. Aside from the ending, however, this is no doubt the worst film ever produced, even worse than Plan 9 From Outer Space. The movie was apparently shot with a cheap store-bought camera and does look like someone's bizarre home movies. In the beginning, there is an extended sequence of the family driving through the country, past farms, fields, and rural houses; you get the feeling the director is just filming his friends' real estate as a favor for them. Despite its cheapness, you actually won't forget this film after it is over, it is so bad; the Torgo character also is quite memorable.Don't think Manos is a film so bad you should pass on it; watch it if you get the chance, but watch it as a comedy and not a horror film.

Aware of the title for a number of years, I have skipped over viewing it, due to the dull,bad reputation is has. Seeing it appear on Dan Murrell's Movie Club,I decided it was time, to finally meet Manos.View on the film:Spending the whole production on LSD, John Reynolds gives a,utterly unique turn as Torgo, that unintentionally matches the mood of the movie, thanks to Reynolds consistent twitching and hazy glances all across the screen,while Tom Neyman Camps things up with his Melodramatic performance as The Master.Made due to a bet,and only being able to record 32 seconds of film a time, (all shot silently, with the amusing, poorly performed dubbed being slapped on at the last minute) writer/director Harold P. Warren & cinematographer Robert Guidry handle a clunky atmosphere, with all the hand-held camera moves stumbling from one over-extended shot to the next,as the smooth, lounge Jazz score from Russ Huddleston and Robert Smith Jr. Tries to find a groove for Manos.

Hobgoblins... Tomb Raider... Planet of the Apes (2001)... Future War (Future Wax)... Pearl Harbor...Those are worse than this. This has been "haunting" everyone since about 1993 (or maybe 0000), but there is no reasoning. Why is it so bad to you all? IT is bad, granted, but to me, surprisingly, it was closer to "lower-okay" than "help, I've watched this piece of you-know-what."True, I'm not surprised that actors killed themselves afterwards (how? fall? knife? gun? how?). I'm not surprised that Hal P. Warren is not only ugly, but a fertilizer salesman (though he doesn't know fertilizer from film). The only thing I'm surprised by:Judging from the #1 spot of the worst, the summaries stating that TV's Frank and Dr. F apologized for showing them it, and my dream/nightmare that had it starring children (and was probably written by one), I thought this would be the worst. People, don't listen to what everyone says about it being the worst. Listen to your heart (that sounds like some stupid romance saying), brain (sounds like Sci-fi), and self (now it's getting stupid), and realize that this deserves a 2 rating at most/least.

Yes, I said underrated. It isn't the worst movie ever made. That is still Hobgoblins. This is not as bad as you say (It is still bad-it is about number four on my least liked films).  A note: For fear of death, blindness, and other bad stuff, I have only seen the MST3K version. You may still have a point with it being "the worst," but for now..."I wish those hands would just PUSH HIM OVER!" And, "Pull my finger!" And, "Theres some poodle meat in the freezer!"

As a horror movie this is a 0/10. As an entertaining movie this is a 0/10. As a movie where the expectations of the common viewer are to be met, this movie is a 0/10. But as a surrealistic movie this is a 10/10! Not all movies are about Santa Claus or good/evil... Well, the above is my comment: but something in the system doesn't let me say what I think unless I write a lot more. Well, this is my first review (in a language that is neither my first or my second) so I'm a bit shy. They (whoever they are) tell me to write at least ten lines - so I write ten lines. But, I've seen comments that were much shorter than mine. And I'm shy as a new poster and I'm stunned by the qualities of the film - this is not one of the ten worst films ever, it is one of the ten most misunderstood films ever (probably even by the directors!). And you have to stand it for at lest 40 minutes (well, yes the beginning is somewhat slow) before (and if!) you get hooked.

Absolutely one of the best-worst movies ever. If you are a fan of MST3K.. you gotta see this one. It ranks up there with Squirm and Pod people as one of the best MST3K's done. The Direction is absolutely horrible and the acting is.... well, it's horrible also.  ENJOY!

Yes, it deserves it's place as the worst movie of all time; yes, it looks like it was shot with daddy's Super-8 camera by a ten year old who had no idea what the term "focus" means; yes, it makes "Eegah" look like high-end film making and as if it were directed by Stanley Kubrick. But I love it for those reasons.The picture and sound quality are a real joke in themselves, while the "acting" makes Arch Hall, Jr. look like Humphrey Bogart. There is no real attempt to create an air of menace. Personally, I think that everyone concerned really enjoyed making this. The movie is an excellent centerpiece for its episode on MST3K. Buy it, you won't be sorry.

Several of you have noticed that John Reynolds (aka Torgo) committed suicide the same year this movie was made and also that one of the wives did too. But there were actually 3 suicides by cast members the same year of release in El Paso, the city of filming:John Reynolds, Diane Mahree, and Joyce MolleurSo many suicides could not have be caused just by them making a bad movie. It was Heaven's Gate-like cult activity! So, I put forth the hypothesis that all involved actually worshiped a god called Manos and that the movie was intended to enlist others into their religion to appease the will of Manos and that Hal Warran actually IS the Master. It's conceivable. This interpretation nonetheless adds a rather disturbing aspect while watching the movie. In any case, MasTER mUSt BE serVED or MasTER WIll be ANGry.I think my two favorite parts are the extended "Torgo Carries Suitcases from the Car" and the smooth "Torgo Busts a Move on the Chick" scenes. I start laughing so hard when I see those that my body actually hurts.

reviews.review_title: Get your hands on this one 👇🏿
reviews.content: I've seen this movie 3 times and laughed hard each time I did. The first was on MST3K and the other times with rifftrax. With that said I can't image what it must be like to watch this inept film without a commentary track pointing out how ridiculous it is from a technical and content standpoint. An 8 with MST3K, a 10 with rifftrax and a 0 on its own for an overall 6.

reviews.review_title: Awful Acting and filming kills what could have been a decent popcorn horror flick
reviews.content: I can't give this a good rating, but I do have to admit, it had some good lines and John Reynolds and Tom Neyman delivered bone chilling performances... too bad the acting by the rest of the cast was so bad it was scarier then their performances.While hard to follow, the movie wasn't the most difficult to follow movie I've ever watched.The story follows a family who is going across country and gets lost. They invite themselves to stay at a lodge they come across. They soon discover that this is no ordinary place and that the master is not some memory recalled by Torgo. It's very hard to describe in detail the train-wreck that arises in this film, I can't emphasize just how bad the camera shots were and how bad the acting in general was.Also the cop and the teenagers scenes didn't really serve any purpose, the cop never came to the rescue, so why have him keep popping up? Anyway if you watch this film, do yourself a favor and watch the mst3k copy.

IMDb and other movie websites have messed up, the genre of this movie is comedy, isn't it? Seriously, you can't expect me to believe that this is a horror movie.This really is a funny movie that everyone should check out. The parody in this movie is really great and clever. But honestly, why is this movie getting such low marks?! People don't understand the greatness of this movie, just really really funny. IF you're bored just try to find this movie classic. It's on Amazon and in 100 great horror Classics, why I don't know. But this is a seriously great comedy, everyone should see it. But I can't help but wonder, why is this movie posed as a horror movie? I mean that can't be serious, can it. There's no way that this is a horror movie, it's got to be a comedy. No way it can be a horror movie, can it?

My wife and I take great pride in watching really horrible movies.  "Wizard of Gore", "Crystal Force" (both 1 & 2), even the so-called "Worst Movie Of All Time", "Plan 9 From Outer Space".I'm telling you right now, I have NEVER seen a movie as bad as "Manos".  My wife even fell asleep during it...lucky lady.Now, I'm like everyone else. I've only seen it with the help of the 'bots, but when Tom & Crow are speechless in parts of a movie, you know you're getting yourself into a bad movie.I would recommend seeing this movie for the pure entertainment value, but I can't.  Rent "Plan 9 From Outer Space" and realize what a great movie you're watching.  Or even better, watch a movie that you really hated, and I promise you'll like it better knowing that you didn't have to watch "Manos".

reviews.review_title: A true classic - nothing can compare
reviews.content: No movie comes close to this classic film in many respects.  Hal Warren's top notch directing (and starring role) made this film the instant classic that it was.  His lead role of "Michael" was a true inspiration for many up and coming actors like Leonardo Di Caprio, Jerry Seinfeld and Mako. Tom Neyman's depiction of "The Master" was awe-inspiring and evil.  He displayed almost a divine aura on the screen.  The true gem of this film was the depiction of the quasimodo like "Torgo" by the unforgettable John Reynolds. Its a shame the film world loss such talent due to his unfortunate suicide in 1966.

reviews.review_title: I actually had the misfortune of being forced to sit through this without the benefit of the MST3K crew!
reviews.content: I actually had the misfortune of being forced to sit through this without the benefit of the MST3K crew! I had a babysitter when I was a kid back in the seventies who would sit through any horror film, no matter how wretched, and this was one of them. Even when I was ten teayrs old I simply couldn't believe that anyone would expect people to pay money to see a film so flagrantly boring and un-scary! And Torgo...what was up with him? Sure, he's extremely creepy in a wino/junkie sort of way, but scary? No way!

Manos: The Hands of Fate is quite possibly the worst movie of all time no hyperbole. Everything from its technical issues, pacing, story and acting shows no redeeming value whatsoever. However, like most bad movies it fascinates you in to what went behind this monstrosity of a film.The movie was shot on a camera that could only record approximately thirty-two seconds of footage, explaining the overly long takes used in the film. The whole movie was also dubbed since the filmmakers had no sound equipment.Actor John Reynolds, who plays Torgo, was reportedly high on LSD while filming and his performance consists of him displaying confusion, twitching and other strange mannerisms.Manos has gone into infamy as one of the all-time bad movies and it's no wonder why...

reviews.review_title: It's not Plan 9 From Outer Space
reviews.content:
I don't hate Manos, I enjoy watching it from a different point of view. I like seeing just how bad it is and think that while many of today's movies are bad, they still PALE in comparison to Manos. I wouldn't tell anyone not to watch it, but to be prepared for how bad it is. Movies like Star Paws it one I would tell people to steer clear of.I see a lot of reviews that compare this movie to Plan 9 From Outer Space and while both movies are quite bad, Plan 9 at least had some kind of coherence. What we find with Manos is a complete lack of vision and the inability to plan things properly. This movie literally plays out like something a bunch of kids filmed on a whim after getting their hands on their parent's video camera. I'm sure working on it made everyone feel important, but the end result was far from it.Plan 9, while also a very bad movie, at least showed that the cast and crew had some kind of knowledge of film making. The story's continuity holds firm through the entire movie and despite ridiculous dialogue, you get the base idea that aliens are trying to contact people of Earth so they can be halted in their advances of technology and eventually destroying the universe, throwing in the "zombie apocalypse" seemed very out of place, but the idea was so far out of left field that it has a bit of charm itself. The sets were bad (plywood for airplane yokes?), strings were visible, and it didn't actually star Bella Legosi, but you could get a sense of competence and that everyone was at least trying.Plot:
Manos, on the other hand, suffers badly from the director/producer's inability to envision the world in which his story takes place. Plot holes are almost non-existant because the entire movie is a plot hole. There is zero exposition or any explanation for anything that happens. While this can work for a movie when done right, in this case it just leaves you scratching your head and asking questions you will never get answers to. Why did the family get lost when the sign literally pointed to their destination? Who is Manos? Why did the master have so many wives? Did Peppy just fake his death to get out of filming? The plot is all over the place and it makes watching the movie difficult.The director has no sense of timing, leaving scenes going on far longer than they should and improperly editing said scenes to shorten them (everyone makes a comment about the driving at the beginning), but other scenes like when the sheriff is telling the "kids" to get lost and the camera just sits there staring at the girl as she does her hair and THEN she turns to the camera and delivers her line. It goes on like this through the entire movie.I like the random events like the kid just running off into the dark and Mike having a loaded pistol in the glove box of the car, it really makes for excellent things to talk about with people!Oddly, the only continuity that holds up in the entire movie is that the car really did have a taillight out at the beginning of the movie. I personally didn't notice it until I watched the restored blu-ray version and could actually see the movie.Dialogue:
I love the confusing dialogue. One of the best is Torgo himself when he keeps repeating his lines (actually, most of the actors do that). I also enjoy the scene toward the beginning where Torgo is unloading the bags from the car while he's explaining that the family can't stay there (the master would not approve), but he just continues to take the luggage in and protest that they have to leave, it's so very confusing. Since all the dialogue is dubbed, everyone's lines just come off as wooden and boring. The Master's laugh is hilariously bad too, so weak and unimposing.Characters:
Every character in this movie is an idiot and annoying. The only real enjoyable person is Torgo, even as confusing and strange as he is, but most of that can be chalked up to the actor being on drugs and wearing the leg prosthetics wrong which caused him pain. Mike is a downright a-hole and I wonder if that's how he is in real life (since he is also the director), it would seem fitting. The Master looks intimidating, but is strangely not very scary at all. I think it's his facial structure that worked, too bad the actor couldn't convey any kind of intimidating manner. Sharron is just inept and the typical whiner, always complaining about something (I suppose some of it is warranted, like not wanting to stay at the house).Music:
Ho-boy... the music is something else. It's not bad, it's not good and it does more harm than good. Almost none of it sets the mood properly, being that it's almost all a single piano. The only music that works is for Torgo's walk (I'm assuming an obo or flute of some kind). It really makes the whole scene worth watching.Overall, it's only to be watched if you want something humorous to enjoy. Just don't expect to understand what's going on.

that the IMDb address for this movie, in which three of the principals committed suicided soon after it's release, ends in the "mark of the beast," 666! {Cue eerie music} http://us.imdb.com/Details?0060666I saw this movie courtesy of the Mystery Science Theatre chatterboxes squawking along to the "action" onscreen, and I must admit I doubt seriously that I could've watched it any other way.  The pacing is what really kills it, slow, slow, slow, but the acting bludgeoned it good before it's demise. I think a good editor could do wonders with it, and probably make it a short film of some note, but I can't think of a good editor sane enough to touch it.

Let me just begin by saying this movie is really, really, bad.  Even watching MST3K with it is sometimes painful.  However, there is something about this movie, that you can't turn away from the film in all it's horror.  It somehow appears to be a "snuff film," I don't know if such movies exist, but Manos: Hands of Fate is a good piece of evidence that it does.Once I learned that the actors who played the Mother, the Kissing Girl, and Torgo had all committed suicide the same year the movie was made, I was freaked out.  You almost think that the whole cult and sacrifice is probably real.  It's probably not true, but watching the movie with a viewpoint that these people are filming a documentary about their cult gives you a whole other feeling, one of unsettling curiosity.  Hey, maybe this movie could be considered the father (or Master) of "Blair Witch Project"!Maybe I'm just crazy.  Probably the whole reason this movie was made was so we could see the Master's brides wrestle in diaphonous gowns.  Despite the wretchedness of the movie, Torgo is an incredibly unforgettable character. You can't help but think of what his ambitions, goals, and motivation.  Once you really dig deep down in his character, you realize how disgusting it is, and try to free yourself from the grossness of it all.Final word of caution: don't watch without Joel and the Bots.Long Live Torgo!

reviews.review_title: THE SINGLE WORST MOVIE OF ALL TIME
reviews.content: "MANOS" THE HANDS OF FATE is the worst movie there is. I find it hard to believe that so many people were able to sit through this unforgivable mess, even with the MST3K commentary! Furthermore, I find it impossible to believe that anyone actually liked it! 541 people thought this was great? You fools! That's like drinking hemlock and calling it Koolaid! I am not exaggerating here, there has never been a movie worse than this. Some say that GIGLI is the worst movie ever made, but they are simply overreacting to a fresh stinker (I mean Ben Afflec and Lopez are irritating and all, but they could never make a movie worse than this!). I am voting in to tip the scales and put this trash on the bottom where it belongs.The film opens with a seemingly endless series of establishing shots that are so lifeless, it would be a compliment to call them 2 dimensional. After what feels like 20 minutes of boring travel, our heroes: a couple, their daughter, and a dog, come to a house in the middle of nowhere. That's when we meet the freak Torgo, who has giant kneecaps. The husband talks to him asking if they can stay the night. Sounds simple enough, right? They can't even finish a simple sentence without stumbling and pausing for small eternities! They are allowed to stay and the "horror" unfolds very slowly. Later we meet The Master, who wears a cape with hands on it as he worships Manos (which means hands, making the title a pathetic redundancy). The Master has wives who wrestle for his favor in nightgowns. All of it is presented in static shots, on very low quality film, which are all held for too long. The dialogue, acting, design, script, direction, music, photography, you name it, it all stinks! In fact, it is all the absolute worst it can be. The movie is such an enormous failure, one wonders if they were even trying. It all builds to a weak horror-movie conclusion and the mercifully ends. The 74 minutes it takes to watch it feels like about five hours.This movie makes PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE seem like CITIZEN KANE. I myself am one who can enjoy a movie when its bad enough (why else would I watch MST3K?), but this thing is just too terrible to enjoy, on any level. The only reason to watch the MST is to hear the comments, which still don't protect you from the utter pain of viewing the movie. MANOS  is a one of a kind pain, rivaled only by THE INCREDIBLY STRANGE CREATURES WHO STOPPED LIVING AND BECAME MIXED UP ZOMBIES. The film, the director, the actors, and the entire crew should have been publicly burned for this crime against the cinema. It doesn't get any worse than this!

reviews.review_title: Horror? Don't be fooled by this well done parody...
reviews.content: At least, I think I'm pretty sure this is a parody of other movies. At least....I hope. I just mention this because there's no way it could be a serious horror movie. The "monster" had big knees for a freakish deformity. And of course in most bad movies, the heroes lost. Except for this movie I was happy.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie of ALL time!!! (I love it!!)
reviews.content: This movie must be seen to be believed.  It's not enough just to say that it's the worst movie of all time.  I was not surprised that it was the top pick on the IMDB to 100 list.  This must have been some bad college project or something.  I don't know why anyone would have been involved with this film.  DO NOT WATCH it without the aid of MST3000.  It would be truly unbearable. The commentary is absolutely HYSTERICAL and makes it all worth while.  I've watched this movie about 10 times and it's still as funny as the first time. I would like to know whatever happened to Torgo (the great John Reynolds). It's not surprising that no one from this film went on to an acting career of any kind. Manos- the hands of Fate is a MUST SEE for bad movie fans.  Ed Wood could only wish for such a travesty.

by the time MST3K got around to this film, I'd already seen it in a theater, and many times on California TV. Prolonged viewing generates a blissful non-attentiveness, that can be quite enjoyable. It is extremely rare to come across an American film, so lacking in any Hollywood influence. Rather then emulating the technical competence of others, this has the rough-hewn feel of constant improvisation, similar to the cheaper Turkish films. It's a real shame that the days of such bizarre, independent films showing up at 4:00 a.m. on TV, are long gone, replaced by the constant stream of commercials, and infotainment. The children of Ron Popeil control that viewing time now.

Manos is Spanish for "hands". How is this evil or even scary? This dork-fest is a really horrid example of film making. Who cares about the details or challenges surrounding production. Who cares if the film had a really low budget? This movie is despicable.Manos, The Hands of Fate is about a small family who gets lost in the desert. They eventually find a small house out in the middle of no where. A strange man is a keeper, named Torgo, who has deformed legs and walks and talks like he's drunk all the time. The family decides to stay over for some reason. Eventually hijinks occur, and we the viewer are set to suffer some of the most horrible film making ever unleashed. Some crap happens in small, lighted locations in the desert. There's some guy with some stupid cape on, and he's the "master" and he has his wives. Most of the film is simply actors moving about these filming locations, coming and going out of frame. Some other crap happens and that's about it.This could possibly be the worst movie ever made. Challengers, and IMO an upper hand still belongs to Laserblast even though it's ranked higher. The Barbaric Beast of Boggy Creek series definitely can hang with Manos as well. At any rate there's really no point in arguing which is worst. They are all absolutely horrid and terrible, each shining through in perhaps it's unique form of ugliness. So if you choose to view this pile, do yourself a favor and at least watch the MST3k version. 1/10

i'm not going to comment on this movie: you can look at the others, thats more than enough.Does it strike anyone that shortly after this movie was released 3 of the stars commited suicide? This movie was so bad that the actors killed themselves(in real life).You can look this bit of info up in the trivia section.

reviews.review_title: Pretty bad, but I give it a 2 for effort
reviews.content: I'm 14 and can't say I'm extremely smart, but this movie had me thinking "How dumb were these people"? The acting was horrific, the script was a joke, and the editing was perhaps worse. However, when taking into the account the crew's inexperience and the small budget I can feel sympathetic. This movie made me feel empty inside after viewing the MST3K version and I felt nauseous and depressed, but there were a few redeeming qualities, like the character Torgo and the outfit of the Master. (you can see the zipper on the back, xD) Overall, I'd say you should watch it if you can handle such things and it does give a lesson of what not to do it you plan on ever making films.

This movie should come with a health warning, everything that could go wrong with a horror movie did go wrong, the plot made no sense, the acting was terrible, the music was bizarre in fact everything was bad, you couldn't even laugh at it as you can with other bad movies. I thought Hobgoblins was the worst movie I've ever seen but I may need to rethink that after sitting through this. But on the bright side, you could use this movie to get confessions from suspects who won't talk, much more effective and more torturous than water boarding, as shown at the end of the MST3K episode Tom Servo temporarily loses his mind and frankly I don't blame him for flipping out.

There are so many questions that need to be asked of this movie that I don't even know where to start!! Why does Debbie refer to her mom as 'mother' in some scenes and mum in others??? Wth is wrong with Torgo's legs????!? Why does the apparently 'loving father' complain and grouch nonstop throughout the movie?? Why were they driving around in the middle of nowhere?? Why did the policeman stop them ( it was just sorta random really) ? Why is the movie's ending so messed up?!? Will the dad's legs suddenly become like Torgo's?? Will there ever be a "Manos The Hands Of Fate 2"?? Did the Master ever wash that cape?? So many questions, so few answers... But seriously, after watching this film I felt like doing a Torgo... That how bad it was :o
An amazing story with well built plot points, well written characters, especially Torgo and an amazing soundtrack to boot, my favorite movie of all time.

Worst cinematic mistake ever made.The only way to get through this piece of garbage is to see the Mystery Science Theatre 3000 version I saw Plan 9 From Outer Space,and Manos ranks one notch below that movie.There are so many things wrong with Manos that its hard to mention all of them in one review. One of the recurring scenes that annoyed me the most was the "teen" love birds making out in the car.They appear 3 or 4 times throughout the movie as if their car has been parked the whole time.Also,I counted Torgo being murdered twice. Half th movie was made up of riding in the car . Its no wonder that 3 "actors" later wound up committing suicide

Usually when sitting throughout the latest MST3K abomination, I can laugh along and savor the cracks made by Mike/Joel and the 'bots. I, having a strong stomach and willpower, can sit through any assault on my senses as long as the MST3K buffer is there. This was the ONE exception. I had to stop halfway through and allow myself 24 hours to mentally recover before bravely pushing the play button again. I think even Mr. Ed Wood would have been too embarrassed to release this waste of perfectly good film. "Plan 9 from Outer Space" look like Citizen Kane compared to this turkey.Obviously from these other reviews, there is a deranged, almost indecipherable plot, no-talent acting, extremely bad acting and the real kicker: the whole film was shot out-of focus and almost no lighting! It actually hurt my eyes to watch it! Even Plan 9 was in focus! What really made me question my sanity was the soundtrack. The bulk of the music(?) sounded like a jazz pianist and clarinet player noodling around for an hour! To this day, I have nightmares about this movie. Not because of the evil dude with the iron-on hands on his zippered, polyester costume, and not because of the skeevy, one-too-many-sessions-on-the-stairmaster Torgo. I have nightmares because it was so bad, that not even the geniuses at Best Brains could save it. It was physically painful, and should be considered by the chinese as a new form of mental torture. I realize that one should not expect Scorcese-like quality from a director who was really a full-time fertilizer salesman, but gez...I think a retarded slug could have made something a little more palatable.

reviews.review_title: Should have been final episode of MST3K!
reviews.content: After seeing the MST3K episode in which this movie plays I realized that never in the history of cinema has there ever been, nor can anyone ever achieve, a worse film than 'Manos' The Hands of Fate (I wish there was something lower than 1 I could give this piece of carp). It is so incredibly bad that if it were broadcast on every channel in the world simultaneously, non-stop around the clock, it would have succeeded in breaking the will of every human being on Earth and forced them to obey the one man capable of turning it off: Clayton Forrester! This movie should have been the final episode of MST3K in which Mike/Joel/Crow/Servo's will is finally and permanently destroyed and they bow before Dr. Forrester and beg him to end the movie (Crow's line's lifted from 'Aliens' during this episode "Game over man, game over!"). Thus the series should have ended with Dr. F. sitting in a throne wearing 'the Master's robe with T.V.'s Frank beside him holding the Torgo staff in his hands and stock footage of various people bowing in worship. If anyone that has actually seen this film thinks they have found one even worse please post it's name here so that I, and everyone else, can be forewarned of the potential terrors that lie behind that seemingly harmless Blockbuster rental that exists in our future.P.S. Vote to make 'Manos' #1 on the bottom 100!

"Manos: The Hands of Fate" is one of the greatest, and most maligned films of all time.As an avid B-movie and Z-movie fan, "Manos: the Hands of Fate" is the holy grail. Never before and probably never again will there ever be a film as ineptly "bad" as "Manos". Literally everything about the film, when judging by normal film standards, is done wrong. But you already know this. It's safe to say that if you are looking at this review, you know "Manos" well and are completely aware of the film and the situations in which it was made. However, I am arguing for the value of this film.While I am certainly biased because I am a fan of this film and have seen it dozens of times, this film is a great example of what movies are supposed to do. Like it or not, this is one of the most entertaining films of all time. I think just about anyone who has seen this film has laughed at least once or twice during the viewing, especially if you are viewing it with friends or even better in a theater full of people. The mistakes are glaring and the scenes become so iconic that they stay in your head forever. Whether it be the first time we meet Torgo, the Master's wives fighting in the sand, or the epic (if you can call it that) finale with an unhappy ending (rare for a B or Z movie of the time), "Manos" is a film you will remember. Sure, it is "terrible" but with enough viewings, it becomes an endearing film. And these days, with most of the trash coming out of Hollywood being passed as "entertainment", a little bit of cheese and a little less seriousness is something that we could use.

reviews.review_title: Oh God it's so Painful! Why Hal Warren, there is no justification for this!
reviews.content: Some movies are just bad. Entertaining, yet terrible. This statement brings to mind films like Kazaam, Steel, and The Mangler. Few movies are so bad that even MST3K cannot make even remotely entertaining. Honestly I must ask the directer, why, why would you do this to the public. Have you no heart? Words cannot even begin to describe how terrible this film is. Why Hal Warren, Why would you do this. Have you no conscience. Honestly I would rather watch paint dry than to sit through this piece of cinematic crap again. It is actually painful to watch. It hurts just to endure it. Because that is what you do. You do not watch the MST3K version, you endure it. I WANT MY 90 MINUTES BACK JOEL.

I've heard all the negative comments here on this movie and asked myself, "It can't be THAT bad, could it?" BOY was I wrong!!! Ugh... this movie is TERRIBLE!!! (And that's being polite) The acting, the filming, the music (I STILL can't get that #*&@$&! Torgo Theme out of my head!), the editing, EVERYTHING that can go wrong in movie goes completely, horribly, and utterly wrong here. The sad thing about this movie was, the filmmakers thought it was a good idea to make this. */SLIGHT SPOILER/* That dog had the most sense of anyone in the film. He bolted. Thank god for MST3K, or else I'd never get through this film with my sanity.My rating: -500000/10

"Manos: The Hands of Fate" will go completely over the head of anyone but the super-intelligent. However, there is depth and metaphor in this divinely-crafted piece of art, which you will find nowhere else. If you ignore the misguided and uneducated popular opinion long enough to treat yourself to this gem, you will be rewarded for years to come. It is perhaps the most disturbing psychological thriller ever made.Although, at first glance, elements like the protracted cuts of the car driving through the desert seem to be gratuitous incompetence on the part of director Hal Warren, they are actually expertly calculated devices designed to engender unparalleled tension (I felt like I was actually experiencing the horrific events myself). What is considered "bad acting" and boring, inane dialogue by most, is in fact Warren's almost supernatural ability to weave a sense of ultra-realism from his supremely skilled thespians. The delicious set design and cinematography are gothically postmodern, conveying an atmosphere of impending dread. Last but not least, kudos of kudos must be given to the brilliant score, particularly the haunting, minimalistic "Torgo" theme. All of these components converge to yield a profoundly subtle epic, a superlative achievement in innovative film-making - in short, one of the greatest films ever made. I could tell you more, but I don't wish to spoil a second of this masterpiece, nor its climactic twist, which would turn M. Night Shaymalan green with envy.God rest your soul, Hal Warren. One can only imagine what other cinematic wonders you would have blessed us with if only your uncanny genius had been recognized and appreciated. Films like "Manos: The Hands of Fate" are the reason celluloid was invented.

reviews.review_title: I underestimated this film, whens IMDB going to put 0 as a choice?
reviews.content: Amazing, this truly is terrible.  Sort of one of those movies that you just have to see to believe.  Absolutely awful, however I would rate Escape from LA, Batman and Robin and any of the two Shaq movies worse because they actually had a budget higher than 50 dollars.

Manos is definitely the worst movie ever. The plot goes nowhere, the characters are ill-developed, and the camera work needs attending to. However, this movie is so bad that it makes you want to watch it again and again. Torgo, the "care-taker" allows a lost family to stay at his cabin while the "master is away." The dad of the family is a loud, rude, and an inconsiderate man who only seems to care about himself. And Torgo has some leg troubles that cause him to sort of shuffle/hobble around. The master is not dead as you know it, but he isn't with us. Once the master "awakens" we come to realize he has six wives, and is after the mom to make number 7. Why you ask... who the heck knows. The plot is so messed up that we don't know who/what/or why concerning the master. Plus, Torgo gets a mind of his own and decides he wants the mom as his wife. These so called wives, when awake, fight as to whether the child (a girl) should live and become the master's wife or die. I could go on for hours, but I simply love this movie because it is so horrible. And who could forget the relentless driving scenes where all you see are fields and grass. If you are a bad movie buff, you have to add this one to your list. May Torgo live on forever in our hearts.

I could have lived with the standard of acting and the silly plot, and just enjoyed 'Manos' as a tacky horror flick.But the thing that kills this movie stone dead is the pacing. The first scene is the family driving... and driving... and driving... and driving...The whole film has the get-up-and-go of continental drift. Even when Torgo makes a pass at the female lead, it seems like a minute before she reacts. If someone had edited big chunks out of this film to get the story moving a bit more snappily, it would have been a quickly forgotten cheapo B-Movie, but the released version really does deserve its appalling reputation.In addition, the Master looks rather too much like Arthur Bostrom's gendarme from 'Allo allo' to be particularly menacing. None of the characters are at all likable, so you don't really care what happens to them.In short, rotten. The excellent and very funny 'Mystery Science Theater 3000' treatment is the only way to get through this.

This film is slowly emerging as an all-time cult classic...
After extensive research, it's been determined this film originated from a Gilligan's Island episode which aired in November, 1965.  In that episode, a movie camera AND film were discovered in a sealed box in the lagoon.  The castaways went on to make a flick and then put the work adrift on a raft in the hopes it would be found and lead to a rescue.  The film was found and went on to win first prize at Cannes!  Needless to say, the castaways remained stranded.  The parallels between 'Manos' and the inspiration are clear: Hal Warren hoped this film would be discovered and would lead him to fame and ultimately, a rescue from EL Paso, TX.  As with his inspiration, however, his film WAS discovered, albeit not until many years later, and Roach was left to his fate in El Paso.  There was to be no rescue. 
I can't comment on the story or the acting because whatever story there is/was has been chewed to bits by the absence of direction and cinematography.  Nevertheless, when you sit and watch this film, you become riveted as you realize you are watching history.Seriously, I would not be surprised to see a modern-day feature any time now which chronicles the making of and release of this film.  Look at it this way:  How could you NOT make a feature about a fertilizer salesman, who by chance runs into a 'big-time screenwriter' (Sterling Silliphant) and decides to chase his own Hollywood dreams, which crash and burn on contact... Look at how many pages of comments there are on this site... Look at how many votes this film has received...everyone's eager to jump on board and offer their expert slam dunk almost 40 years after the fact.  Many are saying Hal Warren makes Ed Wood look like Orson Welles. There's no doubt corporate America will be gobbling up this whole story very soon!

This movie is as bad as it gets. It's not surprising that at least 3 actors committed suicide after making this mess. Lets look at the elements of the movie: You have a family on vacation, who get lost and wind up at "The Masters" house in nowheresville, and Mike, knucklehead that he is, insists that he, his wife, and daughter spend the night. You have Torgo, some kind of man-goat who walks and acts like he's had one too many and fondles women who takes care of the place while the "Master" is away, and don't forget "The Master"; who is supposed to be some kind of menacing evil priest but comes across as a laughing hyena. Throw in 5 or 6 nubile women in nightgowns claiming to be "The Masters" wives; all they do is argue and wrestle each other. Watch ONLY with Joel and the 'bots, It's one of their best efforts.

reviews.review_title: Why this isn't #1 on the bottom 100 is beyond me.
reviews.content: I watched the MST3K version just to see how bad the worst movie ever could be. Could it really be that bad? Simply put, yes it is. Every aspect of this movie is horrible. Any present day filmmaker (professional or amateur) would have to work awfully hard to deliberately make a worse movie. The acting, dialog, sound, cinematography, plot, subplot, action, and music are all the worst I've ever seen. I'm a screen writing major and amateur filmmaker myself, so I've sat through a lot of movies. I was laughing hysterically (mostly at the MST3K's jokes) at how bad and horrendously this movie was put together.For anyone out there making a movie of your own, and tormented with feelings of inadequacy or doubt at your own talents, I would advise you to watch this (the MST3K version first). Nothing you make could possibly be this bad. FYI: The regular version is available on DVD. I bought it cheap online to see if I can stand to view it.And as the movie's stupid, insulting ending finally faded out, I got up with an uneasy feeling in my body, knowing I'd never sit through a movie that bad as long as I shall live. I think I've made my point.

I will not "spoil" this "movie" for anyone with the "plot" or my interpretation of what I think was supposed to by happening, but suffice it to say this movie has to be watched, and here's why:Often you will come across a movie that just came out that someone has headlined "worst movie i've ever seen!" in an IMDb comment box. Very often a viewer will have to great an expectation due to hype. Often you will be told "YOU HAVE TO SEE HOW BAD THIS MOVIE IS!!!" and the film in question turns out to merely be campy, or misunderstood in its entirety, or in need of some lighting, or a better director, better acting, plot modifications etc...Then you get to "Manos", the Hands of Fate and you 'quickly' discover that nothing will ever, ever, ever be the same again.Where once before you saw a terrible, over-hyped movie, misunderstood, contrived movie ... now... well now when you watch THAT film you can breath a little easier, taking enormous amounts of satisfaction in knowing that it will, indeed, not be "Manos", the Hands of Fate.

This movie was surprisingly terrific... on Mystery Science Theater 3000! This is definitely as bad as movies get. Please, whatever you do, don't watch this film thinking that it might be something interesting. It can only be viewed with the helpful comments of the MST3K gang, and even that isn't enough at times. This movie is freaky looking. It looks like it was filmed in one day in someone's back yard. Awful acting, awful plot, and some of the worst dialogue in history. I would like to meet the people that voted 10's for this film. Why... why... why would anyone do that? This movie is incredibly bad and that, unfortunately, may be its only interesting quality. But Beware! Stay away from this one! Overall, a 1 out of 10.

This movie is almost glorious in it's terrible nature. It's shot with a hand-held camera has no really cohesive or logical plot. The characters are ridiculous (mainly Torgo) and the storyline itself is all over the place. The Master's outfit is pretty cool however, especially with the large red hands (the manos perhaps?) that are on his robe. From the weird opening song, to the ending (which is so horrible that it makes the rest of the movie even more painful.)Yea, this movie is best watched in some altered state of consciousness, because otherwise, by the time you hit the one hour mark, you'll want to commit suicide like the director did. However, the MST3K version is delightful and highly recommended.
