The only good thing that I can honestly say came out of the making of "Manos: The Hands Of Fate" are the HILARIOUS reviews and comments that you read on this site. I never knew so many different adjectives could be put together in a sentence like you see here. Whenever I need a REAL laugh I just read some of them. No kidding.

reviews.review_title: A movie that I enjoy when under the influence
reviews.content: Geez. It doesn't get worse than this. It just can't. I'm torn between giving this thing an Academy Award for the category 'Worst Movie Endured by the Poor B******s Who had to View This Repeatedly' and Putting the Director on the War Crimes List. The only saving point of this is the MST3K treatment of the "movie". I've always thought that "Scalps" was the worst movie ever. We even punched out the person who rented it because he kept falling asleep while it was shown, but this transcends even that. That said, I taped it a few years ago and played it to death because it was so bad. I then had the chance to buy the "original" made by Best Brains. It may be an indication of how badly I have lost it, but if you like really bad movies to heckle, this is your Mount Everest. Embrace it, love it and as soon as I get a kickback scheme going to a sanitarium, I'll make some recommendations should you decide to follow this advice. Insert Deity Here help you. Cujo.

OUCH. It hurts!! Make the burning stop! MY EYES, OH GOD MY EYES!!  MY SOUL IS BEING RIPPED OUT THROUGH MY EARS AND MY BRAIN IS NOW THE CONSISTENCY OF POND SCUM!  Please put me out of my misery...oooooohhhhhhh the horror of it all....WHY GOD WHY!! WHY DID YOU ALLOW THIS MOVIE TO BE MADE?!?!?!?!DO NOT, FOR THE LOVE OF EVERYTHING GOOD, WATCH THE NON-MST3K VERSION.IT HURTS AAAAARRRRRRRGGGGGGGGHHH *lots of gurgling and screams of pain followed by an gasp then silence*......................

reviews.review_title: Don't knock it till you've seen it un-MST3Ked!!!
reviews.content: Yes it's an awful piece of filmmaking... yes it's as bad as everybody says... and yes its only bearable when you heckle it... ...but...please!!!  I implore everyone that has placed a review here to try their darndest to see it on the big screen with an audience and without Thom & Servo riffing their way thru it!!  Only then will you truly understand this films unique crappiness...for sheer crud value, the only other films that come close are Boarding House (1982) or Psyched by the 4D Witch (1972) (and to those that try to fob off Cant Stop the Music as a crap film (and worse than Manos) I say "You need to stay in more!!!")truly deserving of the Worst Film of All Time status... makes the films of Ed Wood look sophisticated and well-scripted

This movie has got to be one of the most entertaining and exciting film I have ever had the pleasure of viewing. This movie hits it on all the right levels. The acting: phenomenal. The script: exquisite. But most of all, I thoroughly enjoyed my favorite character, Torgo, played by the legendary John Reynolds. This movie will launch him to stardom. Particularly, the "Dog Storyline" will tear at your heartstrings. The strings of my heart were torn. And if that wasn't enough, the gripping soundtrack kept me on the edge of my seat. The composer gives Beethoven a run for his money. As for the other reviews of this movie, I do not agree tut-tut. They are mindless, clueless hooligans. So much can be said about this movie, but the most important part is that you must watch this movie RIGHT NOW! RIGHT AWAY! NOW! Please and thank you. The world is waiting. TA-TA.

reviews.review_title: I take care of the place while the master is away
reviews.content: Reading some of the comments about this movie. I understand most of em. MANOS: THE HANDS OF FATE is a terrible movie by it's self. Annoying stupid acting. Terrible direction. I realize all that.However, MST3K does save the it somewhat i think. When i watch the show of MST3K that spoofs Manos, i laugh laugh laugh at it soooo damn much! Terrible movie, yes...but HILARIOUS SHOW! The way they mimic torgo's voice is funny as hell. Like lines such as:Torgo: He wants you for his wife, he loves beautiful women... Tom Servo (in torgo voice style): and he likes to wear mittens.*laughing out loud* i just love that! it's sooo funny! with the HIRED spoof before it, that part is really funny too. Yes, i agree, manos alone is terrible, but i love the mst3k show. i laugh so hard when i watch it. I own a copy of it, and just watch at night sometimes just when i wanna fall asleep. I laugh at the stupidity. I don't know why more people don't laugh at the jokes on that show as i do.Ratings...MANOS by it's self: NEGITIVE INFINITY STARS MANOS on the MST3K episode: FUNNY AS HELL STARS! haha

reviews.review_title: It had to be a Dare, it's the only logical answer!
reviews.content: See, I read the guidelines for these review things and it asked me not to spoil any plot points to this movie.Then I realized, if someone is watching "Manos: The Hands of Fate" for plot reasons they need serious medical treatment. This movie can be compared to this: Imagine if your best friend pushed you off a building, destroying your sense of touch by paralyzing you from the neck down. Then they put you in a chair, made you watch fat people in thongs do the Macarana. Next, they fill your mouth with Vegimyte (kill the whole Taste and Smell Sense with one stone). Finally I would fill the space with magnificent sounds of Gwen's golden voice in "This Sh!t is Bananas." It is sad when a person starts to ponder in their tiny little head only six minutes into any movie, "Rocky V sounds pretty damn good now."

reviews.review_title: If Only There was an Academy Award Given out for the Best Movie Written and Directed by a Former Fertilizer Salesman:
reviews.content:
Hal Warren would still lose.  
The movie is so bad, its just, well bad...I had the misfortune of seeing this one without the help of Joel and the bots from MST3k, and I must say, I am lucky to come out of the experience with enough brain cells intact to write this review.Everything about this movie was just plain wrong.   The film was so grainy and washed out, it looked like  the Cinematography was supervised by Abraham Zupruder.  The acting was so bad it made Plan 9 From Outer Space look like Citizen Kane.  And the soundtrack....ohhh the soundtrack....well all I can say about that is that for some odd reason, it fit perfectly as the theme tune for a dirty guy with big knees (at least Hal Warren got that one right).As for things like plot and character development, well theres no need for us to worry about those since they are not even present in this film. 
Robot Rancher's final score: 1.  I must say this for Hal Warren: for a man who use to sell cow manure for a living....he certainly could make a stinky movie.

reviews.review_title: Fans of bad movies: see this one!!!
reviews.content:
This movie was so bad that it was actually funny. This, as Hal Warren, predicted, makes for good comedy. I saw the MST3K version, but found myself laughing more at the film than at what Joel and the Bots were saying.
WARNING: SPOILERS IN THE FOLLOWING PARAGRAPH!!!Some horror movies are just bad. Movies such as "feardotcom" don't have ten minutes of scenery, women wrestling each other in nightgowns, and a villain that couldn't scare a rabbit. What makes it funny is that you can tell that Hal was actually trying to make a serious attempt at a horror film. He didn't intend for it to be humor, but that's the way it turned out.
When speaking solely of horror films, I give this film the lowest score possible (It came out to a -0.3 on my 10 scale)Place this film on the scale of comedy films, and I give it a solid 5 out of 10. However, I will issue a disclaimer pointing out the fact that not all audiences may find this movie particularly humorous. Fans of bad movies probably will. Since judging of movies is generally by genre (how well does the movie do what it's supposed to?), I would say that this is the worst movie ever made. However, depending on who you are, this may not be the worst movie to watch. In any case, it is a must see for bad movie fans. This just blows everything you've ever seen labeled "bad" right out of the water.
It's a miracle that this movie actually exists... I'd recommend it to anyone.

reviews.review_title: terrorizing....I think not....well I did watch it.
reviews.content: OK, this is where I would normally say, "This was the worst film I have ever seen", but I can't say that. Try Death Tunnel. Anyway, if it were not for the guys from MST3K I wouldn't have made it through the whole thing. I looked into why this piece of crap was even made, and I found out a lot of information that kind of made me take a second look. The film was made because Harold Warren made a bet with a friend of his that he could make a movie. The guy was a fertilizer salesman. Made and sold it apparently. He didn't really know anything about making movies. Well, he had this junky camera that had to be wound up to film. It only filmed 30 seconds of film at a time and it did not record sound. He and another guy and some woman did all the voices for the film after filming. I didn't even realize that until I read it, so I got to give props to the guy for being inventive enough and to be able to have the patients to do all that work that had to be done to make an actual story. Not a good one, but still a story. He tried to make a sequel, but for some reason was turned away about it. The sequel was written as a book, but I unfortunately do not know the title of it. For some strange reason I would like to read it just to see what else Harold had in mind for a sequel. Its like a train wreck, I shouldn't be looking but I can't look away. I just don't think a sequel to this movie would work without Torgo. Yes, it is a bad movie. Yes, it has really bad acting. Yes, if you haven't seen it, get the MST3K version. Yes, if you are a fan of "so bad it's good" kind of movies, check it out.

This film is truly a murky mess, inept in every possible manner. The film has a very stereotypical plot common in pratically every other horror movie (including The Rocky Horror Picture Show, which the plot is rather similar to). A young couple and their daughter get lost out in seedy country of El Paso Texas. So they stop at the nearest house to ask for directions. As you can guess, this is a big freaking mistake! They are met by Torgo, the wobbly, bizarre voiced handy-man, who tells them not to stay, because, as he says "The master would not approve". They beg him, and finally he caves, though he warns "The master will be very disturbed." Soon the "master", a Satan-like character bearing a resemblance to Frank Zappa, wakes up and all sorts of horrible things start to happen to family. The ending could be one of the most loathesome, downbeat endings ever.There are many bad movies. But none of them have the all around ineptness of this (though Space Mutiny comes pretty close). Many films are really bad and cheap, but at least they often have some interesting camera angles and are often fun to watch. Manos has none of that. It's just 70 minutes of murky boredom. If it had beautiful photography, fine acting and the filmmakers tried to make the best of their budget (like many good independent films), it could have been a Night of the Living Dead-like classic. The photography is the definition of murkyness, it looks like an extremely faded Super 8 film and there is not one interesting, imaginative shot in the whole film, and combined with the content it end up looking exactly like a Satanist's home movies. And the sound quality is just as bad, perhaps even a bit worse. The camera the filmmakers used could not record sound (and they were obviously too stupid or too cheap to carry a sound recorder of some kind with them), so the whole film is dubbed, really, really badly. All the voices are done by two people, and they all sound exactly alike, and are so overracted it's downright asinine (especially poor Torgo). The actor's may have been good, but we don't know that. And I found it very sad (and at same time rather darky hilarious), that the man who played Torgo commited suicide shortly after this was released, just proving how much of a downer being in a mind numbingly bad movie can be. This whole mess of a film just proves that fertilizer salesmen aren't good filmmakers! Even watching your relatives home movies is far less boring than this. However, the film was shown on Mystery Science Theater 3000, and that episode is truly a hoot, a true MST3K classic.

reviews.review_title: Makes Plan 9 From Outer Space Look Like Citizen Kane
reviews.content: This movie will make you appreciate the directoral talents of Ed Wood. The only real way to enjoy it is to watch it with a group of friends and make fun of it. But the best way is by watching the RiffTrax version.

reviews.review_title: In my thirteen years of life, I've never seen anything more pathetic!
reviews.content: In my thirteen years of life, I've never seen anything more pathetic. "Manos: The Hands of Fate" is celluloid torture. The only redeeming quality present in this film is that it makes the best MST3K episode. It's about a family who stay at a motel run by caretaker Torgo (watch out for those giant kneecaps!), and encounter other evil things. This is undeniably the worst movie ever made! It is more painful than a root canal without Novocaine. WARNING: DO NOT SEE THIS WITHOUT JOEL AND THE BOTS! If you can sit through the un-MSTed version, I praise you. (zero/****)

Couldn't consider myself a movie critic until I had seen the worst of the worst, so I finally obtained the MST3K version last week and oddly enough I have watched it three times already.Manos is indeed wretched in every way, but it is far more entertaining when you consider that the movie was not created as part of a Hollywood mainstream film but rather the labor of love of some residents of El Paso, TX.And although the acting, script, filming, and music are all amateurish at best (after all, for all of them, this was the only acting they ever did), I am sure they had fun making the film.Ultimately, I think this would be a great film to show at film schools as examples of what not to do in nearly every aspect of film-making.  In that way, perhaps the pour souls who made this film (and the three who committed suicide shortly thereafter) can find solace.

Even with the MST3K gang this movie was excruciating to watch.  I mean bleeding form the eyes, want to swallow bleach, hit myself in the head with a hammer, drop a badger in my pants, painful.  It was a non-stop bombardment of poor script, horrid acting and plot that if it was there, seemed to be by COMPLETE accident.  It is no wonder 3 people in this movie killed themselves after having watched it.  I am ashamed to say I wasted 2 hours of my life on this.  I want them back. DAMN YOU I WANT THEM BACK!As a side note: would it have been too much trouble to move to a place NOT frequented by a large white and very visible moth?I wont say this is the worse movie ever, after all that's quite relative, however, this movie was awful, to say the VERY least.   To say the most, you should not show this movie to people who suffer form depression, schizophrenia, Alzheimer's, heart murmur, brain hemorrhaging and tennis elbow, as it may aggravate the condition.

You know, this movie is rock-hard proof that God does not exist.Seriously, this movie is proof that there is no God. Either that, or there is a God, and He really, really, REALLY can't stand us. So He created Manos, to kill us all.There has to be a good explanation for this movie.There HAS to be.Please tell me there's a good explanation for this movie. I mean, unless Hal Warren was a reincarnation of Torquemada, he wouldn't have deliberately made a movie this bad. (Spoiler warning) I can understand the snake, but the jeans under the Master's robe? The cop being voiced by the same guy as Mike, without bothering to put on an accent, pitch his voice any differently? The use of a clapboard, WITH A CAMERA THAT DOESN'T RECORD SOUND???? The Master in general? Even Torgo can't save this movie!DRECK! DRECK! DRECK! This makes Puma Man, Hobgoblins, Space Mutiny...you know, all the Usual Suspects... seem like Citizen Kane. Scrap the train wreck idea, this film closely resembles the extinction of the human species from a meteor strike. And if this is the only thing that survives for the future, the surviving source had better be MST3K.A message for the good folks here at IMDb: please introduce a NEGATIVE grading system. I think anyone who has any respect for movie-making would probably go for minus ten. Here's to Joel, Crow, and High Lord Tom Servo for bringing this particular piece of cinematic disaster to the attention of the world so it could be torn to shreds by anyone with a gram of taste.Oh, and a message for the people who give this 10/10. I'd just like to ask if you have even seen it. If you have, you must be a total masochist. If you haven't, then you must be trying to move this film from its rightful place at ROCK BOTTOM just to make room for stuff that sems worse now. It can't happen. There are several laws of physics against it.

Rejoice, this finally made it to its well-deserved place as the #1 worst movie ever made! This film is so bad, its unforgettable. And come on, who doesn't like Torgo? MST3k's riffing of this is one of that show's best episodes ever.

My immediate thought after finishing this movie was, why oh why did i just not listen to the reviews on IMDb.I have watched a few awful movies in my time but this...this really takes the cake.I cannot name one thing I enjoyed about this movie. I mean, half of it was people standing and wobbling whilst it seemed they had forgotten there lines. But no, apparently that was acting. Then when they finally did speak, it was the same repetitive lines over and over. If I was held at gun point and told to make a good movie out of the script, I would have shot myself.My recommendation: If you like movies, don't watch this.
This movie is truly a masterpiece. Nothing can compare to this mindboggling movie. You will be sitting there in shock and horror, as you realize you actually only spent 1 hour watching this movie.

reviews.review_title: A Must See for Every Filmmaker
reviews.content: We do not learn from our successes; we learn from our mistakes, and surely, there is no greater cinematic mistake than Manos: The Hands of Fate.Manos is almost assuredly the worst film ever made and it will likely remain that way until the end of time. For this very reason, you must see it.Yes, you will laugh, but this is not "The Room." Wiseau's film garners most of its insanity from how badly it wants to use cliche lines, sequences, stories, etc. But doesn't have a clue what to do with any of them (among other things like horrible acting and strangely bad green screen and sets). You see what Wiseau was going for in any one scene, how badly he missed, and how inevitable that miss always was.Manos, however, is something else. It's nonsense that believes in itself! It lies somewhere between insanity and boredom. There It's a plot based film without any plot. There are characters with no traits at all. There are story elements that seem to appear and disappear with wind. Is it a thriller? A drama? Fantasy? It's all three but at different times for the wrong reasons. It is the worst B-movie script ever written yet it has the pacing of a Terrance Malick movie. The pacing is so slow that, when it's over, you can barely tell that the story has even taken place anc yet it has, you just didn't know it. Or, if you did, you don't know what you saw. The cinematography is actively disgusting - I don't mean gross! It is deranged. Shots and cuts either happen or they don't and there can be no explaining any of them. The compositions are so horrible, it belies belief.The acting is likely the most inexplicable I've ever seen. Far from the cringy, melodramatic performances of bad actors we are accustomed to in the B-movie, here, it seems the actors simply don't know what they're performing at all though, clearly they must. There is so little emotion or affect in the on-screen actors' movements or from the voices of the handful of people that dub every character (they don't exactly do character voices either) is genuinely shocking. How could someone, who works as an insurance salesman, raise $19,000 (about.$160,000 as of 2022) and care so little about anything going on?! It staggers the mind.I'm not going to talk much about the technical d problems because, frankly, though they are bad, some of them are excusable for a no budget movie made by a salesman in El Paso.However, I would be remiss if I did not leave you by discussing the opening. Our main couple is driving down a road in Texas and is lost. And they're lost. And they're lost. And they're lost. For over 9 minutes, we just see them drive aimlessly in the Southwest while adlibbing lines about how lost they are. There was clearly supposed to be titles here but there's not. He just forgot. He could have cut this scene out or down significantly. He put work in to make it run that long. Why?!Why?! Why?! Why to it all!!!

reviews.review_title: Am I missing the point here?
reviews.content: I really have a high tolerance if it comes to boring scenes, but seeing a car drive round for 15 minutes is really it, I can't take anymore of that without reviewing this as a bad movie.Though I must say the evil-master's-slave Torgo made me smile, but that surely wasn't because of his interesting monologues.I still can't quite understand why this movie is in the bottom 100 and has been on 1 for so long, I've seen worse movies. (For example: Vampyros Lesbos, Samson VS. The Vampire Women, Hercules in New York)Overall a bad movie with some nice things and especially the 10 minute fight of the 9 shrouded wives was worth it.

reviews.review_title: Bad...but not nearly as bad as I expected
reviews.content: First off, let me stress that I watched the MST3K version of this, so that may have helped to cushion the blow. I also prepped myself for this movie by reading a ton of reviews about it. Therefore, I was expecting this to be an insanely mind numbing experience that I would never be able to make it all the way through. After having seen it, I have to admit that it wasn't the monstrosity that I built it up to be. Make no mistake, this is NOT a good movie, but I wasn't as astounded by the poor production of this movie as others. To me, it came across as a high school production of a play written by one of the students. Knowing in advance that the vast majority of people involved in this movie knew next to nothing about making films helped me be a little more forgiving of the vast array of technical flaws. The basic story that Hal Warren devised could have worked in the right hands (no pun intended). What he didn't understand was how to take that idea and turn it into a full length feature film. Hence we get pointless scenes of endless driving, teenagers making out, people staring at paintings, girls wrestling, etc.I'd love to see a remake of this movie with the following changes: First, I'd spend more time in the beginning with the family before they leave for this trip, to help us identify with the characters. Maybe the relationship between husband and wife isn't going so well, and they hope that over vacation they can try to bury the hatchet. Then, I'd lose those teenagers and change the cops to detectives investigating the disappearance of six couples over a period of years in one small town. These six couples would represent the Master's six wives and his male slaves. I'd change the circumstances of how the family winds up in this house. Big change: Torgo. I'd make him appear completely normal, albeit quirky (think Norman Bates). This serves two purposes - first, it would be easier to believe that the family would stay there in the first place. Second, it would help throw off suspicion of any wrong-doing. As for the Master, I would make him Manos, instead of having Manos be the deity that the Master worships. He would be a Devil-like creature - the epitome of all evil. He would have very definite powers such as the power to possess and the power to shapeshift. I'd probably have the Torgo character and Margaret find a mutual attraction, to add motivation for Torgo to defy the master and to add conflict between Mike & Margaret. This is just an example of the many things that could possibly make this movie an enjoyable experience.In the end, I have to give Hal Warren a little credit. I'd be willing to bet that there are far worse things that were put onto film by well known directors on their first try - I don't mean their first feature film, I mean the very first time they ever rolled film to try to tell a story. Hey, almost 7,000 people have rated it on the IMDb, and I'm sure that thousands of others have seen it. For a horror movie that was made 40 years ago on a shoestring budget by someone who'd never been involved with the movie industry, I'd say that's pretty cool. Worst movie ever? No, and here's why: Hal Warren & the entire cast and crew just didn't have the know-how to make a better movie. I'd reserve the honor of Worst Movie for something like "Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle", where EVERYONE involved should have known better.

WHAT WAS HE THINKING?! This is just SO incredibly awful! But, hey, it gave MST3K a lot to work with! The plot is paper thin, you don't care about the characters, the audio and video is awful, or as Joel says when they're pulled over by the cops, "That's just one guy doing all the voices, just one guy!" I wonder if good Old Mr. Warren was having a rather slow day at the Fertilizer Business, and his mind just came up with this just like that! And the name! Manos: The Hands of Fate?! Or, again in the words of MST3K, "Well, you know, "Manos", just not in so many words." Like the only references to hands in this whole thing is that there are all the burned hands on the... something, the focus is so bad you can barely tell what anything is, and that the Master has hands pained on his cape. Other than that, Gu-HUH?

reviews.review_title: A must see! So terrible, it's fantastic!
reviews.content: You know this movie really is terrible. But it's laughably, wonderfully, pass me another beer terrible. I couldn't stop laughing (not what the filmmaker was looking for, I assume). My wife and I just HAD to see it after the article in Entertainment Weekly. Now having seen it, I can safely say it's probably the worst movie I've seen in its entirety, but I loved every frame! There may be worse movies, but I've walked out or stopped the tape in the middle.So, Manos: The Hands of Fate is not the worst movie I've ever seen (this honor is held by The Thin Red Line, but I digress), and it's not without it's artistic flairs (I hesitate to call them 'merits'). Dig the images of Hands throughout the movie. Try to count them all. I bet you'll miss one or two. The camera used for the filming did not record sound, so the dialog and sounds were dubbed in later during editing, and knowing this, the film makers did their best to not often show people's mouths while they were speaking. So A for effort for working around the limitations of your equipment (F for effort for not, like, buying another camera? or a sound recorder and slate... but I digress).Let's talk about the acting. Gosh. About 2 minutes in, you can see why Mystery Science Theatre panned this movie. But the performance of John Reynolds as Torgo is fascinating to watch. (Not necessarily good fascinating, like, say, Anthony Hopkins in Silence of the Lambs, but you know, funny fascinating). It's entertaining and somewhat poignant, as we know he committed suicide shortly after filming. The article lead me to believe he was tripping on acid while filming, and this is borne out in the on-screen footage. One finds the pondering of this man's plight more interesting than the movie itself.Torgo's deformed legs are never really explained, though the EW article said he was a half goat satyr. In my opinion, this is not borne out by the on-screen footage. Plot-wise, (shudder) it's stock, with many clichés and some narrative blunders that don't make sense and absurdly repetitive dialog. And repetitive dialog. Did I mention the repetitive dialog? It's a drinking game in the making. There's also a protracted (but not very dangerous looking) cat-fight scene between six women clad in cheap curtains, and The Master's robes are actually very cool, except when he hikes them up to walk around and you can see his skinny, white little legs. Not as intimidating as the portrait that we get to study in detail for a good five or six minutes total. Compelling footage, that.So, should you see this movie? YES! YES I SAY. Get some buddies and make a Rocky Horror-esquire night of it. You must watch it, and LOVE EVERY MOMENT! This is the Law of Manos!

My boyfriend and I were planning on watching this together, however after a long think to myself I couldn't resist watching this mess of a movie alone. You might be reassured to hear that I completely plan on watching this film again, not because I'm a huge fan of horror and the thrill of being scared, but because it's not everyday I find a film that actually makes me genuinely laugh.The first thing I noticed about this film is how the audio doesn't fit with the character's mouths. The screeches and whines of the characters accompanied with delayed reactions and simply over exaggerated faces make up for how bad the voice actors were at voice acting. Not that the actors on screen were much better, but right from the start of the film i was laughing. Several lines are also repeated many times, which could be blamed on bad scriptwriting, but I choose to believe were to present the duration of this family's roadtrip, and that despite how long and boring it is, it is so much better than what will happen to them eventually.The score of this movie was not at all creative. The composer seems to have grabbed a piano, sat at one edge and pressed a few random keys individually and recorded that for 30 seconds. At first, I didn't think the score was all that bad - it at least fits with the emotional time of the film - however when I realised that the piano would stop, and five seconds later start again from the beginning, and continue this throughout the entire film, every time I heard the first couple notes I would burst out laughing once again.I also laughed a lot at the cuts throughout middles of scenes. The camera that was used in the film only filmed 32 seconds with every take, and so every time a scene is longer than that, it cuts out. For the most part, that wouldn't have been a problem if everything on set freezed while they started the new take, however it's completely obvious that the actors decided to take yet another shot of LSD and the camera men decide to put the camera down for a while before picking it back up.The editing of this movie was done with minimal effort. A scene which involves lots of emotion will suddenly cut to a bunch of stationary people who wait a few seconds, and then go back into character. Simple editing mistakes can be forgiven, however when the actors haven't even got into character yet, shouldn't it be common sense that the editor cuts out all irrelevant content? Unless, of course, they were trying to make their film longer.In summary, if you plan on watching this film with the mindset of a serious film critic: don't. It won't be worth your time. While this film was created with the intention of being serious, the cast and crew were mainly high on LSD. Take it with a grain of salt and enjoy it for what it is, not what it could have been.

Manos: The Hands of Fate. This "movie" is perfect example of how not to make a film. Gross technical mistakes(Shoot the camera already!), sickening dubbing, Torgo's retarded legs, plot which could be described as cheese treated with AP-bullets shot with AK-47s and outrageously bad actors. Combine this with maddening soundtrack and you have Manos. Hall Warren really is awesome guy. He managed to produce something worse than Plan 9 or Eternal Evil of Asia(reaaally classic Hong Kong-horror). If you don't believe this, just check it for yourself. But be prepared for mental mutilation(I can't shake Torgo theme out of my head). Only thing this piece of carbage can be used, is torture(Speak, or you'll watch Manos non-stop for week!). If you have relatives or friends you hate, just tie them to the chair in the front of your computer or VCR and press Play. Use gag if screaming bothers.

I think the commentary here is WAY too negative. Rather than calling it one of the worst movies ever made, we really need to say that "Manos, the Hands of Fate" is actually the 3,443,229th BEST film ever made!Seriously (ha), isn't watching this movie sort of like having a bad dream you can't wake up from? Certain movies have that quality, making me suspect that hell will actually be much like MST3K but without the funny commentary...

Hilariously bad, Manos gets more out of the few dollars (read very few) that is spent to create one of the worst, but funny horror movies ever made. That pseudo-avant jazz soundtrack was probably the only thing done right in such a stinker of this magnitude.

This movie... Oh man, this has to be the worst movie I've ever seen, and I've seen a lot of bad movies (being a "Mystery Science Theater 3000" junkie). And why, of all things, did THIS have to be filmed in my home-town (El Paso, TX)?! Oh well, it's not the end of the world. Anyway, if you ever happen to visit El Paso and want to see some authentic "Manos..." filming locations (HA!), drive down this road called Scenic Drive. That's where they filmed the first scene, on that mountain viewpoint. Like I said before, "Manos: The Hands of Fate" stunk to high Heaven. The twisted ending was big surprise, though...

Ugh. No way could I watch this without MST.  Without a doubt, the worst film ever made, barring even the likes of Zardoz and Plan 9.  What were they thinking when they actually printed this piece of cinema??? I would rather get a hot coffee enema or a sharp stick in the eye than have to watch this film without Joel and the bots...

reviews.review_title: The horror! Please! Make it stop!
reviews.content: Few movies make a room full of people cry, writhing in physical pain.This is truly a horror movie, for I have a deathly fear of seeing a sequel.Anyone who sees this movie without the aid of Mystery Science Theatre 3000 deserves a medal for bravery and a reprimand for stupidity.Ouch.

I think that most of the other reviews have warned off anyone but the die hard bad movie fans. But just in case some young men saw passages about a harem of women under the thumb of the Master...This movie is not sexy.  It's just awful. You can't imagine. If you show this as a stag film, you'll be beaten with sharp things. If you snuggle up to your honey and suggest, in a sultry bedroom voice, "Hey hon, let's watch Manos: Hands of Fate", then expect to wake up in the ER. And yes, it IS your fault.Not sexy.

While I enjoy watching a bad movie here and there, making fun of it, there is no fun to make of in this "Film". While most bad movies are the least bit entertaining and made with heart, this is not. It's just plain boring, and has no heart behind it. not a single member of cast or crew was paid for this monstrosity, not a single one. The director didn't care, he just wanted to contribute for himself, not the viewers, But himself. I can't even make fun of this movie it's so boring. I've seen this movie 5 times, so that's about 5 hours of my life wasted looking for at least one redeeming quality or something to poke fun at. I highly recommend to never sit down and watch this, it's a waste of time. That is what should be taken away from this film, It's a waste. I'd rather watch "Who Killed Captain Alex?", which was made with an estimated 200$ and is several thousand times more entertaining (and is one of my favorite films of all time, Unironically), and made with heart unlike this "Movie".Avoid this "film" at all costs

reviews.review_title: This movie made my sister manic-depressive; she now speaks only dead languages and has a fascination with fields.
reviews.content: All right, I admit I'm exaggerating.  But it gave my 15-year-old sister major shakes to sit through this -- and we watched the MST3K version!There are so many things about this movie I don't understand.  Manos must be served, says the master, but why does that entail him having a private harem and a weak-kneed butler?  Why do Mike, Maggie, and their monosyllabic daughter spend so much time driving past vacant fields?  Why does the cop deliver a small monologue on the evils of tail light problems?  What is with the couple in the car whose idea of making out is plain kissing?  Why is it that, at the end, we spend about ten minutes driving in the rain with no dialogue occurring -- just watching the windshield wipers do their thing? (Although the phony dialogue inserted by Tom Servo in the MST episode is hysterical.)  I watched the credits right along with Joel and the bots -- why do they end with "The End?"?  Why the question mark?  Were they actually considering a sequel to this cinematic monstrosity?  Was this black mark on their resumes the reason that Torgo and Maggie both killed themselves?Thank God for (the sadly departed) MST3K.  Only they could make this movie tolerable.  On the whole, I hated this movie so much I loved it.

The ONLY way to watch this movie!  Joel and the 'Bots are in RARE form on this one!  It's a little hard to watch since I recently found out that John Reynolds (Torgo) took his own life the year that the movie was released, but it's still fun to watch Joel and the 'Bots having possibly the worst, or best (depending on your point of view), time of their lives...

reviews.review_title: best worst movie of all time
reviews.content: i have never had the privilege of seeing this movie bot-free, but it would be interesting to see it un-mst3k-ified.  one can't deny that it beats battlefield earth in quality, acting ability, coherence, continuity, and lighting, however, it really is a sucky movie.  apparently the actors couldn't deal with it either, as their careers or lives evidently all ended afterward. considering the primitive nature of equipment employed in the filming, it's a wonder that it looks as good as it does.  in all honesty, if it were a student film, it would be considered a fine piece of beginners work. after all, it does have a beginning, and middle, and an end, which is more than one can say for some multimillion dollar films. in the final analysis, it is an historical curiosity that stands outside the continuum of film making--an example of what someone with a big idea and some money can accomplish if unhampered by talent or experience. 1 out of 10, folks.

***SPOILERS***   ***SPOILERS*** Well folks, it does not get any worse than this. Being a long time viewer of terrible/cheesy/campy films most of my life, I can safely say that this "movie", if you can call it that, is an exercise in how NOT to make a movie. Every aspect, whether on the technical side or the acting side makes most first year film student's efforts look like Gone With the Wind. Therefore, it is not suprising that this movie was written, directed, produced and starred one named Hal P. Warren. Who is Mr. Warren, you say? Well, he was a Texas Fertilzer salesman. The following review will show you why his movie and business were mirror images of each other and why it cannot really contain spoilers.First, the "plot". Do NOT hold your breath on this one. There is none. The movie starts out with a family consisting of Incomptent Dad (Hal P. Warren - who'd thunk?), Hysterical Mom, little girl (who must have been scarred for life for being in this movie) and pooch going on vacation, to a place called the Valley Lodge. This lodge is located about 50 meters to left side of the planet Pluto. Hence, the first 15 minutes of this movie is NOTHING but stock footage of the family driving past country fields. They drive and drive and drive and after awhile, you will get carsick. Finally, they get lost and come across a little ramshackle house. Waiting to greet them is one of the most memorable characters in movie history, Torgo. Torgo is supposed to be a half-man/half-goat, a satyr. The movie makes this look authentic by having Torgo wear watermelons in his pants. (REAL SCARY!) Torgo has many memorable lines such as, "I am Torgo, I take care of place the when the mAsTeR is away!" and "There is no way out of here, it will be dark soon, there is no way out of here." Torgo also speaks in a sort of drunken sign-song voice that sounds half stoned, half like he is straining on the toilet.Anyway, Incompetent Dad overcomes the protests of the others and convinces Torgo to let them stay the night, since "It will be dark soon." After about another 20 minutes of nothing, Incompetent Dad and Hysterical Mom see a painting of the Master, who looks like Frank Zappa after a rough night. After this, the pooch wanders off and is eaten by the Master's Hell Beast and the little girl stumbles across the Master and his "wives", clad in sheer nightgowns, all sleeping on stone slabs, in I assume, the backyard of the house. Well, the Master (who I think is supposed to be some sort of evil priest) wakes up, speaks into a cloud of smoke and intones the Will of Manos all the while throwing up his hands that show off his funky zippered black robe complete with funky red hands emblazoned on them. His wives then wake up, start arguing, then get into a wrestling match that only Jerry Springer could admire.While all of this is going on, Torgo makes a clumsy, drunken pass at Hysterical Mom, Incompetent Dad is hit over the with Torgo's walking stick and tied to a tree. After this, Torgo (did I mention he is killed THREE times in this movie?!), goes back to the house, has the Master "kill" him by having a staff waved in front of him, and is taken back to the wives who then massage him to death on one of the stone slabs. However, he is not really dead. So, the Master makes sure he will leave the house by burning his hand off. Torgo then runs out of the scene and the movie. Finally, after all of this, the Master and his wives start going after the family. Incompetent Dad wakes up, free himself, gets his gun, gathers his family and tells them to get back into the house because, he says, IT IS THE SAFEST PLACE. Mother of God!! Predictably, the Master captures them, Incompetent Dad becomes the new Torgo, and the wife and little girl become new wives for the Master. (Rather sick when you think about it)By the way, there is a couple who sit in a car and make out throught the entire movie, while constantly being pestered by two local redneck cops. This has NOTHING to do with the movie, but it is there anyway. Another testimony to the lunacy of this film.Second, the techincal lapses. The film quality is poor because all they had was a hand cranked DMV-type camera that could only record 30 seconds of film at a time. In one scene during the driving sequence the camera dissolves into the exact same scene. And the color prints are as faded as a red shirt going through 50 washings in Clorox 2. The camera also could not record sound, therefore, all voices were dubbed in later by Warren and his wife and this is VERY evident. Also, the acting is on par with a kindergarten play and is as wooden as Louisville Slugger baseball bat. And one more interesting fact. "Manos" in Spanish means "hands". So, the real title of this movie is "Hands, the Hands of Fate".Seeing that this is usually rated as the worst movie ever made on the Internet Movie Database, I must concur. However, I give this one a 1, only because of Torgo and the fact that Mystery Science Theatre 3000 made this a classic episode. For how bad it is, this movie is a must see. Score: 1/10

and I bet you all thought Ed wood was the worst director of all time, didn't you? Well, at least his films have niceties like actors, studios, plot, budgets, sound technicians and cameras that can shoot more then 30 seconds of film at a time. Well, you won't find anything like that in "Manos", a film that breaks all boundaries, and even crosses into other planes of existence with dreadfulness.I really don't know weather or not I can call it a "film" in any conventional sense. you see, even though you know it can't be true in the back of your mind, it looks an awful lot like a home movie. No joke. the lead actor and director/writer share the same last name, the "actors" seem like they are aunts and nieces called in on favors, and the movie had to have its sound edited in later (using only three voices for everyone).I don't know where to start. a script that seems like it was up as they went along, no motives for anyone to do anything and... what? the "scary" scenes? Oh, dear lord. the best parts of the movie, really. the "sacrifice" scene had me screaming with laughter, I won't spoil it for you. Ah, and how could I forget Torgo. he servant of Manos, he completely steals the show. with his cracking voice, bloated thighs and hunched over gait, he is truly a cult celebrity, and the best actor in Manos, too (not saying much).Manos is not something that can be described, nor can it be properly reviewed. It is an experience, one you must have for yourself. It also makes a good stocking stuffer for someone whom you would like to see dead, but haven't the guts to do 'em in yourself.

I was amazed to find that Manos is not the undisputed worst movie of all time in the IMDB.  (But I haven't seen Future War or Chicken Park.)  From the aimless, endless driving sequence that opens the film to the stultifyingly unfrightening goings-on at the mysterious house, this movie has absolutely nothing to recommend it.  Well, except the catfight amongst the many brides of Manos, perhaps.  I was utterly confused by the sequence in which our hero Michael gets kissed and slapped by one of the brides until I learned that the "actor" playing Michael also wrote, directed, produced, etc. this cinematic horror.  I can almost hear him: "C'mon, baby, it's integral to the story!"  Do NOT attempt to watch this movie except on MST3K!

This has got to be the worst movie ever made.  The thing looks like a home movie that was filmed on an 8mm camera.  I'm serious.  This movie is just horrible.  Don't ever watch it unless it's the MST3000 version.

This movie is a tremendous film that the entire family can enjoy! Women will enjoy the three handsome guys in this movie: 1) Torgo, whose slick passes at females and his snappy double entrendes rival James Bond, 2) The handsome Devil, who has more wives than he knows what to do with, but can always add a couple more (making him perfect for women who like "players"), and 3) Michael, the husband, whose good sense and tremendous desicion making abilities almost outweigh his good looks and charm. Men will enjoy the endless scenes of semi attractive women wrestling for some strange reason. Children will enjoy the daughter's heart-piercing cries for help once her dog is mauled, and the suprise ending when she ends up as one of the devil's wives! A true delight!And if you can't sense the sarcasm, then you are only half as stupid as the director of this movie, and that is the most vicious insult a person can deliver.This movie hurt me!!!!!!!!!!!!! I was depressed for the rest of the day. What really sucks is, Joel and the 'bots just aren't very funny, either.
SICKENING.

reviews.review_title: It Really is Beyond your Imagination!
reviews.content: I saw this one night while I rented the MST3K version. I couldn't even sit through the MST3K version! This movie, every element about it, is just absolutely awful. The acting is stale, the story is as slow as frozen molasses, the set is vacant, the sounds and music are sleep-inducing, and the action is awful. It's like the actors and actresses where randomly chosen out off of the street, and they didn't rehearse. If you want to subject yourself to the horror that is Manos: Hands of Fate (when translated meaning "Hands: Hands of Fate") you should probably take your sleeping pills. This one won't even matter if you sleep through. It has no meaning at all.

This movie is already well manifested in pop-culture lore, so I wont really bother getting into the plot. you've probably seen it already anyway, whether it is on that show with the joking robots or one of the countless public domain sources out there.If this really is the WORST movies ever created should entirely be a matter of personal taste, and who really has seen all movies ever made to rightfully make that statement? I would add that it at least can redeem itself with a somehow consistent storyline. But either way, it is much possible among the POORLIEST PRODUCED movies by far. The shots are rarely focused, the editing is mangled, the actors often seems without any directions (notice one shot where the daughter should be asleep but get up and leave the room for no good reason!), and while it could be classified as weird nothing is ever sexy of mysterious as it probably was intended as. The worst problem is still the sound though, with a primitive, under-casted dubbing that makes it really difficult to figure out who's supposed to say what in most dialog scenes!But all things aside, there is a concluded plot that even features a single surprise, something other movies are lacking. If the filmmaker knew what he was doing, maybe this could've been a... eh, passable horror movie? But then again, would we be talking about it today?Originally The Hand was barely released, which in itself is an achievement, and then forgotten for generations. Today everyone seems to know about it and have an opinion that rarely differs. Even though many will claim that they hate it, they must've wanted to see it in the first place. Considering how many movies from the same year, good and bad, that no one knows about today, this one doesn't do too bad.

This stinker makes Plan 9 From Outer Space look like Star Wars.  For those of you who are familiar with Mystery Science Theater 3000 but haven't seen their send up of Manos, this film is so awful that Dr. Forrester and TV's Frank actually APOLOGIZED to Joel and the bots for subjecting them to it. The English language, brimming as it is with creative insults, simply does not contain invective foul enough to accurately describe how truly awful this film is.  It is far and away the WORST film I have ever seen.

reviews.review_title: Not As Bad As You Think
reviews.content: For all the bad press it gets, it only deserves about %40 of it. It's a decent Horror Film, and The Master is sort of creepy. Torgo is pretty weird, too, and sort of creepy too. Sure, he may be somewhat of a harmless fellow, but who wasn't scared when The Master burned his hand off, or when they scratched Torgo to death, and who wasn't confused when that little harmless daughter became a wife of the Master (Never Thought of Him as a Pedophile)? And who else thought to themselves at the end, "How long has this been going on?" For all we know, The Master has been doing this since the 1800s. And for all we know, he's some sort of demigod or demon. He is probably one of the most intriguing horror characters of the sixties (Don't worry, Bates is still number 1).

reviews.review_title: How do you describe a Train Wreck?
reviews.content: How do you describe a complete train wreck?  Manos-(which means hands) the Hands of Fate is the worst film ever made, period.  The title should be the first clue, it's translated as "Hands - The Hands of Fate". This one has to be seen to be believed!  Plot?  There isn't one here, just a bunch of ridiculous scenes mashed together.  For you bad movie buffs, just the scenes with Torgo (the caretaker) make suffering through this film worth it. Torgo has a knee disfigurement that has to be seen to be believed.  The whole film, except for a scene or two is shot out of focus.  If you are looking for entertainment in a film, this is not the film that you would pick-up at Blockbuster (unless it is the MST3K version).  If you love to laugh at bad movies, this is a must.  The director (Hal Warren) has created a film that makes Ed Wood films look like he as a director that is the second coming of Cecil B. Demille or Stephen Spielberg.  The only director that would come close to the ineptitude of Hal Warren is Coleman Francis.

reviews.review_title: Manos hands of WORST movie EVER!!
reviews.content: What can I say the numbers don't lie.... one of the worst movies ever. I have never sat through anything that made 2 hours feel like 2 days. The long driving scene in the beginning and the husband not asking directions at all. Was it necessary to see the "making out" couple (in the same spot mind you) that many times. Does anybody stop at a creepy ass house with a demented "caretaker" Torgo with um deformed knees and say OK family we are gonna stay here tonight? The editing is horrible and the music speaks for itself. Even MST3K couldn't make it watchable I never want to view this movie again. I don't have anything good to say about this movie; it is bad,actually painful to sit through I'm not kidding.

Movie made by a fertilizer salesman who must have ingested large quantities of the stuff while writing, starring and directing this disasterpiece. You will be simultaneously humored, baffled and incredulous as you watch the confounding plot, absurd characters and bad acting (and I use the terms plot and acting most loosely). If this movie had come out prior to the development of water torture, the Chinese would have just put the tape in the VCR and used the extra water on the lawn.

How do you begin critiquing the worst movie ever made? Entertainment Weekly recently gave it a decent shot, though their article focused more on the history and making-of. Here is my take on this wonderful piece of cinematic horror.In what is perhaps the most delicious coincidence of all time, Manos was directed by a fertilizer salesman. Yes, a fertilizer salesman. His name is Hal Warren. The film sank into well-deserved obscurity after its 1966 release, not to be unearthed until the television show Mystery Science Theater 3000 dug it from the depths of B-moviedom. Devoted to making fun of awful movies, the comedy team didn't realize they were creating a cultural phenomenon.Chances are, if MST3K creator Joel Hodgson and his gang hadn't found Manos, no one would have been aware of its existence. A few of its flaws are obvious upon first glance: the ineptitude of the title, for instance, which translates to Hands: The Hands of Fate. I can't help what wonder what would have happened if the film made it to international release. Would they have called it Hands: Las Manos del Sino? And needless to say, it is never made clear exactly what (or who) the hands of fate are supposed to be.Oftentimes, people who are involved in the production of MST3K fodder complain that the show didn't do their films justice. The brains behind Manos had the good sense not to do this, and for great reason: the uncut, un-riffed version of the film is no better than the MST3K'd one. In fact, it is much, much worse.It's the story of a vacationing family who is forced to stay at a creepy old house because their car broke down. So far, so good. The guy who lives there is a mumbling bearded fellow (as the MST3K team put it, he "looks like a chainsaw sculpture") with huge, deformed knees. (As it turns out, he's supposed to be a satyr, but they only show his paper-mâché hooves once. In the MSTed version, the row of "theater seats" makes them invisible.) He speaks constantly about "The Master." His two trademark lines are "I am Torgo. I take care of the house while the Master is away" and "the Master would not approve." He grudgingly allows the family to stay in the house, even though, surprisingly, "the master would not approve".Then, all hell breaks loose. Literally.Actually not, unless you count women in diaphanous gowns fighting each other to be "hell". As it turns out, The Master (Tom Neyman) is a member of the undead. He worships a god called Manos, or something. He has a ton of wives, also undead, who like to sit around and have loud, semi-coherent arguments that consist mostly of single-syllable words. Sometimes they wrestle. Of course. At some point it becomes clear that The Master wishes to keep Mrs. Generic Horror Movie Heroine as his own. But so does Torgo! Oh noes! Whatever will they do? Fortunately Torgo is limited to traveling at about 2 inches per hour, thanks to his immobile knees. It's not really a fair fight.Stuff happens. Unlike most bad horror movies, this doesn't even have a happy ending. Only pain and darkness await. All the voices are dubbed - badly - because the video camera that Warren used couldn't record sound. Torgo speaks as if someone is jabbing him repeatedly in the throat. But the crowning glory, I think, is the elegant speech made by The Master's oldest wife as they all argue about whom to kill: "Man, yes! Girl, no!" To which MST3K's Crow T. Robot quips, "Cheese? Maybe!" Cheese indeed.

reviews.review_title: Second Worst Movie I have seen
reviews.content: The movie is bad, but it has a discernible beginning, a middle, an end and a coherent, if poorly done plot. The characters are shallow, poorly acted and directed, but at least they make some sense as to have a reason to be there within the confines of the plot. Therefore not the worst I have seen (that distinction is reserved for "Nymphoid Barbarian in Dinosaur Hell").As others have said, watch the MST3K version. If this move has overarching lessons it is: (1) admit you are lost and turn back to the place you last knew, where you were and get directions again, (2) if your wife says, "honey, I'm scared and don't like the look of this place", listen to her and turn back around, and (3) if the same two local cops keep busting you for making out with your gal, in you car, do not keep going back to the same place to suck face.

There is nothing I can say about this film that has not already been expressed far more eloquently in the 20+ pages of comments below. Most bad horror movies have a redemptive campiness that makes them fun; MANOS: THE HANDS OF FATE is literally painful to watch. It is a dual suffering brought on by the agonising tedium of actually watching the film, in addition to a feeling of acute embarrassment for the people involved in making it. When a film is so bad that you begin to feel genuine sympathy for the actors as human beings . . . brother, that's bad. The over-all effect is stunning--stunning in the sense that for several minutes after finishing the film, you will flounder for words to adequately describe your mixture of rage, disgust, and humour.Do not watch this film at all, not even for its curiosity value.

This has to be one of the worst films ever made. It's like watching nothing for an hour. Literally, nothing happens at all, there really aren't any elements that could classify it as a horror film. If you were to take a movie trailer for a film that only slightly interested you and expand on that until it was 70 some minutes long, you'd have this movie. There's an endless amount of driving at it's start and the score doesn't match up with the film at all it doesn't set any kind of real mood. I'd say avoid this even if it meant your own death. I can't even say that watching it with the MST3 helped because they even have moments of long pause where it seems the film is just too much for them to bare. Utter craziness.

reviews.review_title: A so awful they named it "Hands: The Hands Of Fate"
reviews.content: When a person reads reviews for a notably terrible film, he or she expects that upon reading such a review, they should become armed with a sort of knowledge that will better enable them to enjoy some of the finer details of that film. But, as far as "Manos: The Hands Of Fate" is concerned, no amount of reading up or preparing will allow you to make the 74 minutes of your life that were just wasted return to you. There is nothing to be gained from watching this film other than the bragging rites that you had. Even this feels hollow, as you are bragging that you had spent time watching the so-called worst movie in existence. There is nothing funny about this film. The poor acting, terrible plot, unsteady filming, and mind-numbing soundtrack do not combine to create anything other than a waste of time. I had expected that watching this film would be a humorous, tear inducing experience. In truth, it was little more than enraging. After the movie, the questions left unanswered did not make the movie entertaining to bash, but reinforced the feeling of anguish that the film left in its wake. I do not recommend that anyone reading this article should watch the movie. But, should you feel compelled to do so, bring a friend, this movie is not for the feint-hearted.

One hell of a bad movie. Boring, for the most part, although Torgo was somewhat amusing. The movie contains all sorts of stupid stuff like Torgo's turn in the middle that came out of pretty much nowhere, although I have to admit I did like the IDEA behind the ending - with Torgo being replaced by the male protagonist.Oh, and all the characters other than Torgo and the Master (to some extent) are incredibly forgettable. The story is forgettable, the soundtrack is... actually, decent enough (I do like the master's little musical cue, though I find Torgo's is a bit too lighthearted for this kind of movie.)Certainly a legendarily bad film, worth watching for a taste of how low you can go - whilst not the worst of the worst, definitely a worthy contender.

reviews.review_title: It's so much fun to watch....
reviews.content: ...the MST3K version!! Well what did you think I meant, this movie!?? This is a must see for everyone, simply because no explanation could convey the experience. It's like aliens from a distant galaxy received a grainy 30 second transmission of a Ray Dennis Steckler film and used it as the basis for writing "Manos". Of course we all know Hal Warren deserves the blame here. Blaming it on aliens is not fair to the aliens.Oh and good job by the IMDB staff, for cleaning out all the erroneous "suicide" listings in the various actor's info pages. The only one who committed suicide was John "Torgo" Reynolds. Too bad, he would never know how famous he would someday be.

reviews.review_title: Not scary, very funny, badly made
reviews.content: I have one word for this movie "Cheap" Even if i had the lowest budget in the world, I'm positive i could make a better movie then this, in fact I'm writing a script for a movie right now that will definitely be better then this, even if it doesn't make it to theaters.This movie had No point to it, half the parts made no sense, like the couple making out in the car and the police pulling them over, it had nothing to do with the movie, they might have giving the police some incite as to where the family went, but its like the police did anything about it, and there were some other parts, but one of the parts that got me the most was the beginning all the scenery going by for like five minutes and then the scenery going backwards again for another five minutes.And I'm sorry but if i saw a man like Torgo i would just leave, they had no sense of judgment or anything, i mean if i saw a man talking about "The master" i would not stay at his hotel, and the place they were staying at didn't even look like a hotel or motel, and seeing the inside with the crappy drawn picture i mean come on, no one would stay there, unless of course what happened in the movie "Oh no the car broke down" thats just classic, the mint condition convertible suddenly just doesn't work and oh no its night out, better not go outside.The whole movie was a mess, it shouldn't have been made, there are parts that are so corny, even the oldest movies didn't do it, like when Togo hits Micheal with the stick and suddenly Micheal is out and Togo ties his hands to the tree, I'm sorry i could go on an on about this movie, about how bad it was.This movie on my part though was quite entertaining i laughed at almost every scene on it, plus i have the mystery science theater version so there comments on the movie made me laugh, if anything i would suggest buying the mystery science theater version of this, and then you can tell all your friends how you saw "The crappiest movie ever made in the history of entertainment". its worth the buy, trust me

reviews.review_title: It's a stinker, but it's not the worst
reviews.content: I agree with most of the comments I've seen so far. The acting was horrible, the lighting and camerawork sucked. The editing has to be the worst I've ever seen and the dubbing was so bad it made you wonder if they even viewed this when it was overdubbed or just read lines in a tape recorder. This is one you have to medicate yourself (with your choice of substance) before watching.Yeah it's a stinker, but is it the worst? Not by a long shot considering they only had $19,000 to work with. I knew in the first ten minutes that this was going to be the most amateurish looking movie I had ever see, even worse than Cornman: American Vegetable Hero.But still, with a gun to my head and a choice between this movie and Volcano, Manos, The Hand of Fate would be my pick.I'd give it a 1.5/10

Ah, MST3K. Where would we be without it? Many would say that some of the "films" presented on that show would be better off without the talking silhouettes at the bottom of the screen. Apparently those people haven't seen "Manos, the Hands of Fate". Boldly declaring its' individuality, this film reeks from start to finish, with a muddled voice track, a gratingly harsh musical score, filmography "courtesy of Zapruder" (as commented on another film given the MST3K treatment), and acting that screams, "Look at what I learned in Summer Stock!" To go into the "plot" is an exercise in futility. Suffice to say that a hapless couple ventures into the domain of the Dark Lord (who apparently shares quarters with Henry Lee Lucas) and are confronted by Torgo, whose sins against humanity have damned him to an eternal life of stammering and giant, wobbly knees. The Prince of Darkness looks like a college acting teacher, his coven of wives wrestle at the drop of a hat, and the peripheral "hero" looks like Jack Klugman. In other words, bleagh.

reviews.review_title: Manos: A Fate Worse Than Death
reviews.content: There are many truly abysmal movies out there. I will admit that movies like "Glitter" and "Karate Cop" are pretty awful. They may even deserve bottom 10 slots on the worst movies ever list. But I can guarantee that no movie ever made, or that will ever be made, is worse than Manos: The Hands Of Fate. In the MST3K version, its badness is made tolerable, even entertaining by the merciless stream of satire voiced by the MST cast. However, the movie itself is one of the rare movies that can cause you physical pain the keep watching. No matter how bad you thought some movie was because no-one could act and the plot was cheesy, just say to yourself, "at least they had multiple sets, a special effects budget, and more than 2 people doing the dialog". because such joys hang upon Manos like a new steaming dog turd in the middle of an already turd-covered field. you are going to either rate this movie a 1 or a 10. A 1 if you watched the movie, and a 10 if you didn't but want to up-vote this out of the way of "Kazaam".

I thought a friend of mine was exaggerating when he told me this was the worst movie ever made.  Well, he was wrong.  This movie is so bad it's not even in the running.  This is The Anti-Movie.  What's wrong with it you ask? The sound for one.  I've never heard a little girl with such a deep voice. The monster (Torgo) looked like he had pillows for knees.  The Master's robe looked like Paul Bunyan had fingerpainted on it.  And the director must have forgotten to pay the electric bill.  I could go on, but I've got to clean my ears.  The only highlight, the haunting Torgo theme music.

reviews.review_title: it was a little creepy, kinda-sorta...
reviews.content: Admittedly, this is one of the worst ever.  However, this movie had potential.  Watching it in the daytime made it really lame (even with the MST3K treatment), but when I watched it late at night, with all the lights turned off, it REALLY creeped me out.  I mean, here you are, stuck in the middle of nowhere, sharing a house with a big-kneed mongoloid and "The Master", it's dark, the background music is creepy, the crazy teenagers are necking while drunk, you're not getting paid CLOSE to scale, and the writer/director/producer/star is a fertilizer salesman from Texas...But maybe it's just me, i dunno.

reviews.review_title: It kept me all night... wondering how something could be so bad!
reviews.content: It was, by far, the most horrid movie I've ever seen. It doesn't make sense how something could be so bad, I mean it wasn't even funny. I saw it on MST3K and I, who adores that show, couldn't stand to watch it any longer! In fact it was so bad that nobody that was in it ever stared in another movie, and three of the actors committed suicide the same year it was made... creepy. Do not see this film unless it is through MST3K, I warned you...

reviews.review_title: The sign pointed this way! Admit I'm right! Admit I'm Right!
reviews.content: Horrible.  Rancid.  Words in the English language can only begin to describe the backed up sewer system that is "Manos" the Hands of Fate.  Few movies even come remotely close to being this awful (Hobgoblins, the Incredibly Mixed-up Teenagers ad nauseum, Incredible Melting Man, and Fire Maidens of Outer Space). Without a doubt the Worst Piece of S--t ever placed on film. Only view the MST3K (rest in peace) version unless you are completley deranged.  Strangely, not the most depressing film ever, as High School Big Shot has that claim, but pretty damn depressing, none the less!

Let me just say I'm glad only 2 people acted after this. If the above comment was true and this was on a dare then it was probably done with locals who had maybe acted in a play, although clearly acting prowess isn't needed in this movie.I havent seen this in years and I still get queezy thinking about it. For those of you who were blessed to miss this on MST3K, let's just say this is the only movie the scientists actually APOLOGIZED showing them. It's that bad...Watch it once if you want to figure out all the appearences by torgo scattered throughout the series, then destroy it.

reviews.review_title: The Worst Movie of All Time
reviews.content: This movie was simply MADE for Mystery Science Theatre 3000. It''s people standing around saying things (sometimes known as a poor excuse of "acting") and a dead limp plot untill someone in the movie gets SLAPPED TO DEATH. Slap (no pun intended) on an mst3k filter and youve got one of the funniest movies of all time. See this movie!

My rating is for the non-Mystery Science Theater 3000 version of the movie. I'd give Alienator's review a 10 out of 10 if there were multiple vote spaces. I've rarely seen such a thoughtful review on a message board site. Most of the time, people either gush about how great a movie was or gripe about what a miserable failure it was. I've been guilty myself of doing both in the past. I've also managed to write some balanced, thoughtful reviews too. It's not easy to do, especially if you have very strong feelings either negative or positive about the film. This Alienator person should be a professional movie critic like Roger Ebert if he or she isn't one already.Personally, I find the non MSTK version of this film to be very bad, but not the worst ever. The MSTK version is quite funny at times due to the trio's antics. I won't go so far as to say that it is the worst film of all time though. Like Alienator, I agree that given the conditions the film was created under and the skill of the filmmakers it's actually an amazing achievement that the film is still well known after all these years. Think of all the bigger budgeted, better casted films that have been made that have been all but forgotten. "Dr. Who and the Daleks" anyone? I'm a Dr. Who fan and own many of the TV episodes and movies including this one and even I think the movie is pretty horrible. I'm not sure that a non-Who fan could stand to watch it. How they ever got the great Peter Cushing to be in it is beyond me. Must have been really low on money.Or how about the great Orson Welles' version of Macbeth? He worked on it for a very long time and was never able to make a polished movie out of it. I really like most of Welles' work but Macbeth is terrible. Talk about poor editing, timing, lighting etc. The only saving grace of the entire film is Orson's acting. Every other aspect of the film is pretty bad. It was made early in his career and he was still learning. The main difference between Welles and the guy who directed Manos is that Welles didn't give up after his early attempts and kept trying and got better. Maybe with enough encouragement, funds and a lucky break or two the guys who made Manos could have done better in future movies instead of giving up after their first one.

reviews.review_title: One of my favourite movies of all time... REALLY
reviews.content: One of the best movies ever made. There is nothing else like this film. The soundtrack is incredible, the script and performances are memorable and unique, and the plot is mind melting. Dialogue was made to be so precise they re-recorded the entire audio in post production. Incredible sets and costumes, the master's being iconic. Watch this film. Do not listen to these idiots one here who do not appreciate art and rate it a low score. They will never understand the genius and cultural impact of this movie, far ahead of its time and still talked about more than 50 years later. Masterpiece 10/10.

Without a doubt, Manos: The hands of fate is the worst film ever made. Worse than Plan 9, worse than the Killer Tomatoes. Manos takes the cake. No acting, no plot, no dialogue, no nothing except a waste of time and film. Funny with MST3K, but I can't imagine anyone watching it without them. A must-see for bad movie people, but if your normal NEVER watch this movie, if you can call it that.0 of 10 stars. 0 of 4 stars.

I keep it short and simple. This movie doesn't even fit in the "so bad it's funny" category. It's so bad that you want to die while watching it and I watched the MST3K version and it still was pure pain and agony.So all I want to say is that don't watch it. I repeat DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE. Although I know you will, so have fun.

reviews.review_title: Who can ever make a movie this bad!!??
reviews.content: Can movies get any worse!? the first 10 minutes or so is just nothing but a card driving through fields, after that almost nothing else happens any way. The characters are awful the acting could not get any worse the plot is stupid, there just is no worse movies, I have absolutely no idea how a movie like this can get a score as high as 1.8 out of 10! If it possible I would rate this movie as high a negative score as possible, numbers don't get low enough to rate this movie! Its filled with flaws you can even see the zipper on the back of one of the costumes! this movie gives me nightmares it was just so awful nightmares that the director is coming over to visit me. This movie made my life not worth living, don't watch it, if I knew how bad it is I would never watch not for a million dollars, I will never be happy again now that I saw this.

The fact that someone actually paid to make this movie and thought it was a good idea is proof enough that PT Barnum was right: "Theres a sucker born every minute! Watching this movie without Mystery Science Theater 3000 commentary is quite possibly more impossible than getting a steak away from Rosie O'Donnell.

Shoot me now.  I believe those where the exact words I used after watching this movie...and I saw the MST3K version.  The worst movie ever.  The only redeeming value would be Torgo's knees.  The scariest part of the film. Great MST3K episode, on up there with Eegah.  Don't watch the regular film version.  You will be sick.  Horror?...No."Manos: Hands of Fate filmed on location in a vacant lot."

Why God? Why? A film about a grouchy father who spends a large portion of the film driving his family through the same scenery over and over again. Upon sudden darkness, decides to stop the car in the middle of nowhere and spend the night in what appears to be the 'after' portion of Changing Rooms. Add to this a mumbling and peverse man servant and an even odder 'Master' who thankfully spends most of the film asleep, then you have ample motivation to glue you eyelids shut. Even MST3K have difficulty making this seem amusing. A confused, head scratching movie.

reviews.review_title: MTHOF: Worst Movie Ever Made- let's keep it so!
reviews.content: If any of you have seen MTHOF then you know that without a doubt, by far, and unquestionably it is the worst movie ever produced: the cinematography is horrible, I think they only had one camera; the plot... yeah, what plot; the, um, actors? Sets?? Anyway, having seen it, I feel almost a personal bond to it- and would like to keep it as the worst movie ever, so vote 1 to keep it at the bottom of the list.  I wholeheartedly recommend watching this film, for it is not until you have seen the lower echelon of the very bottom of the barrel of filmmaking that you truly can appreciate a cinematographic work of art.  If you can make it through the film (try the Mystery Science Theater 3000 version, it helps), you will never forget the experience as long as you live, and you will have a newfound appreciation for the movies at the top of the list.  So, long live Manos! in the number 1 position.I Take Care Of The Place while the Master is Away,Carter

Manos has a great reputation, but it isn't true, the trully worst movies aren't even noteworthy, this however sits securely in the bad pantheon along with the works of Andy Milligan, Herschell Gordon Lewis, and Ed Wood. For me the best worst movie remains 1989's Things. I need in my collection now - Birdemic, The Room and Troll 2.

reviews.review_title: If You Must Choose Torture, Choose the MST3K Version
reviews.content: If I could rate this film a '0,' I would. However, the MST3K version redeems it. After all, the worse the movie, the funnier they make it.If you read the "trivia," you'll see just how awful the production was--and every bit of it shows. If you've ever seen student films (like, middle school student), then you have some idea of just how this film looks. Because the film could only capture a few sections at a time, there are lots of awkward cuts. And the dubbing is painfully obvious, and often out of sync.This movie is fabulous fodder for jokes, and I imagine if you're even looking on this page, that's why you're interested in watching it anyway.

reviews.review_title: The Biggest Pile of Fertilizer Ever Caught on Celluloid
reviews.content: The fact that this film was made by a fertilizer magnate is quite apt in my opinion.
