The only redeeming thing about this film is the hilarity of the Mystery Science 3000 treatment, other than that there is nothing about this film that is done with any quality approaching even the barest acceptable amateur level. The cinematography, editing, sound, acting, and script are all heaps from the fertilizer that the writer/producer/director/star of this film should have kept to pandering.This is truly the worst film that I have ever seen. If we really want to get information from terrorist suspects, we need only to force them to watch this "film" repeatedly until they break from the horror of the experience. Oh, wait that would be against the provisions of the Geneva Convention.Excuse me while I now go pour acid in my ear to purge the memory of this cinematic torture from my memory.

reviews.review_title: The stories about making this film are more intersting than the film....
reviews.content: Literally if you track down the short documentary "Hotel Torgo" and the sci-fi fanzine "Mimosa" which did two articles of interviews with surviving cast and crew, that stuff is more interesting than the actual film, even the new HD version of the final 16mm Ektachrome workprint (because the movie was blown up to full-screen 35mm for theatrical showings) which is sharp and good looking.In short, this film is a spiritual predecessor of all the '70s horror films where a group of teens go out to a place away from society and get killed by a monster or a cult. In "Manos" it's a family (mother, father, small daughter, her poodle) trying to find a hotel called "The Valley Lodge"; they get lost in their black '65 Ford convertable and instead find a smallish house off a dirt road with a caretaker who might be a Satyr who is named Torgo. He is the servant to an undead magician/cult leader called The Master who worships a god named Manos, and his cult are his undead brides, all dressed in goofy white robes. The Master wears a black robe with the outline of red hands and his facial hair makes him resemble Bill Buckner. The "plot" is the family finding out just how crazy the situation is, and trying to get away. Unlike most horror films of the mid-1960s, it has a downbeat ending.Why I gave the film four stars was that they shot it on 16mm home movie cameras, on their own time, and it took SIX MONTHS to make a 60-plus minute film. That's dedication. "Manos" had a shadowy run on the Southern drive-in circuit, joined the raft of B-movies sold to independent UHF TV stations in the 1970s, and would have been utterly obscure had not Frank Conniff of "Mystery Science Theater" not found it. "Manos" is the perfect example of the self-financed, independent regional film (El Paso, Tx.), and should be shown in film schools for how not to make those sorts of pictures.

This was the best movie I've ever seen. The portrayal of Torgo was honestly award winning. The police force in this movie was really good, the way they really drove the plot forward sealed their performance. This has got to be the finest piece of cinematic art I've ever had the pleasure of viewing. The Master's dog deserves an Oscar just because, and Debbie is a god awful, pathetic excuse for a child actor with no future in this business. I cannot stress the complete perfection that is Torgo, it's a shame that he died so young, he had a promising career ahead of him. This movie absolutely broke me, please help me. Wake me up inside, I can't wake up, save me from the nothing I've become.

reviews.review_title: Terrible, but an important film to see
reviews.content: Being a TV broadcasting/film student, I find that viewing films of all types is a necessary thing to do in order to expand one's likes and also to see various styles of directors and editors. I find that Manos: The Hands of Fate, while it is the worst movie I have ever seen, is also a film I recommend for people to at least attempt to watch, simply to see how not to make a film. The unnecessary shots, terrible audio, and giant plot holes (Including Torgo being a Satyr: Never once mentioned, he just limps around with giant kneecaps) give perfect examples of how badly a film can go, and gives filmmakers information of what not to do. Whether you watch the original or MST3K version (The only difference being a few jokes and commercial breaks. Claiming more credibility for the original is pointless) I recommend at least one attempted viewing of this film.

PLEASE...listen to me...I don't have much time...my mind...my poor unprepared mind. This 'movie' will bring you to ruin and has no redeeming values. The hurt inflicted upon your psyche will most definitely last a lifetime and may be inheritable. Being waterboarded is now my most enjoyed pastime, along with other 'unmentionable' things. Just say NO! Ohhhhh....my manos are starting to hurt, don't worry that's a good thing, it keeps my mind off of the horror I've witnessed. Yes, unedited, unMST3K'd, raw, limping, fetid, cellulose. It can't be..... It can't be... It can't be.. It can't be. It..............IS!

What can be said about this film that over 300 other posters hasn't said already? Reading a "Fun fact" in the trivia section explains a lot though. They could only shoot 30sec of film at at time? Seriously, between that and no plot, you're asking for trouble. Even with the MST3K treatment, a bad taste is left in my mouth and about 10 showers are needed. Although without Joel, Crow and Tom Servo I don't think that any sane person can sit through this film. I'm not one to go to boards to trash things. But I feel safe that I can say 'MANOS' THE HANDS OF FATE Lewinskied big time and not fear anyone complaining about my opinion. I'll just add this, according to the MST3K AMAZING COLOSSAL EPISODE GUIDE, "Manos" translates to "hands" so the title really reads "'HANDS' THE HANDS OF FATE"

Well I've seen Manos the Hands of Fate with the MST3K crew and without them. And I've got to say that no one *watches* Manos, one *experiences* Manos. It goes from nervous giddiness to revulsion to a hearty slumber.  If you can get a copy of the unMSTed Manos The Hands of Fate, watch it!  That's the stuff that'll build character!  I couldn't stop laughing through the whole damn thing.

I saw this movie on MST3K and didn't see the whole episode. So I rented it, b/c I couldn't believe it was that bad. it was. How could this movie have gotten made? Is it possible to create a negative ranking on IMDB for this piece of gutter trash? I didn't think it was possible to create a movie without plot, cinematography, characters, anything! This film (if it really deserves the name) was worse than.... Highlander II, Pet Sematary, That City of Angels movie-- you name it. So boring, so drawn out, so... incomprehensible!

One of the funniest pieces of garbage I've ever had the pleasure of suffering through.  The lack of focus, both with the camera and the script, should make this film mandatory viewing in film school on what not to do in a film.  Ironically though, this flick is a must for everyone's video collection.

reviews.review_title: Manos - the hands of fate. Boring or entertaining?
reviews.content: I don't have much to say that hasn't been said already. It's true that the movie is rather boring. Especially in the beginning while watching them drive around the countryside kissing at the same time. Anyway, I saw the MST 3K version, and despite of the boredom, found it rather funny. To be honest, I can't even remember when I laughed as much as when I saw this. I don't know if it was for the plot or the partially funny comments, but I just simply liked it (I wouldn't use the word love because it'd surely be exaggeration). The reason why I'm not willing to give it a straight 10, is because of it's dullness and repetition. Some parts of the plot were clearly copied from earlier horror movies as everyone can probably notice. In a whole, the plot was also extremely confusing and I had enough trouble keeping up with what was going on. After all, I'd call Manos a part of common knowledge and a movie everyone should see to understand what makes (almost) every other movie in the world better than this one.

reviews.review_title: "Tonight, Manos gets caught in a deadly game of cat and mouse..."
reviews.content: Thank God for Joel and the bots to get us through this one.  Of all the MST3k experiments it's the only one I ever saw make Servo cry.  Good for unintentional laughs, the worst movie I have ever seen.  Internet rumours abound of a modern-day remake (!)

This movie is so entirely depressing that if you were to see it for the first time, alone, I don't know what it would do to you.  Suffice it to say that it's wise to watch with a group of people. It might drive you crazy if you don't. I really don't know how the Best Brains escaped with their sanity after watching this.  Maybe they didn't.  I mean think about it. Or maybe Monster A-Go-Go broke them down so much that this barely affected them. Or, as Paul Chaplin implies, maybe the MST writers have developed a mental defense mechanism which causes them to thoroughly forget a movie after they're done with it. In any case, it was barely watchable, even after being given the MST treatment.  After you've watched it with others the first couple of times, you might carefully test the waters with a PARTIAL alone viewing, but have oxygen and smelling salts on hand.

reviews.review_title: The worst film i've ever seen (and that's saying something!)
reviews.content: The MST3K version roasting of this turkey is one of my favorite episodes of the classic "Joel" era of that once great show.Just recently some friends and i actually found a copy of the original Manos in a run down video store and decided to test ourselves by trying to make it through it without the assistance of Joel and the Bots. Sadly, we just couldn't do it...........rating:1

The general consensus seems to be that the only way to watch this movie is via the "Mystery Science Theater 3000" episode.  I have to concur.This movie is completely unwatchable otherwise.  I'd rather be forced to watch "highlights" from every L.A. Clippers game ever played, nonstop, for days on end... on second thought, maybe not.

reviews.review_title: This was a truly ghastly(!!!) movie?!(was this really?)
reviews.content: I was convinced to watch this on MST3000 and I couldn't believe it. I sat through it because, I couldn't believe it. I have nightmares, I couldn't believe it, about having to watch it again. My husband actually has threatened me. I am not kidding.

reviews.review_title: Something has to be worst -- and this is definitely something
reviews.content: More telling to me than the two actors who apparently committed suicide the year this film appeared, is the fact that not one of them appears to have ever worked in film again. (The two suicides are excused.) I suppose, looking at the names closely, that several of them simply covered their tracks while they could.I don't think the problem with this film is so much the pacing. I think it has much more to do with trying to spread a 12 minute idea over a two hour time frame. I found myself envying the dog, who disappears at minute 5 of the idea (and at about 0:53 in Manos time).It could be salutary to require all serious film students to study Manos before commencing their first projects. Then again, the survival rate might be unconscionably low.

Manos. You will believe a film can suck.I agree with other reviewers: Do not try to watch this without the kindassistance of Joel, Crow, and Tom. While other films may earn their "negative stars" rating for bad writing ("To be like the hu-man! To think! To feel!"-- Robot Monster), special effects that come from Special Ed (cardboard tombstones--Plan 9) or acting that a high school drama teacher would have trouble praising (Invasion USA), "Manos: the Hands of Fate" has it all.Torgo deserves special attention. While the ostensible title character mopesaround in goth gear, the director must have told actor John Reynolds "Act weird" without expanding upon it. That role is played in the self-conscious style that is usually reserved for sighted actors playing blind people or average intellects playing developmentally disabled ones.Whenever people criticize amateur theatric productions, I remind them that this (and other badfilms) were made by professionals. The MST3K staff must have had multiple orgasms when they discovered this.

reviews.review_title: A cult Horror film that humorously terrible
reviews.content: There are some movies that are so bad they become good. Then there is Manos: The Hands of Fate. This film is commonly hailed as one of the worst movies in existence, and I can do nothing to disprove this. However, that does not mean the film is unenjoyable. It is bad to a point which it becomes hilarious. It has appeared on Mystery Science Theatre 3000, and it was even bad by their standards. I, however, prefer to watch this film without MST3K commentary, because it makes it that much worse and funny. I recommend that this film be watched with a group of friends, and you should all have tons of laughs the filmmakers had no intention to give you.

As much as I watch this movie and have several panoramic scenes tattooed across my back and forearms, I still cannot get enough of Manos: The Hands of Fate. Much like The Elephant Man before it, and Mask after, Manos presents the complex and moving story of a deformed handyman searching for love.Hal Warren's snub at the Oscars the year he wrote, produced, and directed Manos is well known. The astonishing fact that Manos never won a single award for the positive aspects of its filmmaking led to several famous actors refusing to work ever again, even though they were not involved in the project. After Manos, the outrage was so virulent a strain that Buster Keaton, Hedda Hopper, and Ed Wynn never acted after its release.At heart of the Manos saga is the story of Torgo. His character represents the need of all of us to love and be loved, and the pain we all feel when caught leering at the wives of stranded motorists. Torgo was, alas, ahead of his time - the homoerotic allusion between Torgo and The Master was to be the framework for the Williams/Lane relationship in The Birdcage and the Doggett/Skinner tension in the X-Files.Sadly, the Academy has repeatedly denied Warren a Thalberg award for this work. It lives on through countless showings among devoted fans, where we can at last understand Manos' beloved vision.

What a joke! Undoubtedly the worst film I have ever seen. It really doesn't surprise me that this is number 1 in the bottom 100. I have had more fun watching all the sequels to Police Academy. Better that this film is gone and forgotten.

I also saw this movie on MST 3000. That's really the only way to see this movie because the funny comments at least make it somewhat watchable. It's hard to describe just how bad this movie is. It seems so poorly put together that's it hard to even follow it. But with a plot this ridiculous it won't matter anyway. I wish I could say this has that "so bad it's funny" quality to it, but for the most part I found it just bad. I heard they spent the whole summer of 1966 filming this movie, but it really looks like they should have been able to film this garbage in a few days. And one last thing: for a horror movie, this has nothing scary in it at all.

This is a good movie. I have no idea why they all badmouth it, and I don't get the "Bottom 100" thing. Sure, for some, it was a box office hit, and for some, it hit rock bottom and made a permanent home there! Someone still worked hard to tape it: I've lifted a full-size film camera before on my shoulder and it's really heavy! Sure, the special effects and actors were worthy to be turned into dogs and tortured by little children, or into ants and squished by nearly anything! But, your opinion still counts. But, I'm not one to blast my counterparts. Your opinion still counts, and if I say it's great, and you say it made you get cramps from how bad it was, that's fine. The choice is all yours...

*SPOILERS AHEAD READ WITH CARE* This movie was a real bomb, it was disgusting, made no sense, and sometimes were downright rude. The first 10 minutes of this movie consisted of people driving around in 50's cars. Interesting, huh? Everybody in this production was very unlikeable, and the only reason it probably  got a greenlight in the first place was because of a scene that had pretty (SCARY) women fighting in their nighties. If there is anyone brave enough to watch this piece of junk without the Mystery Science Theater cast, that person either is braindead, or was the director, a fertilizer salesperson, and I don't think it is a coincidence.
A definintion of so bad, so hilariously inept, and unintentionally funny that it ascends to next level. Really couldn't decide whether to give this a 1 or a 10. Please watch it.

What a masterpiece, truly the pinnacle of Hal P. Warren's film career. I really enjoyed the driving sequences in the first 20 minutes of the film, truly haunting! Torgo was a brilliant character as well, from his very sexually appealing passes at the women in this film (how did they resist the charms of Torgo?) to his amazing strength that only requires him to tap Hal with his death stick to knock him out. Other great features of this movie include: the Master's beautiful cape, Hal's widows peak in the mirror (what a camera shot!), and of course Torgo's knees. 100000000000000000000/10!!! The best movie ever, period.

reviews.review_title: So bad it MUST be seen
reviews.content: Being a fan of MST3K it was almost inevitable that I would see what I have been told is the most requested episode of the cult TV series. Now I am no stranger to bad films, but this one is so unbelievable I feel that it must been seen in order for one to appreciate just how bad it is. Poor camera techniques and dreadful acting are just two horrendous elements that make up "Manos". In my opinion, Ed Wood's Plan 9 is better made than this. Despite the sheer atrocity of this film I feel that it must be seen in order to properly enjoy a good film. I mean, how can one say a film is good without experiencing a truly bad one? When I read the book 1001 Movies You Must See Before You Die, i was very surprised that this was not in it. I feel that it is a film that must be seen, if only for 90 minutes of gut-busting enjoyment.

reviews.review_title: worse than death-less torture.....oh wait it is death-less torture
reviews.content:
i saw this film i think about a year ago. did i just call it a film....whups!  i think the correct word would be something along the lines of.....no nevermind, there isnt a word strong enough to describe the emmence pain, the feeling you wish you'd just die so you wouldn't have to witness this vial, vial, abomination.  and thats with the gods of mst3k.  and i love them, they are the funniest people alive.  but this they couldn't make funny.  i kept waiting in unimaginable pain for them to say something funny. but they couldn't.  there's nothing there.  for stretches that prove god hates us all, nothing happens. its a meaningless piece of ************* *******, with absolutely nothing they can even be identified of molecules of plotline.  there are probably less than 50 words in manos, including all of them repeated, (which they are, e.g "whos there? whos there?").  the dubbed "dialogue" changes tone color constantly.  the mst3k guys are desperately apologetic.  the only thing they can say is the title over and over (which i admit became kind of funny the umpteenth time) because there are no lines and everything in it is far, far, far, far beyond unintentionally funny. it doesnt cross that line - it vomits on it, hacks it to pieces, shoots it with an automatic weapon, and destroys it with the most powerful nuclear bomb. the running time is really short but it feels like a quadrillion years of constant, sadistic torture.  i regret ever laying eyes on its contaminated, poisonous box, videotape, and anything else that has to do with it.
if you ever have the choice of a slow death that inflicts the most pain possible or watching this, take the former.and will god help us all by deciding we learned our lesson from this vile thing that brought hell on earth.

reviews.review_title: Would you like some wine with your CHEESE?
reviews.content: Could anything be worse? I mean, anything? When they did the "Top 100 Worst Movies" in an MST3K marathon a few years back, I basically predicted this as the #1 worst. I guess MST agreed with me. Note to all fertilizer workers aspiring to be film makers: don't bother.

the only way to survive this horror show with a stable state of mind (if you have stable one to begin with) is to watch the mystery science theater 3000 version. otherwise, you might as well bid farewell to your family because you'll be spending your remaining days in an insane asylum.

This movie was so mind-numbingly awful that I had trouble even watching the MST3K episode that heckled it. Is there, you may ask, at least some aspect of this movie that one could point to and say, "Well, at least some other movie did it worse"? No. It looks like it was shot over the weekend on drug store-quality 8mm film by people who were making it up as they went along. I'm not going to waste time going into detail about this movie's flaws, because its very existence is a flaw.This is, in my long experience of cheesy movie-watching, the bottom of the barrel. If you wish to torture your children for misbehaving, keep a copy of this movie on hand.

This is without doubt the worst film I've ever seen. Once famously Quentin Tarrentino is said to have called this film his favourite comedy. In my opinion he couldn't have been further from the truth, this film is so bad its not even funny.Everything about this film is bad but its where to start that is the problem on commenting on this film.For me it has to be the terrible editing of this film that makes it stand out, with every cut of the camera the characters have changed position and appear to jump about the screen and in one scene you can see the clapboard going down.Then i would have to comment on the music. A really terrible score possibly the worst use of music in a movie ever. The way music follows Torgo around is very odd indeed.The plot or lack of it has to make this the worst movie ever after 30 minutes in i decided to go through what had actually happened; family going on holiday, couple kissing in a car to the dissatisfaction of the police, meet Torgo, look at picture of the master, nothing really happens and when something happens it happens with no logic at all.The script and acting also makes this film the worst ever with exceptional note on the character of Torgo (John Reynolds).I could go on but i think by now you should have got the picture of what I'm trying to put across this is th worst film ever. Yes worse than "plan 9 from outer space" and yes worse than "The man who saved the world AKA Turkish star wars"

This is a movie so awful that even the folks at Mystery Science Theater 3000 couldn't make it funny. About the only positive comment I can make is that it's not boring -- believe me, boring would be a great improvement for this piece of cinematic detritus. There is something ineffably awful about the film, like it was created by an acolyte of Cthulhu who wanted to capture the horrors of the cosmos on film.

first of all, i own have access to an origional copy of manos the hands of fate. i have viewed the movie about 3 times. finishing the movie proved to be harder than slapping the president, and getting away with it. before you go and defend the movie, you should take one thing into account. Manos the hands of fate is by far the worst movie in the entire world. there is no way movies can get any worse than this. i am a film student  at columbia college, and while this gives me a certain knowledge of film, it does not mean that i am qualified to critique movies. having said that i will proceed to relay my overall impression of the film.if you were to stab 27 inch rail road spikes in my ears and eyes, it would be almost as bad as sitting through that movie. if you think that i am joking, then the master and torgo have already put you under some kind of spell. while i appreciate bad movies for what they are, i cannot reccomend this film to anyone who i consider my friend. to do so would be unfathomably rude and uncool.while torgo remains my all time favorite pseudo-badguy i am very sad to learn of his death (suicide?). his role as torgo was a memorable one. if you have seen the movie, then you will know that torgo is somewhat of a creepy guy. his enormous kneecaps are funny as hell. when he was stroking the womans hair you cant help but laugh. if you were being touched by a gritty looking man with large knees, would you run away, or would you let him finish, and then calmly tell him that he no longer had permission to touch you?in any case manos the hands of fate, ormanos del destinos as i like to call it is one of the worst and best movies in the world. the worst movie ever because of continuity errors, and the best movie because of torgo. well i think i have wasted enough time ranting. have a nice day everyone and go watch manos again if you dare. mullet

Well, I can enjoy just about any piece of trash if it's bad enough for a good laugh, But "Manos, Hand of Fate" goes beyond the realm of the laughably bad, and crosses the threshold of actual, physical pain. I'm pretty sure the actors were reading off file cards tucked in their sleeves, except for the times they seemed to be just basically standing around staring into space. Even the kid seemed bored and stilted in this 75 cent budget, one-take-wonder. Even MST3K couldn't make this dog funny!In summary, this film should come with a warning that prolonged exposure (say more than 15 seconds or so) can cause permanent brain damage and loss of the will to live.

reviews.review_title: Can't get any worse than this!
reviews.content: well first off the Dialogue is repetative as well as filled with long gaps of silence.  The acting was awful although Torgo will always be etched my mind, and it's safe just to watch the MST3K version.  I'd have to give this one 0 stars if I could.

this movie was absolutely the worst movie I have ever seen. and i have beheld such horrors as Dragon Wars and Speed Racer The Movie. the movie was excruciatingly painful from the very beginning. my friend said i needed to watch it so i sat at my fathers computer and watched it on Google Video. Third worst mistake of my life. as i observed the opening sequence i began to cringe. after 45 minutes, i began furiously clawing at my eyes. near the random all-out wrestling match between the wives, i was emersed in desperate, pointless hate and rage. i wanted to burn my house to the ground and throw myself into the flames. but i refraned from such activities as i feared hell itself may be Manos on an endless loop. God help us all.

Well, although it is extremely difficult to explain how bad this movie is, people have a done good job I think. Actually I don't have much to say about it's poor acting, non-existent plot or completely irrelevant "the make-out couple". I am going to evaluate the movie in a completely different manner. Think about this: years after our time, mankind is completely eradicated from the face of the earth. And some kind of alien species finds the earth and decides to send an expedition team to discover if any kind of intelligent life form exists. And during their search,they find "Manos the hands of fate" and somehow manage to watch it. Wouldn't they think they are wasting their time researching a species (us) that created this movie (and possibly enjoyed) as a form of art? There will be no one else to explain that this is the worst movie ever! And they will leave us to our fate! Mankind will be forgotten forever. So, I'm saying that Manos is not just a bad movie, It's a crime against humanity.

In my quest to make sure that Manos is #1 on the Bottom 100 list, I just have to comment.I have to admit that Torgo is great.  And by great, I mean that in the worst possible sense.  A totally unexplained, freakish character with minimal lines and the acting skills of a first-grader is usually frustrating and annoying.  Well, he is frustrating and annoying, but in an amusing, intriguing, why-the-hell-are-his-thighs-like-that kind of way!There are vast stretches of time in the film where the characters are just driving through a barren wasteland.  Nothing beautiful, no purpose to the repetitive drive.  It just makes you wonder what was going through the film-makers' minds when they wrote, produced and directed this film.  Not to mention the actors who signed on to play these people.  (Poor Torgo man)For some reason I both hate and love this movie.  It's hard not to like something that is so utterly ridiculous it makes you laugh when it is obviously trying to be dead serious and scary.  You just can't NOT laugh at "the master" in his hand cloak.  Or the strange, unexplained lady slaves fighting in their white gowns.  And what is this man "the master" of? Why is Torgo with him?  If he has all these scantily-clad ladies with him, wrestling, why does he need a creepy, dirty minion with legs akimbo? It's all part of the magic and misery of Manos: Hands of Fate!

reviews.review_title: Its truly that bad. I am stunned.
reviews.content: I joined IMDb thanks to Manos which is the only redeeming quality I can say about the whole experience. I have seen some horrible movies, simply horrible I tell you. But none have come close to what I have just witnessed. This movie has cemented its spot as the 3rd worst movie I have ever seen... ever. Although "Ax'em" and Pocket ninja's managed to beat Manos out in my opinion the movie was truly a feat of epic proportions. For the life of me I cant figure out what Torgo was all about. I seemed as though he was stoned... really stoned. But the kicker came during the extra long cat fight when I could tell there was no audio whatsoever. If you give this more that a one then you are lying to yourself. You Must Watch this at least once... or try to anyway.

reviews.review_title: All you have heard is true.
reviews.content: Yes this is indeed one of, if not the worst, movies ever made.  All the bad things you have heard about this movie are true and I repeat ALL THE BAD THINGS YOU HAVE HEARD ABOUT THIS MOVIE ARE TRUE.  I am so thankful that I watched this through the protective arms of MST3K.  I couldn't even imagine watching this movie without it.  Nothing about this movie was done well or even competent.  This is the bottom of the barrel plain and simple. 1/10

reviews.review_title: There is a reason Torgo committed suicide after completing this movie.
reviews.content: This has been the ruler of imdb's bottom 100 for quite some time. Until recently when a rather large group of people have started voting 10 on it so that From Kelly to Justin would occupy that spot.Regardless, this movie is the worst movie I have ever seen, no question about it. One of the main characters Torgo (The Henchman) committed suicide in the same year it was made, one can wonder if it was because of the poor quality of the film or if it was of other reasons.This movie became famous because of Mystery Science Theater 3000, who were subjected to it in episode 424 back in 1993. The movie is slow, the plot is as paper-thin as toilet paper (not the two layered kind), the suspense is non-existing, and the ending is un-imaginative.This movie was supposed to be a horror\thriller, but has become a joke beyond belief. It seemed like most of the movie was stock footage of scenery taken from a very long roadtrip, or Torgo carrying luggage.
Truly the plight of man. An absolutely horrid film. I cried out of pure displeasure and I'm sure you will too. not worth it AT ALL

reviews.review_title: Dear movie gods, why was this film made!?
reviews.content: *Spoiler ahead, tread carefully" Before I start this review, I saw thisfilm on MST3 in 1999. This film made no sense at all. A 3yr old could make a story more believable then this film. This film is about a family stuck in the middle of nowhere. (that was the only interesting thing about this film). The acting was as bad as a high school play. the setting in the film looked like the budget of $1.34. There were some parts in the movie that made my IQ drop by 12%. from a group of women having what seems to be like a 12 minute cat fight ( to me, probably 2 hours). I was so pleased when the whole family didn't make it to the end. Then when the film ended it said " The End?", like they wanted to make a sequel to this junk.To anyone who said " Plan 9 from outer space" was bad, take a look at this film. It makes every bad film look like an academy award winning film.

If you are a film student, aspiring director or actor, or just an avid movie-goer such as me, then this film is an absolute must-see. If it is not already, Manos should be required viewing in every film school. Why? Because if understanding and learning from the mistakes of others are valid methods in education, then one could spend an entire semester studying this film and not make it through the first 15 minutes. The mistakes, goofs, and blunders in this film are so numerous and extensive in their scope and severity as to make it the de facto "Bible of don'ts" for film production; the absolute gold standard of ineptitude; the Titanic of movie disasters. If Director Harrold Warren's intent from the onset was to create a 74-minute collage of all the mistakes that had ever been made in film (and even invent a few new ones), then his genius truly is on the Spielberg or Hitchcock level. As romantic as it might be to hope such is the case, the cold reality is that Warren was actually trying to produce a legitimate horror film. Well, at least the genre is fitting. This film is indeed horrific (though not in the sense that Warren intended). Pick any measure by which films may be critiqued; directing, acting, editing, script, cinematography, post-production, equipment, lighting, sound, continuity, set design. Watching Manos is wildly entertaining in the context of its epic failures in every single one of these, or any other category you care to name. I gave the movie one star on IMDb because they wouldn't let me give it zero. I won't go into specifics about the film's specific shortcomings because there are just too many, and, as so many others before me have said, there simply are no words. I will say this, though, the character Torgo is by far, I repeat, BY FAR, the most ridiculous villain ever! If you have not already seen this gem, please do. Although for first-timers I highly recommend viewing it in the MST3K version.until you've built up your tolerance a little. Watching the raw version right off the bat would be a painful experience at best; a highly ill-advised foray into a disturbing world of movie madness.

reviews.review_title: Awful, awful, awful, awful, simply and truly awful
reviews.content: Being near the top of the bottom 100 list here at IMDB seems to have given this trash heap (and several other cinematic travesties) a lot of sympathy from numerous folks. Well, disregard them. Please, please do. Don't subject yourself to the pain that is MANOS - the Hands of Fate.This film is truly the WORST movie I have ever seen, in all my years. I know that's not something that should be thrown around very lightly - it's a pretty big statement. But in all honesty, I think I'm dead-on in the assumption that no film is as bad as this trash. I've watched numerous other no-budget Blockbuster-bargain-bin slashers, I've seen a LOT of random, obscure B-movies on MST3K and from other random sources, I've exposed myself to oldschool drive-in fluff. But none of it, NONE, has truly come close to the awful experience of seeing this movie.Marketed as a horror movie, MANOS would have been a hit with a switch-a-roo in its genre - selling it to insomniacs as a cure would have been very successful. The film starts off with a father (Director, Writer, Producer, and Fertilizer Salesman Hal Warren), A mother (who didn't live long after the completion of this movie), a daughter, and her little poodle. It isn't long (actually, yes, it is. And I do mean it is. For about 20 minutes at the beginning of the film all that happens is soft elevator music plays as the group drives across the fields of Texas in midday. And it goes on. And on. And on. Oh, the pain.) before... wait, where was I? Oh yeah, this movie sucks.After the painfully boring and devoid-of-dialogue opening driving scenes, we meet a couple of teens necking out on the highway. A cop stops them (hey, it's 1966,) and they go off to neck somewhere else. They really never had any significance that I can remember, but I read that they were going to have bigger parts until the gal in the car broke her leg. So writer/director/farmer Warren thought it'd be nice to still have them 'cameo' or something. Either way, the scenes still suck. But that leads me to the next point. MANOS was shot with a camera that records no sound - that's right, every line was dubbed by 2 people. A man, and a woman. This results in terrible voiceovers (the little girl actually sounds like a 40 year old woman mocking a 5 year old toddler, and hillarity unintentionally ensues when Hal is pulled over by a cop and you can't tell who's talking because the same person dubbed their voice). On other audio issues, while the music doesn't itself suck, per se, it is absolutely out of place in a 'horror' movie. The elevator music is out of place at the beginning. The Torgo theme could have been memorable if it had been used in more memorable places. The jazzy solos don't help the 'horror' movie at all, and the whacky music that plays during the scenes where the wives beat each other up certainly doesn't make anyone scared (and, in fact, makes it reminiscent of old silent comedy films that had similar music.)The script is ineptly written, the acting is terribly done (most people in this movie either killed themselves or never appeared in films after this one, or both,) there is no spooky, thrilling, scary, or even unintentionally funny atmosphere throughout the whole piece. It's almost physically painful to watch the actors stumble through the film, and the dubbed voiceovers (and it shows that the dubbers really did try to fit each part, but failed miserably) all add up to a terrble experience. In my movie watching experiences it's often that I find horrible movies that make me laugh. I'm sure many others have similar experiences, but this film is devoid of any of that.There is truly not a single redeeming quality in this film. Spare yourself the pain. Truly the worst movie I've ever seen - 0/10

reviews.review_title: Hal Warren -- The Lloyd Kauffman of his time.
reviews.content:
I hear all these negative comments about "Manos" The Hands of Fate and I just don't get it. "Manos" was fantastic. A great film.
Yes, let me repeat that: A GREAT FILM.No I'm not sick, I'm not insane, and I definantly have a clear sense of reality."Manos" was a great film. It had it's charms. No it wasn't well made. The production values sucked. The acting (thanks most probably from the dubbing) wasn't spectacular.. But the movie was great. It imbodied the central idea of an independant film.It showed us that even a fertilizer salesman from El Paso can make a film that gains any sort of status (in this case, cult status.)Sure, Hal Warren's dead and gone, but "Manos" is still here, it lives on, and look at where it is now? It was on MST3K, and the main reason why any of us really know the movie exists. You can go online or to your local video retailer and pick up the MST3K version. Heck, oldies.com is selling the original version of it.What I think "Manos" really stood for was that anybody could make a movie. Hal Warren did in 1966, and it's something people still do today. Sure it's more difficult now. But look at Lloyd Kauffman and Troma entertainment. He's doing the same thing now that Warren did in '66, and people love his stuff.If anything, that's what "Manos" is a good movie for... That and Torgo. I don't think anyone can ever make a more memorable character... The master would not approve... It'll be dark soon.

I don't even know what to say. This is without a doubt the worst movie I have ever seen. Have you ever seen a really terrible movie and thought that the director actually wanted it to be bad because audiences will find humor in a movie that is so bad it is funny? Yeah, well that's not the case with this movie. I have a feeling that this director actually thought that this was a good film. To start, the film is called Manos: Hands of Fate, which translates to Hands: Hands of Fate. Ummm, okay. Next, the voice track rarely matched the actors mouth movements. The writer, who also happened to be the director, couldn't come up with anything better, so he had an overwhelming amount of establishing shots. For example, we see these painfully long scenes in which doomed travelers are driving around the bare countryside, and a couple of teens are making out- over, and over, and over. To me, and I venture to say most folks, these are simply bad time fillers. The plot, which jumps all over the place and really makes little to no sense, is ridiculous. The dialogue is repetitious and inane, and the actors seem to be at a loss as to how to present such a poor script. And finally, as if that wasn't enough, the camera work is terrible. You might as well see a boom mic hanging out, since there are several instances in which heads are chopped off or something blocks the actors in the frame (i.e. smoke). Really, this is the worst movie ever made.However, I will say that there is one way to enjoy this movie: watch it with a group of friends, and in particular, watch the Mystery Science 3000 version of this film. It is the only way you will be able to appreciate Manos (Hands): Hands of Fate.

Manos is without a doubt the worst movie I have ever seen. Having said that, I also must admit a certain fascination with it. I can't decide whether it is a touch of masochism or the macabre interest we must all fight to avoid staring at a car wreck.And I also get a certain sadistic pleasure from forcing others to experience this piece of cinematic diarrhea.But I definitely think that everyone should see this film. It hurts at first, but afterward, you learn to appreciate life a little more. For there can be no good without bad, no light without dark, no pleasure without pain.

reviews.review_title: Utter, complete dreadful mess of a movie.
reviews.content: Much could be said about Manos. But I won't say much. Just that it is an absolutely horrible movie, trying to be a horror movie, but ending up as some sort of a half-finished, utterly non-watchable movie. Check this one out only if you want to torture yourself. The Acting is wooden, most frames are out of focus, the dialogue is extremely cheesy and sometimes makes no sense whatsoever, voices are done by four actors for all the characters, oh yes, and there are the guy and girl constantly making out in a car, which have no connection to the plot whatsoever. And the snake is from a Disney documentary.Stay away, stay far away!

In my opinion, a movie can only be considered bad when it is hard to sit though it. For example, many Ed Wood movies are considered bad for the obvious terrible sets, acting and directing, but you watch them and have fun with them. So my question is how can you sit though a movie that entertains you and say that it is bad.This is where Manos:Hands of Fate comes in. As Woods movies are horrible, but fun to watch, Manos is horrible, and IMPOSSIBLE to watch. Watching Manos makes your blood flow stop and your eyes roll into the back your head.I consider this movie to be the most unpleasant experience ever with a movie, along side the Star Wars Holiday Special.But at least that had cocaine as an excuse, all this had was fertilizer.

Every shot, every line of the "script", every "set", every human emotion that was attempted to be portrayed by the "actors" (it's as if they weren't actual human actors at all, but clones, who never experienced fear before, and certainly didn't know what a film was, but had it explained to them by a director that never saw one before either....but I digress).... every moment is either highly entertaining awesomeness or madness inducing, pushing one to a full-on psychotic break. There is no in-between. I wish you, viewer, the best of luck, and my all the gods have mercy on your soul.

reviews.review_title: What's Good About Manos--Hands of Fate
reviews.content: What's good about Manos, Hands of Fate is that we all know that we all could make a better film than this without even trying. Just think, if this piece of, what, art? can come into existence maybe that spec script you have gathering dust in the closet has a chance after all. Just remember, there's a fine line between clever and stupid. One person's clever is another person's stupid and this film is like a universal boundary for all people. Manos, Hands of Fate will ultimately save the human race from self-destruction because Usama bin Laden and George Bush can find common ground by agreeing that Manos is the worst film ever made. The world will know peace because of this artistic endeavour.

reviews.review_title: Makes Ed Wood look like a cinematic genius
reviews.content: Just finished watching the MST3K episode of this, and even Joel and his robots struggled to make this one entertaining. It is, however, an MST3K favourite... by my calculations the all-time series #2 according to the show's fans. 'Space Mutiny' gets #1, but only because the cast was particularly on-song with their wisecracks for the episode. I note the acknowledgment at the end thanking the city and county of El Paso. One has to wonder who would want to visit any place silly enough to want to put their name to this... ummm... complete and utter tripe (I'm being diplomatic here). It's only redeeming feature is that one of the cops looks a bit like Don S Davis, General Hammond of Stargate SG-1 (he would have been about 24 at the time). The 'credits' list a different name, but I would have changed my name pretty quickly too if I was desperate enough to appear in this (expletive deleted). Maybe he needed a role to qualify for union membership. It's impossible to write a spoiler review for this flick... there is simply nothing to spoil.

This is a unique specimen of garbage. It shouldn't have existed. Manos: The Hands of Fate is a movie that you don't want to watch.First of all, the title. "Manos" means "hands" in Spanish, which makes the title, "Hands: The Hands of Fate". But I'm not going to judge a movie by the title, the problem is, this pile of junk BARELY counts as a movie.This thing only lasts a little over one hour, but it feels like eternity. The picture is so boring, it has nothing to get interested. It's considered to be a horror movie, but it has nothing thrilling. Everything moves so slow, I can't even describe. Let's ask ourselves a question: Why do we watch movies? For entertainment? Well, this one doesn't entertain the audience a bit.Acting is nonexistent, the cinematography is disgusting, lightning effects are the WORST. For some reason, Plan 9 From Outer Space was much more eye appealing.There's NOTHING decent about this movie. To be honest, I expected everyone to be named "Alan Smithee" on the credits. Watching this movie is a torture, it just gets worse.

reviews.review_title: So Bad I Can't Think of a Clever Title
reviews.content: This is it, the absolute worst movie of all time. First of all, the title is redundant and stupid, as anyone knowing any amount of Spanish will tells you that the title is Hands: Hands of Fate. Also, the villain in the movie has hand prints on his cape. Clever. Saying that this movie had a shoestring budget would be an insult to shoestrings; this movie had no budget. In fact, the director and star was... a fertilizer salesman. What can I say, the story is not unusual, a B-grade horror story, but what the director does with it is stuff of legend. The acting is done by the guy's family and friends, and it is obvious. No one here had any inkling on how to act. Second, with the exception of the mysterious Torgo, none of the characters have the least bit of... characterization. The film is blurry, shot with a camera that had no sound. And all the dubbing was done by 2 people! So when someone talks, it's hard to tell who, because all the voices sound the same and you can't tell whose lips are moving. There are points where the movie is so lost that even the keenest of spectator will have to laugh out loud at the movie. An absolute must of bad movie buffs. But be warned, this is not your average bad movie... this is... pain-inducing thriller, Manos, Hands of Fate.

When I first got into MST3K and went hunting around for what are the best episodes of the show. Of course, right on the top of the list, is Manos. And for many reasons this should be right toward the top of the list of great episodes. But, it is painful to watch even with a great riff on top of it. The thing was made by a manure salesman from Texas so you know it's quality. A friend and I sat down and watched this one night and it about killed us. It's the film equivalent of getting hit by a car. It's not enjoyable but it makes for a good time when you commiserate with others about your experience. I own the DVD of this that has the mst3k version and the unriffed version and I've never been stupid enough to watch this without Mike and the bots. It's a good ep. of the show but be prepared, it is a slog getting through this movie. Long Days and Pleasant Nights, Tom Snapp

A terrible, boring movie that leaves an ashen after-taste.I've only seen the MST3 version and even the playful atmosphere of the show couldn't dispel the awfulness of the movie for us. We literally felt soiled afterwards. I guess it could be improved - if you had an entirely new script-director-cameraman-sound technician-cast etc although I'm not sure why removing the "cat fight" portion would make it any better since that alone had to be the high point of the whole movie.A lot of bad movies can be fun, of course. "It - The Terror from Beyond Space" is one of the worst science fiction films ever made in the 1950's but it is a scream; literally a howler. Scenes of male "astronauts" looking like a bunch of middle-aged teamsters sitting around their "break room" smoking cigarettes while the "lady astronauts" clear away dishes and serve coffee will have you laughing your ass off.There are few such gems to be found in Manos. It really is just a unfortunate boring piece of crap.

reviews.review_title: Even worse than you think it could possibly be
reviews.content: I saw the MST3K version of this film, and even that is difficult to watch. It starts out with about 20 minutes of driving footage in which the action is moving from right to left. That alone is enough to make you nauseous. It doesn't get much better from here: horrible acting, inept storyline, and pathetic directing. This would be a great movie to show to film students on how NOT make a movie. The MST3K characters are hilarious, as always, and there is no way I could have watched it without them. If there is one redeeming factor about the movie, its that its fun to imitate Torgo's famous line "The master would not approve."

reviews.review_title: could have worked on better budget
reviews.content: I think the idea is great...maybe a little creepy with the end...if you've seen it you know what I mean. Family goes out to find a ranch, ends up at some weird house in the middle of the desert, here's where the fun begins, right? It could have unfortunately the camera they used got like enough for two takes before needing to be rewound. And the father, there was never a stupider horror movie set up, ever. The wife wants to leave, his 4-year-old daughter wants to leave, hell, even the dog wants to leave, the creepy guy with posture problems wants them to leave...but no. Dad says we're staying here with the guy that has a speech impediment and keeps spouting off about how his master won't like them being there, in spite of a few minutes of everyone insisting on leaving, he's like we're staying...this place looks awesome. My favorite scene is the police search, the police take about two steps wave their head, and nope doesn't look like there's anything fishy here. Like I said, the basic, bare-bones premise could work, I think it just needs a big budget remake, with a better script, better sound, lighting, cinematography etc, etc etc...Only watch in the company of Crow, Tom Servo and Joel.

reviews.review_title: This movie is NOT "So bad it's good"...
reviews.content: I don't see how anyone can give Manos the "so bad it's good" award. I first heard about this movie from a friend who said that this movie was the worst movie he'd ever seen. He saw the MST3K version. I actually had the fortitude to watch the original, but forgive my ignorance. When I think "bad" I think "B" movie grade, which actually has a plot, a somewhat coherent storyline, bad acting, and a budget smaller than your brother's weekly allowance. The only thing Manos succeeds in is failing to meet even a low standard in any category. I had to watch this movie in two parts; now, I've completed 10 mile runs before (with respectable times), but this movie felt like an absolute MARATHON. This movie was torture of the worst kind. I think this movie actually classifies as horror for the simple fact that when you get done watching it, you realize in absolute HORROR that you lost a few hours of your life that would have best been used elsewhere. Writing this post telling how bad the movie was is actually a better use of my time than actually watching the movie. SLEEPING is a better use of your time than watching this "movie".

This has got to be the worst movie ever. It is so bad, it makes, "Plan 9 from Outer Space," look like, "Gone With The Wind." I have only seen this movie through, "Mystery Science Theater 3000," which in my opinion was the best episode of that series. It has reached the level of bad that makes it so funny and enjoyable to watch. From the bad cinematography, and horrible dubbing, to the script that has the feel of something that was written on a napkin in haste, "Manos: The Hands of Fate" has reached a rare level in America cinema, the level of perfection, in this case, perfectly bad. How can you not be drawn to something that is perfect? This movie is a must see for anyone who has a love of cinema.

reviews.review_title: How is this no longer the worst movie ever made?!
reviews.content: I have seen this film several times, and after the first or second time even Joel and the Bots can't save this one.After having used this film almost as an instrument of torture, and as such having endured it several times, I feel capable of going through the SAS selection course or the Royal Navy's Perisher course.If I can get through this movie without gouging out me eyes and poking out my eardrums, then I can do just about anything. Screw kryptonite, let's see old' Superman put up with this movie.This film looks like a home movie at Ozzy Osbourne's house and sounds like it was dubbed by the same 3 people using a public restroom as a recording studio.

After reading everyone Else's reviews, I had to give Manos a 1 instead of following my gut and giving it a 2. When the film was over, I truly had to say that it wasn't the worst film I had ever watched. Mind you, I watched the actual movie first, not the MST3K version. (I ordered both, followed the original with the MST3K version... Yeah, I don't appreciate money, I know.) Anyway, the acting, the script, the production quality, yada-yada... It all sucked. I did find that Torgo's theme implanted itself into my feeble brain and I'm struggling to remove it, (actually, I am typing this while trying to position a drill to my frontal lobe.) I do wonder if this thing was made so poorly on purpose. If so, what a success at failure! I must admit, I am glad to own the film in both versions because now I have the ultimate torture device for my b-movie loving friends. I can tolerate a few watchings of this film, especially if someone else can feel my initial pain. Sadistic and cruel feeling on my behalf, but not as sadistic and cruel as this film.Fertilizer salesman by day... fertilizer producer by night.

Yep, it's a real stinker. I've seen both the MST3K screening, and the whole thing in its glory. It's just incredibly painful to watch. Be sure to have plenty of beer on hand. I guess that I need to see Yusei oji (ranked lower at time of writing) to see if in fact anything worse was ever committed to celluloid.

reviews.review_title: "... was filmed in a vacant lot" (Joel Robinson) and I believe it!
reviews.content: I first saw Manos, the Hands of Fate on MST3 and I actually thought that it was probably the worst movie that I had ever seen, but now after my 585th showing of it, it has actually grown on me and I don't think that it is really that bad. I've only seen Titanic once, so seeing Manos 585 times says something. In conclusion, this movie definitely ranks in the "so bad, it's good!" category. Ed Wood would have been proud.Thank you.(If there is ever a remake, DeNiro must play Torgo!)

reviews.review_title: Is it the worst movie ever?
reviews.content: I don't know, I haven't seen every movie yet! However, this horrible piece of trash is the worst movie I have ever laid eyes upon! It is grotesque in the way that skin on six month old jello is grotesque, repulsive in the way that a dead skunk in an outhouse is repulsive, it is so repugnant that I've had friends disavow knowledge of my existence because I've admitted publicly to seeing it! Avoid this movie!

"Tom Servo crosses the blueline and drops the puck for Joel... ...he winds up, shoots..........KICK SAVE, TORGO!"This character looks as if he spent his sad childhood raised by a pack of wild hockey goalies.  He's got the crouch down cold, and he sports ready-made padded legs for those crucial kick saves.Let's face it:  If the score is 2-2 and your team has just been called to defend a penalty shot, who *wouldn't* want Torgo in goal?!?  And talk about loyal!Seriously, I gave this tortuous experiment a "2" (not a "1") only because Torgo lended the film enough campiness to hyperbolically hurl the "film" into the realm of "so bad, it's good!"  [Good for a few laughs.]OK, OK...maybe not *that* good.  I'll settle for "so bad, it's terrible!"

reviews.review_title: There is nothing like this...spool of film.
reviews.content: I have never seen anything like this -- it is just randomly bad footage taken out in the desert with a character called Torgo running a coven of badly dressed people with no lines. Then things get super-scary when Torgo comes out into daylight, he and his group assaulting people. Or something. I could have shot this in 8mm film outside some desert town myself.

This is the worst movie ever made. Even with the bots, I wanted to run. Joel and Co. really had to reach to find anything of value in this movie. And what's with Torgo? I'm scarier than him, and I don't have his funky knees.

reviews.review_title: Technically the worst movie ever, however it's doesn't even deserve to be classified as a movie.
reviews.content: The worst movie ever? No not all all. The worst thing a fertilizer salesman has ever done? You better believe it. It doesn't even deserve to be called a movie!

reviews.review_title: Tell me they do it on purpose..
reviews.content: I went to see Manos as part of an 'Incredibly Strange Film Festival' my local theatre put on, even (well, okay, 'especially') after visiting this website. I love bad movies, but I didn't know they got this awful! The film was full of oversights (how many times did Torgo 'die' before running off into the night with his sleeve on fire?), bad dubbing, worse lines, and much time-wasting to cover up the fact that nothing happened. The audience were laughing themselves silly at the stupidity of it all - even the soundtrack was funny! (not only due to the record being restarted every time it finished....) After the (admittedly BAD) ending, the audience stayed through the credits and applauded, with the biggest cheer saved for Torgo. You must see this film. "It's shocking!"

reviews.review_title: Not all bad. Just mostly bad.
reviews.content:
Yeah, the acting is pretty bad, the plot is never really explained, and the camera work sucks, but everyone here seems to forget that those things alone don't make the movie the #1 worse of all time. The fact is, this movie is almost bearable to watch, which is more than I can say for other movies. Manos is really more pathetic than bad.Reasons:Plot: Ok, it sucks. A lot. But look at the bright side. At least it has a beginning, middle, and end. Once again, I have seen movies which do not.Acting: Again, it is bad. But at least you can make fun of some of the acting, laugh at it. The rest is just pathetic.Action: All the "action" scenes in this movie, of which there are very few, are pretty lame. Moving on.Humor: The only thing funny in this movie is Torgo, though he is not meant to be.Music: Heh, well, let's just say it is really, really bad.All of these things are reasons to rate Manos as being a very bad movie, but the worst movie ever? Hardly. Here is how I would rate Manos:
Here is my scale for bad moviesLevel 1:   Standard bad movie . Level 2:   A movie so bad it is funny. Level 3:   A movie so bad it has stopped being funny. Level 4:   A movie so bad it is even worse than 3. Disturbingly bad. So bad every copy of the movie deserves to be burned.I rate Manos, Hands of Fate as a Level 2.8, one of the worse ratings I have ever given a movie, but not the worst.

I also saw manos at the strange film festival, bloody fantastic movie, pure class. I loved when torgo lost his hand and ran away with a flaming stump, we couldnt stop laughing. I loved how the "director", writer and "actor" too often used the 32 sec max shot time to its fullest extent when not needed, so the "actors" just stood there and looked blankly at each other(actually sounds like the entire movie). Also liked the subtile way the director overused the chick fight scenes for his own pleasure(shudder). The massage death therapy was pure class as well, I really wish I had taken a video camera to the showing so I could watch manos at my leisure when drunk with guests.

Hey, haven't broken into the film industry yet?  No problem!  ANYone can be a filmmaker! Including Hal P. Warren, a manure salesman (insert manure/Manos joke here)!Don't have a real camera?  No problem!  By using a smaller version of those Hollywood "big shots," you can shoot scenes 30 seconds at a time and then DISSOLVE into the same scene in editing!  Thanks to Crow T. Robot for pointing that one out.
This film is so, so awful it makes me hate Thomas Edison for inventing moving pictures.  If you MUST see it, please be sure to get the MST3K version as even their spoof BARELY makes "Manos" watchable.  Trust me, it makes "Plan 9" look like "Citizen Kane."

reviews.review_title: One of the worst films EVER . . avoid this movie.
reviews.content: This is one of the WORST films ever.   The direction and script are terrible; during the opening scene, the camera shows a view from a moving car and immediately dissolves into the SAME shot!   There isn't much of a story to talk about, so just do the smart thing and avoid this movie.

I was actually sorta horrified.  I frankly didn't understand what was going on, and the mid-movie girls in underwear fight that happened without preamble or explanation just blew me away.  Upon seeing the mst3k I understood that this movie must have been made with the forethought that one day a man and his robots would ridicule it.

reviews.review_title: About worth a sack of fertilizer.
reviews.content: I saw Manos on MST3K,and couldn't have made without Joel and the gang. Hal Warren must be ken to Ed Wood. Turgo ,the housekeeper with knees the size of watermelons,greets a family who is heading to Valley Loge ,and drives them crazy.What a way to end a vacation.

Surely it is easier to make a mediocre movie than it is to make a bad movie. Hollywood effortlessly cranks out the same pedestrian two-star drivel year after year. But to make a truly bad movie, a movie that sinks below the schlock and makes a name for itself in the annals of badness, takes a special kind of effort.A mad kind of deluded genius can give you PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE; inexplicable mass ineptitude can yield HUDSON HAWK; a sick mind seeking to stretch the limits of depravity can come up with FREDDY GOT FINGERED.But nothing can explain MANOS, THE HANDS OF FATE. This is a new level of bad, an unapproachable, incomprehensible kind of bad. So bad, so very very bad, that it flies off the low end of the continuum and emerges... where???Note that the most popular user rating for this movie is 1, and the second most popular vote is 10. Why? Because this movie exists outside the known universe, in a place where 1 and 10 occupy the same space. Charles Foster Kane reaches out into the void, and there he finds... Torgo.Imagine cinema's finest moment, its absolute high point: perhaps the anguished face of Maria Falconetti in THE PASSION OF JOAN OF ARC; or the fog-enshrouded final moments of CASABLANCA; or THE GODFATHER'S operatic tableau of baptism and bloodshed; or LAWRENCE OF ARABIA emerging from the sun-distorted haze of the Sun's Anvil...Now go one step further, one step beyond the edge of abyss, where the very fabric of celluloid is infinitely distorted and space folds back upon itself...Step through, and you will emerge in MANOS, THE HANDS OF FATE.

This film is unbelievably bad.  Those 133 votes for "10" are pushing this film out of its deserved position, right at the top of the 100 worst movies list.I'm going to the MST3K website now, to buy my own copy, so that I can inflict it upon my friends and family...

Well, everyone who says "Plan 9 From Outer Space" is the worst movie ever made has obviously never seen THIS piece of garbage.  Plot summary: family composed of dense, gun-toting Dad; vapid, fretful Mom; and whiny, high-pitched kid end up in some Tex-Mex House of Horrors populated by a group of Devil worshippers led by a Frank Zappa wannabe, a group of women from some psychotic slumber party, and a henchman who looks suspiciously like Charlie Sheen after an all-night bender.  Hijinks ensue.The only way to derive any enjoyment of this movie is to watch the Mystery Science Theater 3000 version.  The acting is torpid at its high points, the plot so lame it needs crutches just to limp, and the cinematography looks like it was done by an indifferent 10-year-old with a major head injury. Where does MST3K FIND this crap?  HOW does it ever get made?  What group of Hollywood execs looked at this and said, "Yeah, run with it!"?This movie is so bad it's painful.  The constant, snappy banter of Joel, Crow, and Tom Servo make it hilarious.

Although this is possibly the worst movie i have ever seen, i have not laughed at any movie so much as i did in this! The crapyness and cheese and all over bad everything just left me in stitches for the whole session. I actualy had the privelage of seeing this film on a big screen, at the Wellington Incredibly Strange Film Festival 99.

One thing struck me, looking through the comments - those who know this movie only through the Mystery Science Theatre 3000 version usually hate it.
Contrast this with the comments of my fellow New Zealanders, who actually saw this film in a cinema at last year's Incredibly Strange Film Festival - most of us had a good laugh. For proper appreciation, this film needs a rowdy theatre audience. A few beers beforehand probably helps, too.
According to IMDb, the guy who played Torgo killed himself after this movie was made. Can't say I blame him.

This was one of the few MST3k's that i found myself saying "oh my God - I've SEEN this movie!!!". I first saw this movie on a "Creature Feature" sumthin'-or-other-movie-thingy when i was around 15 years old...pre-cable days (at least in my neighborhood). Good thing i was young and resiliant (and slightly dimmer...). Anyhoo, this movie is scrumdilly-iciously horrible. I can't believe Joel Hodgeson had a hard time convincing Best Brains to play whack-a-mole with this stinker. If you do attempt to watch Manos sans Joel and the 'bots, prepare for it as you would any serious operation -  don't eat for 24 hours prior, expect the worst and pray for the best, and be prepared for a long, slow recovery....

reviews.review_title: It was the second best of films, it was the second worst of films...
reviews.content: The boys of MST3K had their second greatest episode with MANOS (only MITCHELL, with master thespian Joe Don Baker, tops it).  While the film was awful on every conceivable level, at least it was better than SHOWGIRLS.

reviews.review_title: Like being stuck in a nightmare
reviews.content: This was like being stuck in a nightmare. The movie NEVER ENDS!!! And the knees.. the knees!!!! Without MST3K, I think I would have exploded. As it was, I was barely holding on. I'd rather watch mud dry. It's at least not going to turn my brain into goo.

Manos: The Hands of Fate, a totally amateurish attempt at making a horror movie. I'll start by listing off a few things that make this movie garbage: The 35mm camera used in filming does not record sound. But ingeniously Hal Warren found a way around that, he, another man and their wives dubbed over the voices of every character. Often times there will two characters speaking to each other and have the same voice. So it's just one person talking! The dubbing doesn't even match the actors' lip/mouth movements at times.The movie is full of sometimes ten minute periods of nothing happening. NOTHING. A perfect example of this is when the movie opens you will have to watch a nine minute driving sequence before the opening credits role.There are many times when the movie is focusing on a couple making out in their car. In fact they are necking for the entire course of the movie, as you will see when the movie flashes back to them pointlessly time and time again.The story is very bland, but the ending is unpredictable and astonishing, I'll leave that to be discovered and won't spoil it for you.Now I want to talk about Torgo. Torgo believe it or not, has a large following. He's such a lovable character too! With his "goat legs", which were accomplished by having actor John Reynolds wear over-sized pants and walk strangely. But I truly believe that John Reynolds had potential as an actor, as bad as the movie was, I loved Torgo and his actor.I believe everybody should see this movie, on the purpose to see how bad a movie can truly get, and I definitely recommend the Myster Science Theater 3000 version.

This movie doesn't really make any sense...not a single bit. I guess maybe they were going for an artsy type thing with all the silence and stuff but it didn't work very well. The best thing that came from this movie is obviously the Mystery Science Theater 3000 episode. Now that was a good movie/episode. Also, I'm sure people have already noticed this but Manos is the Spanish word for hands. So.....Hands: Hands of Fate? Wow. I can understand doing that if maybe it were a part of a "Manos" trilogy or something and this particular part was called hands of fate but come on. That's like saying Shawshank: The Shawshank Redemption.

Oh gosh I cant even start... But only that this is probably one of the worst movies I have ever seen and hopefully i wont watch anything else in the future that makes this movie look at least 3 percent better. Lol

reviews.review_title: Manos - Worst film of our time
reviews.content: This film is only watchable in the Mystery Science Theatre 3000 DVD featuring this film. Otherwise it should be categorized as a torture device to those with good taste.The MST3K (Mystery Science Theater 3K) episode showing this film is truly MST3K at it's best.Even though the director has not received any noteworthy recognition in his lifetime, the family should be told that this movie is the benchmark for all that is wrong in Independent Films.When I saw this movie without the MST3K comments I became very bored and watching anything but this would be welcome. Even watching Joe Versus the Volcano in HIndu would be more interesting.If you do not decide to make this movie the worst film of all time either you don't know how bad of a movie this is or you have watched Who's Harry Crumb and are upset it wasn't nominated for an Oscar.Face it. This movie is in violation of good taste and the movie making process in it's entirety.If you don't think so, please watch it again.

reviews.review_title: MST 3k is the savior of this movie.
reviews.content: This movie makes people want to commit suicide. So watch it on MST 3k, so that you'll have a reason for living. Beware: if you watch a good movie (i.e. Casablanca, Platoon, etc.) after seeing this movie, the shock of the change in movie quality might give you brain damage. Also, don't you just love the umpteen minute view of farm scenery? I know I don't. This movie should be called Manos: Hands of TOTAL CRAP!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: You want to know how bad this movie is? Simply put...
reviews.content: You want to know how bad this movie is?I can sit through a bad movie, especially if Joel and the 'bot's are lambasting it.  I've never had a problem with any other movie, especially when given the MST3k treatment.Simply put, this movie is _t_h_e___o_n_l_y_ movie that I've watched the MST3k version of and have never been able to watch it in one sitting...  And there has to be at least 20 or 30 minutes of footage with fairly nice women wrestling in bra's, panties, etc. !!!!!!! ZOUNDS!!!!  It's so bad I can't do take it in one sitting...  I have thought I've seen _really_ bad movies before, but this one leaves them all in the dust.

What can I say about "Manos" that hasn't already been said? Before viewing, any potentially lethal guns, knives, or blunt object should be removed from your home, as viewing this film will make you want to repeatedly harm yourself.Some ask what it is like. I usually find the best way to describe it is to imagine that Satan himself decided to make a movie and subject earthly evil-doers to watch. You will surely pray to God to cleanse your filthy soul after watching.It can be entertaining, however, use caution. The first time I watched, I laughed and watched in awe at its total wretchedness. The second time, I was forced to take a large dose of tranquilizers and go to bed for the evening.

reviews.review_title: only good when aired on MST3K
reviews.content: If I had seen this movie anywhere else but MST3K, I would have run away screaming. If I had rented this movie for free I would have tried to get a refund. But even on MST3K, it was hard to watch. It was the only movie where there were so many gaps in action that the robots started getting bored. You know a movie is bad when you see a car driving past a corn field and they show how long it takes to drive through Iowa in real time. I drove through Iowa once, it seemed shorter than the time it took to watch this movie. The fact that one of the main actors killed himself soon after this movie was made, tells you how bad he feels about what he did to the American Public.

I feel like the director found this movie locked up in a dusty attic, never to be seen by the general public. Its cursed in every way and I feel like I've invoked an ancient curse just by watching it.

reviews.review_title: Well deserving of #1 worst movie of all time.
reviews.content: I saw this movie when MST3K was making fun of it and I just could not imagine watching this without Joule, Crow, and Tom making their remarks. If you were to watch a blank screen you will see better acting, directing, and writing. I feel sorry for anyone who had any involvement in any way with this movie, for they are forever shamed.

At least Plan 9 and all of Ed Wood's other movies have a cult following, much like Godzilla.  Manos has no redeeming value, other than the lovable Torgo.  Plus, this movie is a very good example of cheese.  Sure, it wasn't intentionally cheese, but nobody makes movies worthy of that title anymore. I want to see someone make a horrible movie, that is so bad that people just keep coming back because they can't believe how bad it is.  A movie that allows the legend of MST3K to live on in all of our hearts.

Manos: The Hands of Fate is the equivalent of Rosanne coming to your home and raping your ears with a machete.The production value was a 'shoe-string' budget, but by no means does that make or break a movie--nor does it become an excuse when the whole thing blows up in your face. It was filmed in the 60's by a guy who sold--what was it?--fertilizer, and it shows in his acting, editing, and scriptwriting, because the whole thing is a big stinking pile of dookie.What is unintentionally funny in the movie is overshadowed by long, drawn-out moments where nothing happens. It takes many attempts to watch this atrocity all the way through. If you manage to sit through it, you feel emotionally and physically drained. Just trust me and go watch something worth it, like The Departed or To Kill a Mockingbird. This cult favorite is liked for all the wrong reasons.Like Quentin Tarentino said: It's his favorite comedy.

Very simply and very easily the worst film ever, anywhere , of all time. many people said that it isn't all that bad for the price and to you I say "Clerks"(was made for less than 10,000 more and thats not even including inflation, look it up) This movie was the worst and it had nothing to do with money(don't try to hide behind that) But why does that have to be such a bad thing.  So its the worst film ever, I think that is a reason to celebrate not to be ashamed.  Hal Warren the man who made the worst film ever, salute to you. Someone had to do it.

Manos is a tedious example of endless driving scenes, stupid people, and random scenes cohering to no one particular plot line. It is important during movies of this caliber to remember to take your caffeine enemas, otherwise you may not make it to is glorious and final conclusion - that is, being able to celebrate the fact that it has ended.However if you want a chance to engage in uproarious commentary during the film to make it pass by just a little quicker than an eternity a second, I recommend locating and watching MST3K's Manos: The Hands of Fate - that is, Mystery Science Theatre 3000 - while enjoying the running commentary of inane witticisms that a man and two robots engage in while they watch this otherwise deplorable feature film.Good luck!

reviews.review_title: Watch with friends for true enjoyment
reviews.content: Very slow. Recommend watching it with a friend group or a date that likes bad movies. I found it extremely difficult to enjoy this disaster alone. 1 star for holding up to being one of the worst mainstream movies of all time.

MST3K version or the Original one this movie bites so hard it left a bruise. I do recommend you watch it though but with the knowledge that is sucks beyond compare.
